description: ['Unsere Manufacturing Division ist ein Team von engagierten, energiegeladenen Personen, die sich dazu verpflichtet haben, weltweit der vertrauenswürdigste Anbieter von Arzneimitteln und Gesundheitsprodukten zu sein. Unsere Einrichtungen, zusammen mit unseren externen Auftragnehmern, Lieferanten und Partnern, umfassen ein voneinander abhängiges globales Fertigungsnetzwerk, das sich zu einer konformen, zuverlässigen Versorgung von Kunden und Patienten pünktlich und jederzeit auf der ganzen Welt verpflichtet hat.', 'Für unsere neue Produktionsstätte in Krems suchen wir Automatisierungsingenieure (m/w) mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Automatisierung von Produktionsanlagen in der Chemischen Industrie oder der Pharmaindustrie. Sie haben die Gelegenheit, Teil eines sich neu formierenden Teams zu werden. In den nächsten 4 – 5 Jahren installieren wir an diesem Standort eine moderne “State-of-the-Art” Produktionsanlage zur Herstellung von Vakzinen und Impfstoffen für die Tiergesundheit.', 'Automatisierungsingenieur (m/w)', 'Vollzeit, ab sofort', 'Zu Ihrem Aufgaben- und Verantwortungsbereich in dieser Position zählen:', 'Erarbeitung von Automatisierungslösungen für den Produktionsstandort basierend auf den Anforderungen der Anlagenbetreiber (Produktion) in Zusammenarbeit mit den jeweiligen Liefer- und Planungsfirmen und in Übereinstimmung mit den Unternehmensrichtlinien', 'Leitung von Projektteams für die Erstellung und Implementierung von Automatisierungslösungen am Standort', 'Mitarbeit bei der Erstellung von User Requirements in Kooperation mit den Anlagenbetreibern', 'Mitwirkung bei der Planung und Ausführung der neuen automatisierungstechnischen Einrichtungen (Prozessleitsystem PCS7, sowie Simatic S7 und WinCC-Systeme) für die Produktionsanlagen, gemeinsam mit den ausführenden Unternehmen', 'Teilnahme an Planungsworkshops und Review von Ausführungsdokumenten', 'Abnahme und Überprüfung der Automatisierungsanlagen im Herstellerwerk (FAT) und in der Betriebsstätte (SAT)', 'Mitarbeit bei der Inbetriebnahme und Startup der Produktionsanlagen', 'Mitwirkung bei der Qualifizierung und Validierung der Automatisierungstechnik für die Produktionsanlagen im GMP-Umfeld', 'Schulung der Anlagennutzer sowie Unterstützung bei Betrieb und Wartung automatisierungstechnischer Einrichtungen sowie Unterhalt der übergeordneten Automatisierungsebenen', 'Qualifications', 'Für diese Tätigkeit bringen Sie folgende Voraussetzungen mit:', 'Abgeschlossenes Studium der Fachrichtung Automatisierungs- oder Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbarer Fachrichtungen (abgeschlossene HTL, FH oder Universität)', 'Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in Projektierung, Programmierung und Inbetriebsetzung von Prozessleitsystemen (vorzugsweise Simatic PCS7), idealerweise in der chemischen oder pharmazeutischen', 'Industrie', 'Gute Kenntnisse im Bereich von SPS und SCADA-Systemen (vorzugsweise Simatic S7 TIA-Portal)', 'Gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Sensorik und Aktorik sowie Antriebstechnik', 'Idealerweise IT-Kenntnisse im Bereich der Virtualisierung und Netzwerktechnik', 'Berufserfahrung im pharmazeutischen und GMP-Umfeld von Vorteil', 'Flexibilität, Lernbereitschaft und Bereitschaft zu Rufbereitschaft', 'Gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse', 'Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift', 'Wir bieten Ihnen:', 'Spannendes und herausforderndes Arbeitsfeld mit modernen „State- of-the-Art“ Technologien in einer neuen, wachsenden Organisation', 'Abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem international agierenden Unternehmen', 'Gute Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten', 'Mitarbeit in einem professionellen, ambitionierten und hoch motivierten Team und einer wertschätzenden positiven Arbeitsumgebung', 'Das Mindestgehalt beträgt Euro 38.814,44 brutto/Jahr, die Bereitschaft zu Überzahlung abhängig von Qualifikationsprofil und Berufserfahrung ist gegeben.', 'Sie sind kompetent, belastbar, zuverlässig, initiativ und wollen unseren Standort in dieser intensiven Start-Up Phase der Entwicklung einer großen Produktionsstätte aktiv unterstützen? description: ['Mit seinen verschreibungspflichtigen Arzneimitteln, Impfstoffen, Biologika, Präparaten zur Selbstmedikation und für die Tiergesundheit in verschiedenen Therapiebereichen bietet MSD in mehr als 140 Ländern umfassende und innovative Lösungen für Gesundheit. Ein besonderes Anliegen von MSD ist darüber hinaus die Verbesserung der weltweiten Gesundheitsversorgung und der verbesserte Zugang zu Medikamenten. Dafür engagiert sich MSD in weitreichenden Gesundheitsprogrammen und Partnerschaften. Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir für unseren Produktionsstandort in 1210 Wien eine/n:', 'Facility Manager (m/w)', 'Aufgabenbereich', 'Verantwortung über das Facility Management am gesamten Standort inklusive Medienversorgung, elektrische Energieversorgung und Infrastruktur-Dienstleistungen', 'Planung, Koordination und Kontrolle von Instandhaltung und Reparaturen', 'Aktives managen der Wartungsstillstandsplanung sowie Stör- und Ausfallszenarien', 'Enge Zusammenarbeit und Führung des internen Facility Teams und Abstimmung mit der EHS Schnittstelle', 'Sicherstellung von internen Sicherheits- und Umweltstandards sowie gesetzliche Vorschriften', 'Identifizieren der Optimierungspotentiale in Bezug auf Versorgungssicherheit, Energieeinsparung und Kosteneinsparung und deren Umsetzung forcieren', 'Qualifications', 'Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung (Werkmeister, HTL) im Bereich Elektrotechnik, HKLS oder Maschinenbau und einschlägige Berufserfahrung (bevorzugt in einem GMP-Umfeld)', 'Mind. 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Facility Management', 'Hohe Eigenverantwortung und Teamplayer, zeitliche Flexibilität im Störungsfall bzw. bei Wartungsstillständen', 'Management- und Führungskompetenz, um Mitarbeiter mit hoher Fachqualifikation zu führen und idealerweise Führungserfahrung in einem Servicebereich', 'Ausgeprägtes Kosten-, Qualitäts- und Servicebewusstsein', 'Englisch und Projektmanagement', 'Es erwartet Sie ein angenehmes Arbeitsklima sowie ein hochinteressantes Aufgabengebiet. Wir bieten Ihnen eine verantwortungsvolle und langfristige Spezialisten-Position mit attraktiven Rahmenbedingungen und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten innerhalb des Unternehmens.  Für diese Position ist ein Jahresbruttogehalt von mindestens EUR  50,200.00,- vorgesehen. Je nach Erfahrung und Qualifikation ist eine Überbezahlung jedenfalls möglich. Bei Interesse freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung.', 'Personalberatungsvertreter, bitte sorgfältig lesen: MSD akzeptiert keine unaufgeforderte Unterstützung von Personalberatungen für diese Beschäftigungsmöglichkeit. Bitte keine Anrufe oder E-Mails. Alle Lebensläufe, die von Personalberatungen per E-Mail, im Internet oder in irgendeiner Form und/oder Methode an einen Mitarbeiter von MSD gesendet werden, ohne dass eine gültige schriftliche Vermittlungsvereinbarung für diese Position besteht, gelten als alleiniges Eigentum von MSD. Für den Fall, dass der Bewerber von MSD aufgrund der Verweisung oder auf andere Weise eingestellt wird, wird keine Gebühr gezahlt.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Do you enjoy working in an international environment with lots of room for personal development? Did you always want to work in a company where your work can have a real impact on people’s life? Would you like to change and drive things?', 'We have an exciting opportunity within our', 'Quality Systems & Compliance department', 'QUALITY OFFICER', 'You are enthusiastic about getting more insight in processes and performances of different production facilities. As Quality Officer you enjoy advising and coaching other people in a positive manner to get to higher GMP compliance level.', 'You are responsible for managing and executing external GMP audits at our suppliers. Next to that, you will also be executing internal audits at our own site, and you will be acting as a quality expert contributing to improvement of all other Quality Systems at our site.', 'As an external auditor you are knowledgeable and consistent. You are emphatic, integer, trustworthy, flexible and loyal.', 'With your deep understanding of (quality) processes and all relevant guidelines you are acting as an expert for colleagues with less experience within their own discipline.', 'Responsibilities', 'You contribute proactively to improvement initiatives in complex QMS environment.', 'One or multiple (more complex) Quality Systems will be assigned to you, for which you will be the responsible person.', 'You develop, improve and maintain the assigned Quality System(s) on system level.', 'Create an integral and thorough insight in the quality and compliance status of the site.', 'Ensure implementation of the Quality Strategy and you advise by giving direction to the departments and you ensure compliance in line with Global Policies.', 'Welcome in our team', 'The department Quality Systems & Compliance is responsible for driving and coordinating the quality policy of our production location in Boxmeer. The department is owner of the most important quality systems such as change control, deviation management, documentation, internal audits. Therefore, the department is responsible for maintenance and improvement of these systems and gives the necessary support to all users at the site.', 'What we offer', 'We welcome you to a truly global, dynamic and challenging environment with great opportunities for personal development. Our benefits are very competitive', 'Competitive salary', '35,5 days of leave', 'Attractive collective health care insurance package with considerable reduction rates', 'Solid Pension Plan', 'Bonus plan subject to the company annual results', 'Flexible working arrangements', 'Qualifications', 'Your profile', 'Bachelor’s or Master’s degree', 'At least 5-year experience in a comparable function within Quality (Systems)', 'Extensive knowledge of Good Manufacturing Practice and other compliance requirements with the ability to interpret and apply in both routine and exceptional situations', 'Extensive project management skills', 'Strong oral and written communication skills in English and Dutch', 'About us', 'MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD un des leaders mondiaux de l’industrie pharmaceutique, est présent avec un portefeuille diversifié et innovant sur les marchés de produits de prescription, vaccins et produits de santé animale. Aujourd’hui, nous construisons un nouveau modèle d’Entreprise pharmaceutique – une Entreprise engagée dans la création d’un futur améliorant la santé de tous.', 'Notre capacité à exceller est liée à l’intégrité, la connaissance, l’imagination, la compétence, la diversité et le travail d’équipe que vous pouvez démontrer. Autour de nos valeurs, nous visons à créer un environnement de respect mutuel, d’encouragement et de travail d’équipe. Intégré à notre équipe mondiale, vous aurez l’opportunité de collaborer avec des collègues talentueux et engagés tout en ayant l’opportunité de développer et de diversifier votre carrière.', 'Pour notre siège basé à Courbevoie (92), nous recherchons un Analyste Prévisions de Ventes.', 'Fonctions et responsabilités', 'Sous la supervision du Responsable des Prévisions de Ventes et pour les produits dont il/elle est responsable :', '• Développer les prévisions de ventes en coordination avec les équipes de Marketing et Market Research', "• Développer des analyses de l'environnement, marchés, concurrents, afin de produire des prévisions réalistes", "• Apporter son support à l'équipe FP&A; pour le développement des prévisions financières", '• Apporter son support aux équipes production pour le développement des prévisions de production', 'Activités principales:', '• Analyser et fournir des explications des résultats des ventes sur le marché pour les produits de la filiale et ses concurrents avec les équipes de Marketing et Market Research.', '• Préparer des analyses (y compris impact génériques, produits en lancement, etc.), revoir les analyses avec le business et challenger les hypothèses à prendre en compte.', '• Fournir aux équipes finance France et aux usines, des prévisions de ventes de manière régulière par forme et par canal de distribution', '• Développer les outils nécessaires afin de suivre la performance et faire des prévisions justes pour les produits MSD et ses concurrents', "• Faire le suivi des informations de l'environnement, le marché pharmaceutique et les concurrents", '• Développer et maintenir une base de benchmark pour étoffer les analyses.', '• Documenter convenablement les hypothèses prises lors du développement des prévisions.', "• Faire des analyses approfondies en collaboration avec d'autres groupes.", "• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe FP&A;, GHH et Production", 'Qualifications', 'Formation Bac +5, type Ecole de Commerce', '• Expertise des techniques et des outils de prévision de ventes', '• Proactivité, autonomie, capacité à collaborer avec tout type de personne', '• Très bonne capacité relationnelle', "• Capacité à gérer l'incertitude et les situations ambiguës", '• Bonne communication orale et écrite', '• Anglais parlé et écrit', '• Forte capacité à respecter les échéances et délais dans des situations complexes', "• Très bonne capacité d'analyse", '• Souplesse et capacités organisationnelles', "• Très bonne connaissance d'Excel, Powerpoint et aisance informatique", 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'Position Overview', 'The Brand Lead Diversified Brands is part of the CEE Marketing Portfolio Team and part of the European Marketing organization. The role of the Marketing Portfolio Team is to provide marketing support to the four country organizations aligned with the Global Marketing strategies and the local needs. This position reports to the Chief Marketing Officer of the CEE Cluster. It is located in Warsaw, given that Poland is CEE’s largest business for diversified brands (mature post LoE brands', 'covering respiratory, cardio, dermatology, womens health and other therapeutic areas).', 'Diversified brands (DVB) vision is to maximize DVB value through a 3-pillar strategy:', 'LCM plans that can maximize the long-term retention of sales through differentiation', 'Maximization of low cost digital promotional options and strategic commercial partnerships via external commercial platforms (Pharma, Wholesaler, Pharmacy) and', 'Portfolio optimization via systematic and disciplined execution of pricing, Registrations of existing products, Operational efficiencies (i.e., on-going SKU rationalization).', 'The Brand Lead is responsible for identifying the above brand opportunities, set portfolio priorities, and develop business plans within the cluster consistent with global and local strategies and brand/franchise priorities.', 'He/she designs, develops and implements marketing programs focused mainly on low cost digital solutions. He/she monitors execution with excellence with key focus on the Polish market.', 'Major Activities', 'The Brand Lead Diversified Brands for CEE is accountable for creating cluster brand plans & providing the markets with customized branded marketing programs focused on digital promotional solutions.', 'The Brand Lead will lead the brand planning process which includes forecasting, expense planning, pricing and limited promotion resource allocation. With Poland being the critical market for the business she/he is expected to spend at least 70% of focus on executing the optimal plan for the specific market and align strategy with all critical stakeholders of the Polish organization (Commercial team, Multichannel Marketing team, Managing Director)', 'The Brand Lead will identify and support markets’ specific priorities by developing, leading and influencing the execution of a franchise plan that allocates the right effort to the right therapeutic area, making the appropriate choices depending on growth opportunities.', 'The Brand Lead Diversified Brands will also support all efforts linked to business development projects that may include external partnerships to leverage opportunities regarding promotion or commercial channel partnerships.', 'He/she will collaborate closely in the day-to-day work with cluster Medical Affairs, Alliance manager,', 'MCM, Market Research colleagues and European RCL (Regional Commercial Lead).', 'He/She will ensure continuous reporting back to countries and cluster leadership on selected KPIs and will be responsible of sharing best practices across the region.', 'Qualifications', 'Required:', 'Education & Experience', 'Minimum: University degree (master or equivalent) from accredited university', 'Minimum: >4 years experience in Marketing', 'Previous experience with managing assigned brands, multiple brands and/or mature or generic brands/portfolios', 'Fluent in Polish and English (written and spoken)', 'Leadership behaviors:', 'Demonstrate ethics and integrity', 'Drive results', 'Focus on customers and patients', 'Make rapid disciplined decisions', 'Act with courage and candor', 'Build talent', 'Foster collaboration', 'Professional Competencies', 'Business & Financial acumen', 'Working across boundaries', 'Strategic thinking', 'Project Management', 'Productive Communication', 'Problem Solving', 'Core Commercial Competencies:', 'Customer and marketing insights', 'Customer engagement', 'Strategic Business management', 'Market access', 'Product knowledge and portfolio management', 'Regulatory and compliance knowledge', 'Functional Commercial competencies:', 'Strategic marketing (advanced)', 'Brand management (advanced)', 'New product planning (applying/advanced)', 'Inventory and supply chain knowledge (applying)', 'Communications management (advanced)', 'Desired', 'Experience in multiple geographies', 'Experience in one or more of the countries in the cluster', 'Understanding of cultures and healthcare systems in CE', 'Expertise in anticipating and predicting future brand and market environment changes', 'Experience in marketing and / or selling generics', 'Experience with Commercial trade channels', 'Knowledge of business development.', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD BIOTECH DUBLIN', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of biotech in Ireland', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do. We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD BIOTECH, DUBLIN', 'The latest addition to the MSD Ireland family is MSD Biotech, Dublin. The site will play a pivotal role in the manufacture of MSD’s biologics-based medicines, including in the area of immuno-oncology, and will expand MSD’s current internal network of biologics drug substance manufacturing plants when full manufacturing operations begin in 2021.', 'MSD Biotech Dublin, will be MSD’s first ever Large-Scale Mammalian-Based Drug Substance Facility, with the mission and ambition to manufacture breakthrough medicines from Ireland for patients around the world.', 'This facility will be a significant supplier of drug substances for one of MSD’s key treatments and will also be critical in the future supply of new biotechnology products to its global network.', 'THE ROLE', 'Reporting to the site manufacturing and technology head and based at the MSD Biotech Dublin site, the Upstream Process Engineering leader responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:', 'Provide oversight of the design, construction and qualification of the new cell culture installation at MSD Biotech Dublin through to technology transfer and commercialization. Support establishment of the commercial process and routine manufacturing by:', 'o Serving as a cell culture commercial manufacturing process subject matter expert, providing technical oversight to teams, and coaching to associate staff. Provide technical leadership for:', '\uf0a7 Experimental design, execution, data analysis and interpretation.', '\uf0a7 Interpretation of trends observed in commercial process monitoring (e.g., proactive process analysis (PPA), continued process verification (CPV), statistical process control (SPC) multivariate analyses (MVDA)), and for further technical investigations and process changes that seek to drive improvements to yield and/or robustness.', '\uf0a7 Deviation management.', '\uf0a7 Change control prioritization and implementation.', 'o Authoring and reviewing of batch documentation, technical reports and global regulatory submissions.', 'o Leading multidisciplinary teams (manufacturing science and technology, quality, analytics, regulatory) for process improvement and troubleshooting with end-to-end product focus.', 'o Assuring effective application of LeanSixSigma and Change Management tools by:', '\uf0a7 Securing continuity of an appropriate LSS/CEM level of knowledge.', '\uf0a7 Leading by example in achieving results by using high performing organization (HPO) tools and processes', '\uf0a7 Facilitating problem solving & risk assessment (FMEA) projects/meeting.', '\uf0a7 Making problems visible and strive for continuous improvement.', 'o Serving as a key member during internal audits and external inspections/audits', 'o Supporting alignment and knowledge exchange with other commercial nodes and external manufacturing partners.', 'o Supporting authoring and maintenance of the site master validation plan.', 'Manage and coach a staff of 4-6 engineers.', 'Lead and support various manufacturing science and technology organizational initiatives as needed (examples include safety, financial forecasting, work standardization, etc).', 'Represent the organization and company MSD in external collaborations (BPOG, NIIMBL, etc) and present technical and strategic outcomes at scientific and professional conferences and forums.', 'Keep up to date with scientific and technical developments.', 'Support creation of the departmental budget and surveil actual performance against the forecast.', 'Maintain continuous focus on quality and safety compliance and unflinching focus on the customer.', 'Qualifications', 'QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE - KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS', 'General', 'This role requires an experienced individual description: ['Functieomschrijving', ':', 'Als Maintenance Technician ben je verantwoordelijk voor het voorkomen en oplossen van technische problemen op diverse vakgebieden: mechanisch, elektrotechnisch en industriële automatisering. Je verhelpt en analyseert technische (ver)storingen, bewaakt richtlijnen en procedures en komt met verbetervoorstellen om de betrouwbaarheid aan onze equipment te verhogen. Je plant uitvoerende werkzaamheden en bespreekt deze indien nodig met de Werkvoorbereider, Maintenance Engineer en / of Technicians. Je onderhoudt zelfstandig de contacten met contactpersonen van externe partijen, coördineert en begeleidt hun werkzaamheden. Je houdt je bezig met modificaties en adviseert en ondersteunt bij de uitvoering van onderhouds- en investeringsprojecten. Je geeft advies over technische aspecten en levert input bij het opstellen van wijzigingen, voorschriften, werkinstructies, documentatie en onderhoudsplannen.', 'Je komt te werken in een met zorg uitgewerkte dienstrooster dat bestaat uit dagdienst, vroeg/laat-dienst, weekend- en consignatiedienst.', 'Je rapporteert aan de', 'M&R; Lead LIVE', '.', 'Qualifications', 'Benodigde kwalificaties & ervaring:', '·', 'Relevante afgeronde technische opleiding op MBO-niveau, bij voorkeur electrotechniek, mechatronica of besturingstechniek', '·', 'Nen3140-certificering, of bereid deze te halen', '·', 'Ervaring als Maintenance Technician in de farmaceutische of food industrie is een pré', '·', 'In bezit van een VCA-certificaat, of bereid deze te halen', '·', 'Beschikt over goede analytische en organisatorische vaardigheden', '·', 'Voortdurende focus op de identificatie en de realisatie van verbeterpotentieel', '·', 'Goede communicatieve eigenschappen', '·', 'Continue aandacht op het gebied van kwaliteit, veiligheid en compliance', '·', 'Is een resultaatgerichte teamspeler', '·', 'Goede mondelinge en schriftelijke vaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels', 'MSD Inventing for Life', 'Wil jij werken als technician, operator of manager operations? Solliciteer dan', 'hier', '.', "MSD Animal Health ontwikkelt en produceert vaccins en farmaceutische specialiteiten voor landbouwhuisdieren, gezelschapsdieren en vis. We hebben kantoren in meer dan 50 landen, verkopen onze producten in meer dan 140 markten en opereren een netwerk van productielocaties en R&D; faciliteiten in de hele wereld. Binnen MSD Animal Health zijn we altijd op zoek naar innovatieve talenten die zich richten op voortdurende verbetering van onze producten en de manier waarop we werken. We zijn op zoek naar nieuwe collega's die ondernemend en resultaatgericht zijn. Niet alleen de resultaat telt; de manier waarop je deze resultaat behaalt is van cruciaal belang om succesvol te zijn binnen MSD Animal Health. MSD Animal Health loopt voorop in diergeneesmiddelen.", 'Onze medewerkers zijn de sleutel tot het succes van ons bedrijf. We tonen onze toewijding aan onze medewerkers door onder andere het aanbieden van een concurrerend arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket. Onze voorwaarden bieden ondersteuning aan de verschillende doelen, behoeften en levensstijlen van onze medewerkers én degene die hen het meest dierbaar zijn.', 'MSD als werkgever', 'Keer op keer nieuwe uitdagingen aangaan, dat is wel iets wat je leuk moet vinden als je bij MSD aan de slag wilt. Want continu verbeteren is een van onze drijfveren. Dat geldt zowel voor werkprocessen als voor medewerkers. Gedrevenheid, teamwork en eigen initiatief zijn van groot belang. Bij MSD kun je je op allerlei manieren ontwikkelen. In de diepte, door je te specialiseren in je vak. Maar ook door jezelf te verbreden en door te groeien naar een leidinggevende functie. Internationaal of juist heel lokaal, er zijn talloze andere mogelijkheden om stappen te zetten in je loopbaan, te rouleren in functies of te groeien in je functie. Werken bij MSD is werken in een dynamische high tech omgeving van internationale allure, die toch sterk lokaal geworteld is in Boxmeer, Oss, Haarlem en de Bilt.', 'Informatie', 'Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met Peter van Dooren, Maintenance & Reliability Lead M&R; LIVE: 06-11916472. Heb je vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure, neem dan contact op met onze recruiter Ragna Post op 06-18846194.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'No', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Bij MSD in Haarlem zijn we voor het Center of Excellence (CoE) Quality op zoek naar een', 'Pharmaceutical Specialist', 'Over de functie', 'Als Pharmaceutical Specialist draag je zorg voor de initiëring en uitvoering van kwaliteitsverbeteringen, het adviseren over farmaceutisch technische issues en over kwaliteit- en compliance gerelateerde issues, alsook het implementeren van oplossingen. De Pharmaceutical Specialist rapporteert aan de Associate Director QA Systems.', 'Welkom in ons team', 'De Center of Excellence Quality is verantwoordelijk voor het sturen en coördineren van het kwaliteitsbeleid van de site Haarlem, in overeenstemming met bestaande wet- en regelgeving. Hiertoe onderhouden de verschillende afdelingen contacten met alle Integrated Process Teams (IPT’s) en Centers of Excellence (CoE’s) van de locatie  Haarlem en tevens met andere sites wereldwijd en het hoofdkantoor in de VS.', 'Primaire verantwoelijkheden', '• Evalueren van de gevolgen van externe richtlijnen; initiëren en ontwikkelen van policies en procedures; goedkeuren van (incidentele) afwijkingen van goedgekeurde policies en procedures;', '• Optreden als Subject Matter Expert tijdens GMP inspecties en klanten audits;', '• Als lead auditor uitvoeren van audits, zowel intern als extern. De daaruit volgende acties uitzetten en borgen dat deze adequaat en tijdig uitgevoerd worden;', '• Opstellen en reviewen van Quality Agreements met affiliates en contractors;', '• Namens QA deelnemen aan diverse complexe of high impact projecten;', '• Initiëren, formuleren en uitvoeren van voorstellen voor kwaliteitsverbeteringen;', '• Zorgdragen dat Operationele interne CoE Quality activiteiten in compliance zijn met regelgeving en voldoen aan vastgestelde lead times.(o.a. PQ’s voor lab activiteiten);', '• Controleren en autoriseren van GMP documenten, zoals kwalificatie/validatie documentatie, deviatie rapporten en change control documentatie;', '• Kwaliteit borgen binnen het change control traject;', '• Naast het management van het Deviation Platform, ook het leiden en rapporteren van onderzoeken van complexe kwaliteitsafwijkingen leiden en rapporteren. De complexiteit kan bestaan uit zowel inhoudelijke als multidisciplinaire factoren;', '• Samenwerking met de Pharmaceutical Specialists van de IPTs en de CoE TechOps;', '• Bijdragen aan een groeiend kwaliteitsbewustzijn binnen de bedrijfsomgeving;', '• Uitdragen van het kwaliteitssysteem en daarbij vertegenwoordiger voor Quality zijn binnen verschillende systemen.', 'Qualifications', 'Jouw profiel', '• WO farmaceutische, proces technische, of chemische achtergrond, aangevuld met minimaal 4 jaar relevante werkervaring binnen kwaliteits- of productie- omgeving;', '• Kennis van en ervaring met farmaceutisch-technische aspecten, GMP, registratie van geneesmiddelen, validatiestudies en verpakkingstechnologie is een eis;', '• Overtuigingskracht en resultaatgericht;', '• Nauwkeurig, flexibel en zelfstandig;', '• In staat om medewerkers aan te sturen zonder formele hiërarchie;', '• Goede communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel woord als geschrift , in Nederlands en Engels.', 'Wij bieden', 'Werken bij MSD betekent samen werken aan gezondheid in een internationale werkomgeving met  toegewijde collega’s. Je krijgt alle ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en te laten zien wie jij bent. Verder kan je rekenen op aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden:', '• Een competitief salaris;', '• 35,5 vakantiedagen;', '• 8% vakantietoeslag en 3% eindejaarsuitkering;', '• MSD Incentive Plan;', '• Een uitstekend pensioen;', '• In-house sportfaciliteiten', '• Reiskostenvergoeding;', '• Verschillende trainingsmodules.', 'Meer informatie', 'Voor nadere informatie omtrent deze functie kun je contact opnemen met Jeroen Slooter, (Assoc. Director, Quality Assurance) op telefoonnummer 06 – 22 801 687', 'Solliciteren', 'Ben jij de kandidaat waar wij naar op zoek zijn? We ontmoeten je graag! Stuur ons jouw sollicitatie vandaag nog toe. Dit doe je door op onderstaande button te klikken.', 'Over MSD', 'MSD is een wereldleider op het gebied van geneesmiddelen en werkt mee aan een gezonde wereld. Met onze vaccins, biologische therapieën en geneesmiddelen bieden we innovatieve behandelingen voor een betere gezondheid van mensen en dieren in meer dan 140 landen. We richten ons op aandoeningen die mensen ernstig belemmeren in hun functioneren of zelfs levensbedreigend zijn en die vragen om nieuwe geneesmiddelen. MSD is tevens pionier in biologische research & development voor diergezondheid.', 'Bij MSD geloven we in de kracht van verschillen van teams van getalenteerde medewerkers op alle niveaus. Uiteenlopende vaardigheden, ervaringen, achtergronden en culturele perspectieven helpen ons om beter inzicht te krijgen in de behoeften van diverse klanten, zorgverleners en patiënten. Bij MSD in Nederland werken ongeveer 4500 medewerkers op drie verschillende locaties.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 10 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Description', 'Did you always want to work in a company where your work can have a real impact on people’s life? Do you enjoy working in an international environment with lots of room for personnel development? Are you ready to join a company where we cherish Diversity and Inclusion and the wellbeing of our employees?', 'Are you enthusiastic about getting more insight in processes and performances of different production facilities and do you enjoy advising and coaching other people in a positive manner to get to higher GMP compliance level?', 'We have the exciting opportunity to hire a', 'Quality officer', 'for our Quality Systems & Compliance department at MSD Animal Health in Boxmeer.', 'The department', 'The department Quality Systems & Compliance is responsible for driving and coordinating the quality policy of our production location in Boxmeer. The department is owner of the most important quality systems such as change control, deviation management, documentation, internal audits. Therefore, the department is responsible for maintenance and improvement of these systems and gives the necessary support to all users at the site.', 'The position', 'The person we are looking for will be primarily responsible for managing and executing external GMP audits at our suppliers. You will also be executing internal audits at our own site. As an external auditor you are knowledgeable, consistent and you should have a good command of the English language. Next to that you are emphatic, integer, trustworthy, flexible and loyal.', 'Next to auditing, you will be involved in other responsibilities within department and you will be asked to coach other team member on relevant GMP topics or project management.', 'The System and Compliance officer P2 Level is a more senior member of the Systems and Compliance team.', 'With your deep understanding of (quality) processes and all relevant guidelines you are acting as an expert for colleagues with less experience within their own discipline.', 'You contribute proactively to improvement initiatives in complex QMS environment.', 'One or multiple (more complex) Quality Systems will be assigned to you, for which you will be the responsible person.', 'You develop, improve and maintain the assigned Quality System(s) on system level.', 'Create an integral and thorough insight in the quality and compliance status of the site.', 'Ensure implementation of the Quality Strategy and you advise by giving direction to the departments and you ensure compliance in line with Global Policies.', 'Qualifications', 'Desired skills & experience', 'Higher education degree, Bachelor’s or Master’s degree', 'At least 5-year experience in a comparable function within Quality (Systems)', 'Extensive knowledge of Good Manufacturing Practice and other compliance requirements with the ability to interpret and apply in both routine and exceptional situations', 'Extensive project management skills', 'Strong oral and written communication skills in English and Dutch', 'I', 'nformation', 'For information about this vacancy please contact Annelies van Hal, Quality Systems and Compliance Lead, by phone +31 485 585465  or +31 6 114 563 15.', 'Application', 'If you are interested in this challenging role, you are invited to apply online by uploading your resume and application letter in English.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.', 'Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.', 'Join us in the digital health revolution and tackle biggest opportunities and challenges at the intersection of healthcare, information and technology. Become a member of our IT Global Innovation Center in the heart of Prague with innovative atmosphere and flat, friendly and collaborative environment. Create awesome digital products and enjoy a reward that technology careers don’t often bring: the satisfaction of helping to save lives.', 'You will join Integration team that is responsible for development of MSD’s global integration backbone, focusing on analytical, reporting and business intelligence projects. The team focuses both on the delivery of projects and also on exploration of new capabilities and adoption of the latest technology.', 'We are looking for enthusiastic IT professional who will', 'Lead the technical team of IT professionals using agile or waterfall approach to deliver our core product', 'Find opportunities, improvements and innovations how to extend the product bearing in mind the business value for our customers', 'Understand the business needs and define the roadmap', 'Lead the design and architecture of IT solutions to cover the business needs', 'Build expertise in analytical, reporting and BI areas and processes', 'Ensure that the proposed solution is aligned with MSD architecture guidelines and principles', 'Be the decision maker on top of the technical team', 'Promote the product to customers and explain the value', 'Improve the processes around related to delivery, change management, release management, SDLC', 'Work with multiple stakeholders and managing expectations to meet customer needs', 'Qualifications', 'Required experience', '2+ years of experience in managing delivery of projects in the role like technical lead', 'Understand well project standards', 'Strong passion to deliver solutions', 'Experience with vendor management', 'Vision and Leadership', 'Product road-mapping, backlog and lifecycle', 'Negotiation skills', 'Advantage is also', 'Experience with emerging IT technologies (Big Data, Data Science, Data Warehousing, Integration)', 'Experience in Regulated Environment, project documentation standards', 'Delivery of projects in regulated environments', 'Demonstrated ability to work with a diverse group of professionals globally', 'Besides a great atmosphere and flexible working environment, we also offer:', 'Competitive description: ['The Warehouse Assistant will be responsible in performing day-to-day warehouse related tasks such as receiving, sampling, staging, storing, issuing, shipping, cycle counting, pack-out operation, transportation and documents processing related to materials movements.', 'Key Responsibilities', '•', 'Receive incoming materials. Verify incoming materials against the delivery note/document. Stage materials received neatly and transfer to storage locations. Route documents for the materials received to the appropriate departments for further processing. Record and report any variance versus the delivery note/document.', '•', 'Assemble and stage materials per production pick list and issue the materials to the appropriate plants. Accurately document all transactions. Input transaction data into the business computer systems and file the documents accordingly.', '•', 'Perform pack-out activities and observe the cleanliness requirements in the pack-out work area. Perform sanitation and cleaning of pack-out rooms and isolators.', '•', 'Assemble and stage materials per the shipment packing list and hand-over the goods to designate freight forwarding agent. Accurately complete shipping document in accordance with shipping instructions. Input transaction data into the business computer systems and file the documents accordingly.', '•', 'Handle all materials in accordance to safety, health and environmental procedures with special attention to the handling of hazardous chemicals and store materials in accordance to its controlled storage requirements.', '•', 'Operate pallet truck, stacker, forklift and other material handling equipments, as appropriate.', '•', 'Conduct inventory counts as required and record the variances in accordance to operating procedures.', 'Qualifications', '•', 'Demonstrated experience in Warehouse Management', '•', 'GCE ‘O’ level or equivalent', '•', 'Need to have a valid Forklift Driving License', '•', 'Experience and knowledge in materials handling, operating of materials handling equipment, basic safety knowledge.', '•', 'Good understanding of procedure/ document system used for materials movements.', '•', 'Strong verbal and written communication skills', '•', 'Good knowledge of basic mathematics operation', 'How to Apply?', 'Interested candidates can submit their application online through MSD Career site. If you need further information, you can email Ma. Isabel Petallar at maria.isabel.m.petallar@merck.com', 'What we offer at MSD?', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. description: ['BIOTECH DUBLIN', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of healthcare in Ireland', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do. We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD BIOTECH, DUBLIN', 'The latest addition to the MSD Ireland family is MSD Biotech, Dublin. The site will play a pivotal role in the manufacture of MSD’s biologics-based medicines, including in the area of immuno-oncology, and will expand MSD’s current internal network of biologics drug substance manufacturing plants when full manufacturing operations begin in 2021.', 'MSD Biotech Dublin, will be MSD’s first ever Large-Scale Mammalian-Based Drug Substance Facility, with the mission and ambition to manufacture breakthrough medicines from Ireland for patients around the world.', 'This facility will be a significant supplier of drug substances for one of MSD’s key treatments and will also be critical in the future supply of new biotechnology products to its global network.', '& SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES', 'The Utilities Engineer will be responsible for supporting the start up of MSD Biotech Dublin and will initially be involved in Commissioning Support and Turnover activities. They will be accountable for Operational Readiness tasks which will include operations and maintenance programs, development of service contracts. They will have responsible for key fire detection and protection, steam, cooling and waste processing assets. They will developing the Operating Procedures and Relaibility program for these assets. When in Operations they will work with the Utilites Planner they will manage service provider activity to ensure that Biotech Dublin is a safe site and our critical assets are reliable. Our goal is to develop a digital operating site, the engineer will analysis operating data for trends, manage performance and continuous improvement activites for assigned systems.', 'POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES', '• Development, review and approval of technical information including Safety Risk Assessments, Work Plans, Commissioning documents and CMMS data.', '• Establish Equipment Criticality and apply appropriate reliability and asset management strategy based on criticality', '• Ensure compliance to all Safety, regulatory GMP and Environmental requirements.', '• Working with technicians and other functions to develop Prescriptive, Predictive and Preventative maintenance program to ensure designated site equipment operate safe and reliable. Optimise work tasks, ensure spare parts, tools or other services are available when required.', '• Investigate equipment failures or deviations to find root cause and implement effective Corrective and Preventative Actions.', '• Provide technical training to colleagues.', '• Develop and manage KPI’s - ie People, Safety, Quality, Delivery and Cost performance.', '• Support Engineering Excellence Initiatives – participate in local and corporate programs.', '• Pursues and use new technologies and methodologies.', '• Own the initiation, management and closure of change initiatives.', 'REPORTING STRUCTURE', 'Will report to Associate Director, Critical Utilities', 'Qualifications', 'QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE - KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS', 'General', '• 4 + years Experience in a utilities role, preferable in a biologics / pharma site with responsibility for activities relating to Fire Protection & Detection, Steam, Cooling Systems, Waste Processing.', 'Technical', '• Knowledgeable of mechanical, electrical, control and automation systems maintenance requirements.', '• Experience of writing Operating Procedures.', '• Experience of continuous improvement and maintenance optimisation techniques.', '• Some experience of data analytics, reviewing of trends and development and management of alerts.', '• Working knowledge of SAP or another Maintenance Management System.', '• Knowledge and Expereince of Utilites Safety requirements, Statutory Inspections and Contractor Management', 'People', '• Excellent organising, planning skills, and communication skills.', '• Proven success working in a team environment with flexibility to react to changing business needs.', '• High level of attention to detail and strong problem-solving abilities.', '• Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a cross functional collaborative environment.', 'Education', '• A Level 8 qualification in an engineering discipline with evidence of continuous professional development.', 'So, if you are ready to:', 'INVENT solutions to meet unmet healthcare needs', 'IMPACT the future by joining MSD, one of the world’s leading healthcare companies', 'INSPIRE your team to reach their full potential and push the boundaries of science and technology', '*Engineering', '*hjbiotech', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 10 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD BIOTECH, DUBLIN', 'The latest addition to the MSD Ireland family is MSD Biotech, Dublin. The site will play a pivotal role in the manufacture of MSD’s biologics-based medicines, including in the area of immuno-oncology, and will expand MSD’s current internal network of biologics drug substance manufacturing plants when full manufacturing operations begin in 2021.', 'MSD Biotech Dublin, will be MSD’s first ever Large-Scale Mammalian-Based Drug Substance Facility, with the mission and ambition to manufacture breakthrough medicines from Ireland for patients around the world.', 'This facility will be a significant supplier of drug substances for one of MSD’s key treatments and will also be critical in the future supply of new biotechnology products to its global network.', '& SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES', 'The Upstream Manufacturing Shift Manager will provide front-line leadership to a team within the Integrated Process Team (IPT) in our Biologics operation to manufacture quality biologic products in accordance with our Manufacturing Division Priorities of: Compliance, Supply, Strategy and Profit Plan.', 'The Upstream Manufacturing Shift Manager is responsible for the management of the team through the active implementation of the Tier process. description: ['BIOTECH DUBLIN', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of healthcare in Ireland', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do. We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD BIOTECH, DUBLIN', 'The latest addition to the MSD Ireland family is MSD Biotech, Dublin. The site will play a pivotal role in the manufacture of MSD’s biologics-based medicines, including in the area of immuno-oncology, and will expand MSD’s current internal network of biologics drug substance manufacturing plants when full manufacturing operations begin in 2021.', 'MSD Biotech Dublin, will be MSD’s first ever Large-Scale Mammalian-Based Drug Substance Facility, with the mission and ambition to manufacture breakthrough medicines from Ireland for patients around the world.', 'This facility will be a significant supplier of drug substances for one of MSD’s key treatments and will also be critical in the future supply of new biotechnology products to its global network.', '& SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES', 'The Senior Critical Utilites Engineer / SME will be responsible for supporting the start up of MSD Biotech Dublin and will be involved in Final Equipment Design, Installation, Commissioning Support and Qualification activities. They will be accountable for Operational Readiness tasks.The primary focus of the position is on GMP/clean utilities and operations (WFI, Clean Steam, HVAC and Process Gasses). They will act as Subject Matter Expert for assigned equipment and play a key role to ensure that the site is Safe and Compliant.', 'POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES', '• Development, review and approval of technical information including design documents, Hazops, Safety Risk Assessments, Work Plans, Commissioning documents and CMMS data.', '• Establish Equipment Criticality and apply appropriate reliability and asset management strategy based on criticality.', '• Ensure compliance to all Safety, regulatory GMP and Environmental requirements.', '• Working with technicians and other functions to develop Prescriptive, Predictive and Preventative maintenance program to ensure designated site equipment operate safe and reliable. Optimise work tasks, ensure spare parts, tools or other services are available when required.', '• Investigate equipment failures or deviations to find root cause and implement effective Corrective and Preventative Actions.', '• Coach, mentor and provide technical training to colleagues.', '• Develop and manage People, Safety, Quality, Delivery and Cost KPI’s', '• Support Engineering Excellence Initiatives – participate in local and corporate programs.', '• Own the initiation, management and closure of change initiatives.', '• Support regulatory audits on clean utility systems.', '• Be responsible for adherence to site and corporate QMS for clean Utility Systems and Point of contact for Quality Alerts and Bulletins for Utility Systems. Review and prepare formal responses. Complete periodic reviews and other compliance documentation aligned with the site QMS.', '• Conduct life cycle analysis of all critical system equipment to ensure equipment is upgraded and replaced in accordance with the Site Master Plan.', '• Lead technical cross-functional teams and work across engineering areas to deliver robust and sustainable solutions and business processes.', '• Drive functional commitments on initiatives and provide high level of oversight and coordination to seamlessly integrate utility engineering efforts within the site.', '• Pursues and use new technologies and methodologies, consult with other subject matter experts and site on procedures and to ensure design solutions achieve long term business objectives and are supported by robust technical rationale.', 'REPORTING STRUCTURE', 'Will report to Associate Director Critical Utilities', 'Qualifications', 'QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE - KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS', 'General', '• 7+ years Engineering Utilities experience in a Biologics Manufacturing Site, with some experience of start up and qualification of new systems.', 'Technical', '• Experience of Operations and Maintenance of Clean Utilities Systems ie Water, HVAC, Process Gasses.', '• In-depth knowledge of regulatory requirements ability to provide solutions that reflect understanding of business objectives and cost implications.', '• Knowledgeable of mechanical, electrical, control and automation systems maintenance requirements.', '• Knowledge and experience of commissioning and validation of HVAC and Clean Utilities systems', '• A compliance mindset for EH&S; and Quality standards, regulations and practices.', '• Experience of continuous improvement and optimisation techniques.', 'People', '• Excellent organising, planning skills, and communication skills.', '• Proven success working in a team environment with flexibility to react to changing business needs.', '• High level of attention to detail and strong problem-solving abilities.', '• Stakeholder management of multi decision makers, colleagues, peers and cross functional teams.', '• Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a cross functional collaborative environment.', 'Education', '• A Level 8 qualification in an engineering discipline with evidence of continuous professional development.', 'So, if you are ready to:', 'INVENT solutions to meet unmet healthcare needs', 'IMPACT the future by joining MSD, one of the world’s leading healthcare companies', 'INSPIRE your team to reach their full potential and push the boundaries of science and technology', '*HJBiotech', '*Engineering', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 10 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['•', 'Grow your career with a global health care leader', '•', 'Multiple opportunities due to increased product demand', '•', 'Rotating shift roster with generous shift allowance', 'MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare', 'The Opportunity', 'We supply world class vaccines to over 60 different countries and we need the best people to do that. People who are excited about what they can achieve today, but even more excited about what they can achieve tomorrow.', 'As a Production Technician, you will be working on the factory floor manufacturing large antigens or vaccines in accordance with standard operating procedures. You will document your activity in batch records or log books and you will perform quality checks to ensure production meets stringent cGMP requirements.', 'About MSD', 'Our research division is a team of dedicated, energetic individuals who are committed to being the most trusted supplier of pharmaceuticals and health products worldwide. Our facilities, along with our external contractors, suppliers, and partners, comprise an interdependent global manufacturing network that’s committed to delivering a compliant, reliable supply to customers and patients on time, every time, across the globe.', 'You will be supported by a great team of people who take pride in what they do and get satisfaction in producing a high – quality product. We have a fun, collaborative team and we’re 100% dedicated to health and safety and looking out for each other.', 'Qualifications', 'About You', 'Your strong mechanical aptitude and sound problem-solving skills will ensure things run smoothly -as you won’t just identify the problem, you will be part of finding and implementing the solution. In addition to this, you will have high attention to detail -whether it be cleaning or completing documentation – your output will always be of the highest standard.', 'If you’re tertiary qualified in science, engineering or similar as well as approachable, tech savvy and team-focused, you’ll be a success here. After all, it’s our shared knowledge and experience alongside fresh ideas that will ensure our future success, and yours.', 'Our roles operate on a rostered shift pattern, so you can plan ahead for your days off. If you are looking for a unique large scale biopharmaceutical manufacturing opportunity in New Zealand, we have multiple positions permanent positions available.', 'How to Apply?', 'Interested candidates can submit their application online through MSD Career site. If you need further information, you can email April Lim to april.lim@merck.com.', 'What we offer at MSD?', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['In support of, and supported by, the GDO TA Lead, the GDO Program Lead (GDO PL) oversees the successful execution of the clinical data management strategy for one or more drug, biologic or vaccine programs/indications. Accountable for ensuring GDO deliverables are available for all clinical trial milestones for in-scope trials. Ensures all aspects of the GDO specific sections of the project plan (from protocol planning through data management submission components) are executed on time and with the highest quality. Coordinates and aligns deliverables of Lead Clinical Data Managers (LCDMs) working at the trial level within assigned programs/indications. Acts as the single point of contact for GDO at the program/indication level, including representing GDO on cross-functional program teams as needed, as well as other program-level development forums. Mentors, guides, and provides project leadership for junior staff, as assigned. Line Manager of GDO staff.', 'Primary Activities include, but are not limited to:', '1.\tOversees the data management strategy and project plans within GDO for collection and integration of all clinical data (including, but not limited to, case report form (CRF) data, lab data, biomarker data, and patient reported outcomes, etc.) for one or more programs/indications.', '2.\tIn collaboration with PDMS PM, partners with functional area representatives to ensure appropriate use of database standards and program-level consistency on database, data collection, review, and retrieval specifications.', '3.\tMonitors the Book of Business (BoB) and program-specific clinical development plan(s) (both continually and timely) to initiate GDO resourcing and activities.', '4.\tProvides program-related oversight and guidance to LCDMs and ensures quality and consistency of GDO requirements and deliverables, through archival, across trials within a program/indication.', '5.\tUses excellent interpersonal, negotiating, and project management skills to perform the following tasks:', '•\tProject plan review/input, execution, and change control related to GDO responsible sections', '•\tProject team development and resource planning within GDO', '•\tRisk management (i.e., risk identification, analysis, and response planning, as well as risk monitoring and control), including engagement with GDO TA leads, PDMS PMs and functional leadership for issue resolution and escalation as necessary', '•\tCommunications planning, information distribution, performance reporting, and project closure within GDO teams', '•\tManagement of customer/stakeholder expectations; participation in cross-functional decisions', '6.\tKeeps abreast of industry information and changes related to Pharma DM through interaction with experts both within and outside of MSD.', '7.\tIdentifies and develops improvements to data collection and data management processes and tools.', '8.\tSupports audits and inspections within program/indication, as necessary.', '9.\tMay lead continuous improvement special projects, or any other data management task deemed appropriate by management.', '10.\tMay serve as LCDM for one or more trials within assigned programs, if needed.', 'Qualifications', 'Education:', 'B.A. or B.S. degree, preferably in life sciences, computer science, or related discipline.', 'Experience:', '•\tAt least 5 years’ experience in Clinical Trials', '•\tAt least 2 years’ experience in People Management or equivalent demonstrated leadership', 'Knowledge and Skills:', '•\tKnowledge of the E2E clinical development process', '•\tDemonstrated leadership and project management skills', '•\tStrong organizational, communication, negotiating and problem-solving skills', '•\tAbility to establish personal relationships across a wide range of business contacts', '•\tAbility to build talent and lead teams with influencing and development skills.', '•\tAble to work under pressure in a changing environment with flexibility.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Bij MSD in Haarlem zijn we voor het Center of Excellence (CoE) Quality op zoek naar een', 'Pharmaceutical Specialist', 'Over de functie', 'Als Pharmaceutical Specialist draag je zorg voor de initiëring en uitvoering van kwaliteitsverbeteringen, het adviseren over farmaceutisch technische issues en over kwaliteit- en compliance gerelateerde issues, alsook het implementeren van oplossingen. De Pharmaceutical Specialist rapporteert aan de Associate Director QA Systems.', 'Welkom in ons team', 'De Center of Excellence Quality is verantwoordelijk voor het sturen en coördineren van het kwaliteitsbeleid van de site Haarlem, in overeenstemming met bestaande wet- en regelgeving. Hiertoe onderhouden de verschillende afdelingen contacten met alle Integrated Process Teams (IPT’s) en Centers of Excellence (CoE’s) van de locatie  Haarlem en tevens met andere sites wereldwijd en het hoofdkantoor in de VS.', 'Primaire verantwoordelijkheden', '• Evalueren van de gevolgen van externe richtlijnen; initiëren en ontwikkelen van policies en procedures; goedkeuren van (incidentele) afwijkingen van goedgekeurde policies en procedures;', '• Optreden als Subject Matter Expert tijdens GMP inspecties en klanten audits;', '• Als lead auditor uitvoeren van audits, zowel intern als extern. De daaruit volgende acties uitzetten en borgen dat deze adequaat en tijdig uitgevoerd worden;', '• Opstellen en reviewen van Quality Agreements met affiliates en contractors;', '• Namens QA deelnemen aan diverse complexe of high impact projecten;', '• Initiëren, formuleren en uitvoeren van voorstellen voor kwaliteitsverbeteringen;', '• Zorgdragen dat Operationele interne CoE Quality activiteiten in compliance zijn met regelgeving en voldoen aan vastgestelde lead times.(o.a. PQ’s voor lab activiteiten);', '• Controleren en autoriseren van GMP documenten, zoals kwalificatie/validatie documentatie, deviatie rapporten en change control documentatie;', '• Kwaliteit borgen binnen het change control traject;', '• Naast het management van het Deviation Platform, ook het leiden en rapporteren van onderzoeken van complexe kwaliteitsafwijkingen leiden en rapporteren. De complexiteit kan bestaan uit zowel inhoudelijke als multidisciplinaire factoren;', '• Samenwerking met de Pharmaceutical Specialists van de IPTs en de CoE TechOps;', '• Bijdragen aan een groeiend kwaliteitsbewustzijn binnen de bedrijfsomgeving;', '• Uitdragen van het kwaliteitssysteem en daarbij vertegenwoordiger voor Quality zijn binnen verschillende systemen.', 'Qualifications', 'Jouw profiel', '• WO farmaceutische, proces technische, of chemische achtergrond, aangevuld met minimaal 4 jaar relevante werkervaring binnen kwaliteits- of productie- omgeving;', '• Kennis van en ervaring met farmaceutisch-technische aspecten, GMP, registratie van geneesmiddelen, validatiestudies en verpakkingstechnologie is een eis;', '• Overtuigingskracht en resultaatgericht;', '• Nauwkeurig, flexibel en zelfstandig;', '• In staat om medewerkers aan te sturen zonder formele hiërarchie;', '• Goede communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel woord als geschrift , in Nederlands en Engels.', 'Wij bieden', 'Werken bij MSD betekent samen werken aan gezondheid in een internationale werkomgeving met  toegewijde collega’s. Je krijgt alle ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en te laten zien wie jij bent. Verder kan je rekenen op aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden:', '• Een competitief salaris;', '• 35,5 vakantiedagen;', '• 8% vakantietoeslag en 3% eindejaarsuitkering;', '• MSD Incentive Plan;', '• Een uitstekend pensioen;', '• In-house sportfaciliteiten', '• Reiskostenvergoeding;', '• Verschillende trainingsmodules.', 'Meer informatie', 'Voor nadere informatie omtrent deze functie kun je contact opnemen met Jeroen Slooter, (Assoc. Director, Quality Assurance) op telefoonnummer 06 – 22 801 687', 'Solliciteren', 'Ben jij de kandidaat waar wij naar op zoek zijn? We ontmoeten je graag! Stuur ons jouw sollicitatie vandaag nog toe. Dit doe je door op onderstaande button te klikken.', 'Over MSD', 'MSD is een wereldleider op het gebied van geneesmiddelen en werkt mee aan een gezonde wereld. Met onze vaccins, biologische therapieën en geneesmiddelen bieden we innovatieve behandelingen voor een betere gezondheid van mensen en dieren in meer dan 140 landen. We richten ons op aandoeningen die mensen ernstig belemmeren in hun functioneren of zelfs levensbedreigend zijn en die vragen om nieuwe geneesmiddelen. MSD is tevens pionier in biologische research & development voor diergezondheid.', 'Bij MSD geloven we in de kracht van verschillen van teams van getalenteerde medewerkers op alle niveaus. Uiteenlopende vaardigheden, ervaringen, achtergronden en culturele perspectieven helpen ons om beter inzicht te krijgen in de behoeften van diverse klanten, zorgverleners en patiënten. Bij MSD in Nederland werken ongeveer 4500 medewerkers op drie verschillende locaties.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 10 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', "MSD’s Global Human Health (GHH) Division abides by a “patient first, profits later” ideology. Results-driven and ambitious, this team of individuals represents a functional balance between meeting company objectives and the needs of people around the world. The division is comprised of sales and marketing professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing MSD's prescription medicines, vaccines, and other medical products to our customers worldwide.", 'Position Overview', 'Brand & Customer Manager leads their therapeutic area and are able to engage all internal and external stakeholders with their passion and vision. Inspire their coworkers in order to propose best possible solutions and achieve best possible results. Key responsibilities include:', 'Collect customer insights and run market analysis for a clear understanding of the market landscape, customers and competitors', 'Lead cross functional teams in respective therapeutic areas', 'Develop and execute brand strategy based on inputs from all parts of organization as well as market insights', 'Create tactical plans and customer solutions (including digital marketing) based on agreed strategy', 'Calibrate KPIs and delivering upon them', 'Forecasting accurately', 'Monitor sales performance and track expenses according to budget', 'Deliver brand communication assets and key solutions towards all critical customers and stakeholders exploiting all critical f:f and digital channels', 'Support access to our products in the market by developing MSD solutions in close collaboration with Market Access, Trade Channel, KAMs or any other relevant teams', 'Major Activities', 'Strategy alignment', 'Gives strategic input based on the local environment and customer to the cluster team on customer strategy, brand strategy, key account strategy, MCM/Blended rep strategy', 'Develops a high understanding of the customers and stakeholders related to the brand: collects and collates customers’ needs, understands competitive environment and existing influence networks. Analyzes local market trends and identifies commercial opportunities for our brands', 'Adapts and aligns the regional brand plan to local needs delivering an country brand strategy and tactical plan, based on MCBM principles, in collaboration with the cross-functional team. Defines all activities and customer solutions needed and makes sure they are aligned with strategy. He/she monitors closely execution with all appropriate KPIs and is the one managing budget allocated to these activities.', 'Delivers and monitors forecasting for all financial cycles of the company aiming at high accuracy levels.', 'Stakeholder engagement', 'Engages and inspires different internal stakeholders around the implementation of the brand strategy: i.e. drives/coordinates internal sales cycle and team meetings and provides business input in planning of advisory boards/external customer meetings, leads brand team meetings', 'Inspires sales force to be fully engaged towards brand strategy and customer solutions implementation', 'Rolls out regionally and locally developed customer solutions via the relevant stakeholders (e.g. KAMs, sales force): development of tools and services, training, tracking, etc.', 'Acts as in-country point of contact for all above market internal marketing stakeholders', 'Works with Scientific Leaders and other stakeholders in close collaboration with Medical Affairs (e.g., advisory boards/congresses), KAM, account/customer leads', 'Innovation', 'Identifies opportunities to optimize brand growth and profitability, aligns cross functional teams on priorities and provides all key input to sales and demand forecasting while allocating expenses budget appropriately. Monitoring sales performance and tracking expenses according to budget is critical part of the role', 'Delivers brand communication assets and key solutions towards all critical external customers and stakeholders, through all possible channels deploying an integrated MCM plan on top of the sales force interaction', 'Timely adjusts brand value propositions and customer solutions based on strong customer feedback and /or brand performance results', 'Qualifications', 'Expertise Required / Core Competences', 'Education & Experience / Skills:', 'Minimum: University (economy, business or scientific) Master degree', 'Minimum: 2-5 years commercial/marketing experience, brand experience will be an asset', 'Field experience is an asset', 'English business proficient and local language', 'Entrepreneurial mindset', 'Strong business and financial understanding', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Temporary', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 25 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']
