title: QA Specialist (m/w/d)

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'MSD is home to a diverse team of scientists and researchers who are working to push the boundaries of global healthcare through research and innovation. Relentlessly curious and driven, the Pharmacovigilance team produces effective, reliable medicine through clinical trials and surveillance that uncovers new knowledge, product discovery, and leading-edge medical breakthroughs.', 'Position Overview', 'The position shall be responsible for the pharmacovigilance (PV) system for veterinary medicinal products (VMPs) and the internal standard operational processes (SOP) in this area as well as for SOP development, update, trainings and process implementation in accordance to company standards and European Union (EU) and Polish legislation.', 'The position may be accountable for the deputyship in area of Regulatory Affair .', 'It requires as such keep an up-to-dated competence and awareness in the legal and procedural requirements as set up for Marketing Authorization Holder.', 'Major Activities', 'Roles and responsibilities:', 'DPOC is responsible for overall pharmacovigilance for all VMPs for which MSD Animal Health holds Marketing Authorizations in Poland and for products used in field trials (before and after obtaining authorization) in accordance to UE and Polish regulations and in accordance to actual standards described in internal company documents (as for example Corporate Policies, Standard operating Procedures, Work Instructions, User Manuals, Local Procedures etc.).', 'Maintenance of a PV system which ensures that information about all adverse events (AEs) that are reported to any personnel of MSD Animal Health, including its representatives, temporary staff and contract employees, is collected and collated in order to be accessible in at least one point within the EEA.', 'Overseeing of the pharmacovigilance data quality and information collection process (including logistic process related to samples accompanying pharmacovigilance report).', 'Entering reports to the company pharmacovigilance database (translated to English language) and processing related data and documents in accordance to actual requirements.', 'Development/adaptation of any applicable local procedures including training of personnel, documentation of the training process and process implementation.', 'Assurance of the implementation of appropriate Pharmacovigilance related vocabulary in applicable contractual agreements (including field trials related documentation).', 'Participation in audits and controls of the PV system performed by competent authorities as well as involvement in post-audit and post-control activities.', 'The submission of PV reports (periodic safety update reports (PSURs) for the national competent authorities (NCAs) if so is requested', 'The conduct of continuous overall PV evaluation during the post-authorization period', 'Ensuring that any request from the national competent authorities (NCAs) for the provision of additional information necessary for the evaluation of the benefits and risks of a VMP is answered fully and promptly,', 'including the provision of information about the volumes of sales or prescription of the VMP concerned (in accordance to corresponding procedures).', 'Provision to the NCAs of any other information relevant to the evaluation of the benefits and risks of a VMP, including appropriate information on post-authorization studies (in accordance to corresponding procedures).', 'If nature of the tasks requires in all this areas of responsibility the position keeps close coordination and communication with Country Manager, Global Qualified Person responsible for Pharmacovigilance (QPPV) or Global PV team, Regulatory Manager of any other member of local team if assigned despite the position is responsible for independently carrying out these and other tasks.', 'The position is embedded in MSD Animal Health’s organization and therefore being subordinate in specific lines (functional and/or hierarchical).', 'The responsibilities must be carried out in accordance with this job', 'Description', 'and in compliance with all other procedures and regulations in force.', 'Qualifications', 'Expertise Required / Core Competences', 'Regulatory notification: The name and address details of the position are presented to Polish competent authorities (registration Office Chairman should receive copy of diploma and CV).', 'Accessibility: The position must ensure that his/her contact details are sent to the appropriate person(s) or department(s) (e.g. local and global RA) to be added to the local and global emergency contact lists, and to ensure that the emergency contact lists contain up-to-date information. The position of its deputy has to maintain availability either by mobile phone, office or home telephone, email or fax, within office hours.', 'Professional Competence:', 'English in excellent written and verbal command', 'Preferred diploma in veterinary medicine (possible as well zootechnician, master of pharmacy or diploma in the field of the medical or biological sciences but in such case, if person has no veterinary medicine diploma company has to assure constant access of the person to graduated veterinarian)', 'Professional experience guarantying reliable performance of the obligations related to continuous monitoring of the veterinary medicinal products safety', 'Satisfactory time and content of practice in regulatory affair or pharmacovigilance area', 'High competence to work in MS-Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook) and in IT technology in general', 'Expertise in Social Media', 'High degree of motivation and work engagement', 'High level of presentation abilities, communications and team-cooperation', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 5 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD’s Business Service Center (BSC), located across three regions (Americas, Europe, and Asia), are responsible for the timely and efficient delivery of standardized, global financial processes. The BSC – Americas in San Jose, Costa Rica will be responsible for the execution and delivery of a broad range of financial services and processes across MSD business divisions and markets for the Americas region.', "The EEM Supervisor is in charge of handling & resolving escalations received (internal and external), ensuring the internal controls are being applied, follow up with market's requirements, propose and execute process improvement projects, and work with the team in order to maintain a good performance within the department.", 'Primary responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to, the following:', '·         Achieve required accuracy on all defined KPIs and SLAs.', '·         Manage escalations received from internal & external stakeholders.', '·         Process improvement & root cause analysis to issues encountered in any of the processes.', '·         Lead and participate in projects requested by management.', '·         Perform monthly 1:1 sessions with the team members.', '·         Coordinate the workload distribution among the team.', 'Qualifications', 'Required', "·         Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance or equivalent Minimum of 1 year of experience in a finance or accounting department of a multinational company preferred", '·         Minimum of 5 years of experience in a finance or accounting department of a multinational company', '·         Minimum of 3 years of experience in leadership positions', '·         T&E; Background experience', '·         Business Level fluency (oral and written) in Spanish and English languages,', '·         Portuguese at basic or intermediate level is a plus', '·         ERP system experience and competency (SAP) is required', '·         Experience working in an organization providing services across multiple markets or geographies', '·         Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values and standards of ethics and integrity Strong communication and organization skills', '·         Advanced PC skills (MS Excel, Word, Power Point).', '·         Problem solving and analytical skills', '·         Accounting Experience', 'Preferred', '·         Pharmaceutical industry experience', '·         At least 1 year of people management / supervisor experience', 'Our employees are the key to our company’s success.  We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program.  Our Company’s benefits are designed to support the wide range of goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees, and many of the people that matter the most in their lives.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

title: Employee Expense Management Supervisor Job

description: ['Ben jij op zoek naar een uitdagende functie waarin je midden in de operatie staat als productiemedewerker, waarbij de dagelijkse processen binnen Media Productie uitvoert samen met je collega’s op de werkvloer? Ben je quality minded, sta je open om te leren en heb je een innerlijke drive om volgens vaste procedures en GMP, netjes en accuraat je werkzaamheden uit te voeren?', 'Voor onze locatie Boxmeer zijn wij op zoek naar een', 'OPERATOR MEDIA PRODUCTIE', 'Over de functie', 'Als Operator Media Productie werk je in gekwalificeerde ruitmtes aan de productie van hoogwaardige kweekmedia, buffers en agarplaten voor verschillende afdelingen van MSD in Boxmeer en de Bilt.', 'Je gaat volgens voorschrift en in overeenstemming met de planning de voorbereidende-, bereidende- en afrondende werkzaamheden ten behoeve van productie uitvoeren. Dit gaat volgens voorgeschreven protocollen en GMP regelgeving. De verschillende media die worden gemaakt, worden in verschillende formaten afgevuld. In collaboration with stakeholders and Regional procurement professionals, creates and implements 1-3-5-year strategic sourcing strategies.', 'Global Category Management: Leads Global Category Management teams to develop and implement strategic source plans for one or more categories of spend.', 'Sourcing Management - Uses the Sourcing Management Process to manage assurance of supply, quality, service, cost, innovation and regulatory compliance within Global or International category of spend, resulting in breakthrough strategies which optimize value and ensure appropriate risk management. Understands the Sourcing Management Process and how to apply required tools in the creation and implementation of source plans.', 'Proactive Cost Management: Achieves cost control, cost reduction, and cost containment targets, and adds value to area of expenditure through a strong total cost orientation.', 'Market Knowledge and Insight: Uses thorough market knowledge and data analysis to gain critical insights that drive the selection of Sourcing Strategies and continuous improvement activities.', 'Supplier Management and Conditioning: Responsible for building relationships with Global, International and Enterprise suppliers and managing supplier performance against business requirements using proven processes; ensures adequate inclusion of diversity suppliers in RFPs and contracts as applicable. Supports major Regional supplier relationships', 'Stakeholder Management and Business Sponsorship: Ensures appropriate stakeholders are identified and managed through stakeholder matrix. Engages assigned stakeholders and partners with them to define and meet or exceed business requirements and identify and manage profit plan savings targets. Understands strategic business requirements at 1-3-5 year horizon.', 'Contract Negotiation and Management: Once strategy is approved, personally leads the sourcing including RFX, RFP, negotiations and contracting for Global and International categories to put in place the right suppliers. Negotiates at tactical and strategic levels to develop local, regional, global company contracts.', 'Qualifications', 'Your profile', 'Education Minimum Requirement:', 'BS/BA', 'degree in Finance/Business/related field; MBA or advanced degree, CPM or', 'supply chain certification preferred', '5', 'to 7 years’ experience in manufacturing or purchasing arena', '3', 'to 5 years of direct experience in sourcing packaging components', '3', 'to 5 years’ experience in Project Management demonstrating the ability to', 'successfully complete large, complex and international projects', 'Demonstrated', 'strong problem solving, negotiation, and conflict management skills', 'Drive', 'results while dealing with ambiguity', 'Excellent', 'oral and written communication skills; able to influence at all levels in', 'the organization', 'Thorough', 'knowledge of MS-Office', 'Required Experience and Skills:', 'Demonstrated', 'capabilities in Sourcing & Supplier Strategies, Cost Optimization,', 'Supplier Relationship Management, Negotiation Skills, Financial/Legal', 'Aspects with Procurement, and Supplier Risk Management', 'Demonstrated', 'strong interpersonal skills, inclusion and diplomacy in all interactions -', 'particularly when interacting with people from different', 'cultures/countries and all levels of management. Must be a team player and', 'relationship builder and have the ability to interface with senior', 'management in a professional yet courageous manner', 'Demonstrated', 'experience in leading complex analysis', 'Candidate', 'must have proven skills in prioritizing and multitasking utilizing strong', 'organizational skills. Must possess strong attention to detail and follow', 'up. Ability to be consistently poised under pressure and the ability to', 'keep an objective perspective', 'Strong', 'financial and business acumen', 'Strong', 'quantitative, analytical and problem resolution skills', 'Ability', 'to lead cross-functional teams', 'Strong', 'attention to detail', 'Demonstrated', 'competence, achievements and ability to work independently in a fast paced', 'environment', 'About us', 'MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription', 'medicines, vaccines and consumer health products, as well as animal health', 'products. description: ['MSD Tiergesundheit arbeitet stets daran, die Gesundheit von Tieren auf der ganzen Welt zu verbessern. Dabei sind uns eine partnerschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und ein tiefes Verantwortungsbewusstsein gegenüber Kunden und Tieren sowie gegenüber der Gesellschaft und unserer Umwelt wichtig.', 'Mit unserem neuen Produktionsstandort in Krems an der Donau wollen wir ein Anbieter innovativer Impfstoffe und Immuntherapien für den Schutz und die Behandlung von Nutz- und Heimtieren sein. Mit dem weiteren Ausbau unserer biotechnologischen Anlagen hat sich MSD Animal Health Danube Biotech GmbH zum Ziel gesetzt, ein bedeutender Arbeitgeber in Niederösterreich zu sein, der in den verschiedensten Funktionen attraktive Karrieremöglichkeiten in einem modernen und sicheren Arbeitsumfeld bietet.', 'Für unsere neue Produktionsstätte in Krems an der Donau suchen wir Lagermitarbeiter im Pharmasektor mit mehrjähriger Arbeitserfahrung in Lager und Logistik.', 'Lagermitarbeiter (Pharma) (m/w/x)', 'Vollzeit, ab sofort', 'Zu Ihrem Aufgaben- und Verantwortungsbereich in dieser Position zählen:', 'Durchführung des Wareneingangs und Warenausgangs/Versands', 'Einlagerung von Material sowie Lagerverwaltung', 'Termingerechte Vorbereitung und Bereitstellung der Produktionsaufträge', 'Materialversorgung der Produktion', 'Aufrechterhaltung der Ordnung und Sauberkeit im Lager', 'Einhaltung aller gesetzlichen Vorgaben und SOPs (GMP, GDP, EHS, etc.)', 'Verwaltung von Verbrauchsartikeln, bestands- und nicht bestandsgeführt', 'Die zu verrichtenden Tätigkeiten werden durch den Vorgesetzten zugeteilt und überprüft.', 'Qualifications', 'Für diese Tätigkeit bringen Sie folgende Voraussetzungen mit:', 'Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Tätigkeit', 'Engagierte, lösungs- und kundenorientierte Persönlichkeit', 'Teamfähigkeit und Zuverlässigkeit', 'Sicherer Umgang mit MS-Office-Applikationen, SAP-Kenntnisse im Logistikumfeld von Vorteil', 'Erfahrung im GMP Umfeld (Pharmaproduktion) wünschenswert', 'Schichtbereitschaft', 'Staplerschein', 'Wir bieten Ihnen:', 'Einzigartige Möglichkeit zur Mitarbeit am Aufbau eines modernen „State-of-the-Art“ Produktionsbetriebes', 'Spannendes und herausforderndes Arbeitsfeld in einer neuen, wachsenden Organisation', 'Abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem international agierenden Unternehmen', 'Mitarbeit in einem professionellen, ambitionierten und hoch motivierten Team und einer wertschätzenden positiven Arbeitsumgebung', 'Gute Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten', 'Attraktive Sozialleistungen', 'Das kollektivvertragliche Mindestjahresgehalt für diese Position beträgt EUR 27.833,96 brutto.', 'Ihre Rolle bei MSD ist von wesentlicher Bedeutung, um neue Errungenschaften in der Tiergesundheit zu erzielen, die kommende Generationen positiv beeinflussen können. Hierbei setzen wir auf Ihre Fähigkeiten und Ihre Innovationskraft, um einen sinnvollen Beitrag zum globalen medizinischen Fortschritt zu leisten.', 'MSD Tiergesundheit – Die Wissenschaft für gesündere TiereTM', 'Personalberatungsvertreter, bitte sorgfältig lesen:', 'MSD akzeptiert keine unaufgeforderte Unterstützung von Personalberatungen für diese Beschäftigungsmöglichkeit. Bitte keine Anrufe oder E-Mails. Alle Lebensläufe, die von Personalberatungen per E-Mail, im Internet oder in irgendeiner Form und/oder Methode an einen Mitarbeiter von MSD gesendet werden, ohne dass eine gültige schriftliche Vermittlungsvereinbarung für diese Position besteht, gelten als alleiniges Eigentum von MSD. description: ['Responsibilities:', '•\tDevelops, coordinates, and provides biostatistical support for related drug/vaccine projects under supervision in Late Development Statistics.', '•\tInteracts with Clinical, Regulatory, Statistical Programming, Data Management and other MSD Research Laboratories Scientists in designing and analyzing clinical trials, and in coordinating the statistical activities for clinical drug/vaccine projects.', 'The incumbent may initially work in a specific disease therapeutic area.', 'Primary activities:', '•\tServes as statistical representative in the cross-functional teams for the clinical trial planning, execution, and reporting.', '•\tDevelops individual protocols and data analysis plans and determines appropriate statistical methodology for data analysis.', '•\tParticipates in database design meetings to ensure that the data evaluated are in high quality and satisfy analysis requirements.', '•\tCollaborates with the statistical programming staff to ensure that all programs meet analysis requirements, internal standard operating procedures, and external regulatory requirements.', '•\tEvaluates appropriateness of available software for planned analyses and ascertains needs for potential program development of novel statistical methodology.', '•\tAnalyzes data and interprets results from clinical trials to meet objectives of the study protocol.  Independently applies and implements basic and complex techniques to these analyses.', '•\tPrepares oral and written reports to effectively communicate results of clinical trials to the project team, management, regulatory agencies, or individual investigators.', '•\tProvides responses to queries relating to study design, analysis, and interpretation posed by the clinical monitors, regulatory agencies, and/or investigators.', '•\tIs responsible for planning and ensuring the accuracy of Statistical Review Aids submitted to regulatory agencies.', '•\tParticipates with management in discussions with corresponding scientific personnel at regulatory agencies and with investigators concerning proposed or ongoing studies.', '•\tInvolved in research activities for innovative statistical methods and applications in clinical trial development', 'Qualifications', 'Education and Minimum Requirement:', 'PhD or equivalent degree in statistics/biostatistics or related discipline, or a Master’s degree with a minimum of 3 years relevant experience.', 'Required Skills and', 'Experience:', '•\tKnowledge of statistical analysis methodologies and experimental design.', '•\tWorking knowledge of  statistical and data processing software e.g. SAS and/or R.', '•\tGood oral and written communication skills. Able to work effectively with personnel with different functional background.', '•\tDemonstrate strong interest in statistical research activities and in application of novel methods to clinical trial development.', '•\tMust also demonstrate the ability to learn, be proactive and motivated, and consistently focus on details and execution.', 'Preferred Skills and Experience:', 'An understanding of biology of disease and drug discovery and development.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Upstream/Downstream Lead Bioprocess Associate', 'MSD BIOTECH, DUBLIN', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of healthcare in Ireland', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do. We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD BIOTECH, DUBLIN', 'The latest addition to the MSD Ireland family is MSD Biotech, Dublin. The site will play a pivotal role in the manufacture of MSD’s biologics-based medicines, including in the area of immuno-oncology, and will expand MSD’s current internal network of biologics drug substance manufacturing plants when full manufacturing operations begin in 2021.', 'MSD Biotech Dublin, will be MSD’s first ever Large-Scale Mammalian-Based Drug Substance Facility, with the mission and ambition to manufacture breakthrough medicines from Ireland for patients around the world.', 'This facility will be a significant supplier of drug substances for one of MSD’s key treatments, Keytruda and will also be critical in the future supply of new biotechnology products to its global network.', 'Our MSD Biotech facility in Dublin is now seeking experienced', 'Lead Bioprocess Associates for Upstream/Downstream Commercial Large-scale Drug Substance manufacture.', 'This is a great opportunity to join during a start-up phase where you can develop that in-depth knowledge that only a start-up will afford you.', 'These roles will be initially day based to support project start up but will migrate to a permanent 24/7 shift cycle as per business requirements.', '& SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES', '• The Lead Bioprocess Associate is responsible for all procedures and processes associated with the Manufacture of Commercial Large-Scale Drug Substance at MSD Biotech, Dublin.', '• The Lead Bioprocess Associate will be responsible for the preparation, operation and monitoring of equipment, use of business systems and carrying out tasks including but not limited to the cleaning, validation, in-process testing and basic maintenance of equipment in accordance with current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMPs).', '• The Lead Bioprocess Associate will direct, coach and mentor Bioprocess Associates on an ongoing basis.', '• The Lead Bioprocess Associate will operate to the highest standards of Safety, Quality and Compliance.', 'POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES', '• Work with the manufacturing operations group, project design team, the CQV team, the Automation/CSV reps to facilitate the development and validation of the MSD, Biotech facility manufacturing facility.', '• Support Equipment Design/ HAZOP and Room programming reviews as per requirements.', '• Support Operations team to consistently deliver on specific area Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), e.g. EHS metrics, Production Plan, OEE, compliance and team training.', '• Execute commercial manufacturing processes according to established work instructions and Standard Operating Procedures.', '• Work as part of a dedicated process team where flexibility and teamwork are a key requirement', '• Generate SOPS/Electronic Batch Records for start-up.', '• Adhere to Right First-Time principals', '• Provide assistance and/or support maintenance, engineering, quality or other colleagues as requested.', '• Escalate issues as appropriate.', '• Maintain a high level of personal expertise and working knowledge of all aspects of the manufacturing process and process equipment through continuous training and development.', '• Liaise with other groups and individuals to ensure planning of tasks is effective and linked into the manufacturing process plan.', 'REPORTING STRUCTURE', 'The Lead Bioprocess Associate will report to the Manufacturing Shift Manager, Operations.', 'Qualifications', 'QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE - KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS', 'General', '• Demonstrated successes in a team environment, such as project teams, Lean Six Sigma team, etc.', '• Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving capabilities.', '• Knowledge of applying Lean Six Sigma and Lean methodologies in a workplace environment.', 'Technical', '• Experience in a highly regulated drug substance manufacturing environment is essential.', '• Start-up experience in a large scale commercial drug substance facility desirable but not essential.', '• Excellent understanding of Upstream/Downstream Processing.', 'People', '• Ability to interact with multiple stakeholders across numerous departments', '• Good people management skills are highly desirable', '• Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a cross functional collaborative environment.', '• good interpersonal skills, attentiveness and an approachable manner for interactions with inter-departmental colleagues.', '• high degree of problem solving ability and adherence to scheduled timelines.', 'Education', '• Minimum of a Level 7 qualification in a science or engineering discipline.', '• A level 6 with a minimum of 4 years’ experience in a GMP Manufacturing requirement shall be deemed equivalent.', 'Experience', '• A minimum of 6 years’ experience in a Drug Substance Manufacturing facility is essential.', 'So, if you are ready to:', 'INVENT solutions to meet unmet healthcare needs', 'IMPACT the future by joining MSD, one of the world’s leading healthcare companies', 'INSPIRE your team to reach their full potential and push the boundaries of science and technology', 'Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully:', 'MSD is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at MSD via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of MSD. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by MSD as a result of the referral or through other means.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 5 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Manufacturing Process Support Coach', 'Carlow', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of healthcare in Ireland', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do. We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD CARLOW', 'MSD in Carlow is a world-class manufacturing facility, and the company’s first stand-alone vaccine and biologics facility outside the US. Carlow employs over 350 highly skilled employees and is an important element of MSD’s network of sites, playing a pivotal role in the manufacture of our immuno-oncology treatment.', 'MSD Carlow is a state-of-the-art, 200,000 sq ft vaccines and biologics facility focused on formulating and filling vaccine and biologic products that improve and transform the lives of people across the world.', 'MSD’s sustained investment in Ireland empowers Carlow to offer its team the opportunity to continuously grow, learn, invent and thrive. We are growing our highly-skilled team and building our presence in Carlow so that we can continue to lead scientific breakthroughs in the treatment of some of the world’s most harmful diseases.', '& SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES', 'The Manufacturing Process Support Coach is:', 'Responsible for review and approval processes for the Integrated Process Team (IPT) GMP documentation including but not limited to Quality Notifications, CAPA close out records, IPT Standard Operating Procedures and Standard Work Instructions and change controls. Ensure that objectives are effectively achieved, consistent with our requirements to ensure compliance, safety and reliable supply to our customers.', 'Support manufacturing activities through oversight and management of equipment and process investigations associated with non-GMP activities and completion of quality notifications. Raise and investigate quality notifications using standard tools and methods, to resolve system issues e.g. FMEA, Fishbone diagrams, 5 why’s etc.; implement subsequent corrective action through the change management system.', 'Support Batch release through ensuring timely Quality Notification completion, Interim/summary report generation; meeting batch release requirements. Ensure all manufacturing incidents are appropriately investigated in a timely manner with adequate CAPA development to prevent recurrence.', 'Leadership activities including selection, development, coaching and day to day management of the Process Support Specialists.', 'Manage Customer and supplier complaint investigations associated with manufacturing activities ensure they are closed out to support production activities in a timely manner in conjunction with the SCM team.', 'POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES', 'You are:', 'Required to comply with our Global Policies, Procedures and Guidelines, regulatory requirements and execute current Good manufacturing Practices (cGMP) in the performance of day to day activities and all applicable job functions.', 'Collaborate with Technical and Quality Departments to ensure robust investigation of quality events. Drive continuous improvement by leading and active participation in system failure investigations and investigation reports, execution/development of change control, and contribution to Kaizen events as appropriate.', 'Partner with manufacturing shift coaches and colleagues to deliver communications, training, project work, audit/inspection duties etc.; thereby ensuring department is audit/inspection ready.', 'Drive effective writing/revising/rolling out of accurate operational procedures, training materials and maintenance procedures for various IPT systems; ensure all work is subsequently carried out in line with same.', 'Manage root cause analysis of system failures, substandard equipment performance, using standard tools and methods, to resolve machine and system issues e.g. FMEA, Fishbone diagrams, 5 why’s etc.; oversee and implement subsequent corrective action through the change management system.', 'Drive compliance with our Global Policies, Procedures and Guidelines, regulatory requirements and execute current Good manufacturing Practices (cGMP) in the performance of day to day activities and all applicable job functions', 'Work collaboratively to drive a safe and compliant culture in Carlow.', 'REPORTING STRUCTURE', 'Will report to the Associate Director Operations', '*Featured', 'Qualifications', 'QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE - KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS', 'General', 'Bachelor’s Degree or higher preferred; ideally in a Science, Engineering or other Technical discipline.', '3-5 years experience in a leadership role GMP setting with 1-2 years experience in investigation of quality events desirable, ideally background in manufacturing, process engineering or quality.', 'Technical', 'Strong knowledge of GMP processes including investigation of quality events and implementation of CAPA’s to prevent recurrence. Working knowledge of problem solving and risk assessment methodologies such as 5 whys, Fishbone, FMEA, QRM', 'People', '• Demonstrated ability to coach and lead a team.', '• Strong focus on delivery and results driven.', 'So, if you are ready to:', 'INVENT solutions to meet unmet healthcare needs', 'IMPACT the future by joining MSD, one of the world’s leading healthcare companies', 'INSPIRE your team to reach their full potential and push the boundaries of science and technology', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 5 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness;this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'The Clinical Data Management Center Manager is responsible for providing all aspects of supervision to individuals supporting a functional area within Global Data Management Services (GDMS) team in Costa Rica. Our DMC manager will interact effectively with project teams and business partners, and serve as first line escalation path. Provides career development opportunities and manages performance. Participates in functional area process and project initiatives. Responsibilities may include supervision of staff and interaction with individuals across multiple MSD sites under the guidance and direction of the Associate Director/Director, in compliance with MSD Policies and Procedures, Global Data Management Services (GDMS) Standard Operation Procedures (SOPs) and ICH-GCP guidelines and within the department budget.  Join our team to ensure effective interaction of GDMS staff with business partners to achieve business objectives. This role offers an exciting career at MSD!', 'Primary activities include, but are not limited to:', 'Develops career plans for direct reports, makes work assignments, conducts periodic skill assessments as well as annual performance appraisals, coaches for performance, provides ongoing feedback on performance, provides rewards and recognition, and sets priorities', 'Provides developmental opportunities for direct reports, including challenging growth assignments. Prepares promotion recommendations. Ensures direct reports receive appropriate training and mentoring to be successful in their assignments.', 'Participates in the recruitment process of the team.', 'Aligns others around a positive direction.', 'Develops challenging but achievable objectives that clearly support stated organizational goals.', 'Maximizes staff effectiveness by working with direct reports to ensure a realistic workload that supports value-added work and work-life balance, estimating length and difficulty of tasks and projects, anticipating and adjusting for obstacles and setbacks, and elevating issues to the appropriate management level.', 'Assumes specific functional leadership responsibilities for business deliverables assigned to direct reports and supervised staff on project.', 'Increases team and functional effectiveness by supporting functional efforts to simplify and standardize procedures to the greatest extent possible, sharing best practices and leading continuous improvement efforts under the direction of Associate Director', 'May supervise contingent, non-exempt, or temporary workers, on-shore and offshore', 'May assume responsibilities to support Process Owner activities in department for specific functional or business activity', 'Manages performance', 'Conducts management and functional area meetings, contributing expertise when necessary through formal or informal presentations.', 'Keeps abreast of process and technology changes both within and outside of MSD that may impact staff.', 'May participate in initiatives beyond functional area (e.g. cross-functional initiatives, etc.).', 'May support any other project or perform any other data management or drug surveillance task deemed appropriate by management.', 'Qualifications', 'Education:', '1.\tAt least B.A. or B.S. degree in relevant discipline (pharmacy, physician, veterinary, nurse, or healthcare related)', '2. Fluent in written and conversational English', 'Knowledge and skills:', '1.\tMinimum 3-5 years’ experience in', 'Clinical Data Management or Pharmacovigilance', 'as appropriate to business role or related industry, AND supervisory or management experience.', '2.\tAn overall working knowledge of the drug discovery or Drug Surveillance process, ICH and GCP guidelines.', '3.\tStrong communication skills (oral and written) with the ability to communicate with both the technical and business areas.', '4.\tDemonstrated project management, decision making and problem-solving skills.', '5.\tAbility to establish effective professional relationships across a wide range of business contacts.', '6.\tAbility to build talent and lead team with influencing skill and development skill.', '7.\tAbility to work under pressure in a changing environment with flexibility.', 'Our employees are the key to our company’s success.  We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program. description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'MSD’s Information Technology division partners with colleagues across the business to help serve our patients and customers around the world. Ours is a high-energy team of dynamic, innovative individuals dedicated to advancing MSD’s contribution to global medical innovation by leveraging information and technology to efficiently advance the business by driving revenue and productivity.', 'MSD’s Information Technology division partners with colleagues from the business across all geographies and divisions to help serve our patients and customers around the world. To enable this we need leaders to charter and build the Prague Hub in many different competency areas. For the Associate Director for Advanced Analytics, we are seeking an energetic, forward-thinking leader who in collaboration with scientific/clinical/business leaders leverages data and information to bring insights to make informed scientific/business decisions. This position will be a “hands-on” with a strong focus on the skills needed to extract scientific and business meaning from and interpret data using all kinds of advanced analytics method – statistical, mathematical, including simulations, optimizations, machine learning. This position will be closely working closely with strategy and delivery leaders across divisional and enterprise IT teams, especially in the field of MSD research and development.', 'Key Responsibilities:', 'Understands the customer/stakeholders business needs/priorities and helps building solutions that support our business goals. Establish and manages the close relationship with customers/stakeholders.', 'Participates on the definition of complex analytics projects working with the business/IT teams to propose the right analytical approach/methodology', 'Has overview of the DS - AA market development to be able to come up/explore new ways of delivering analytics solutions to increase their value/contribution', 'Manages a group of 3-4 data scientists, drives professional as well as personal development of subordinates to help them growth their expertise and career within MSD to maximize the value they deliver to the business. Is responsible for high quality deliveries of his team.', 'Builds “community of practice” leveraging experience from delivering complex analytics projects, functionally/technically mentors more junior colleagues while contributing to build a strong skilled team of advanced analytic scientists.', 'Contribute to innovative experiments, specifically to idea generation, idea incubation and/or experimentation, identifying tangible and measurable criteria', 'Communicates with the business and provides with necessary insights both from an IT and a business perspective in order to build appreciation for the quantitative tools and analyses and to drive organizational buy in on a journey from descriptive to predictive analytics', 'Promote a culture of modelling and analytics as a differentiator and competitive advantage.', 'Qualifications', 'Education and Skills Required', 'Degree or advanced degree in data science, mathematics, statistics, or computer science or related fields; PhD preferred', 'Minimum Experience Required', 'Minimum of 5-10 years of relevant delivery of complex analytical projects (industrialized, validated), minimum 2 years of relevant experience in the Life Sciences industry.', 'Skills/Knowledge Required', 'Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms multi-method modeling and simulation, optimization; economic decision analysis; algorithm development, data integration, mining, and visualization of complex data', 'Self-motivation, proactivity and ability to work independently with minimum direction Proven knowledge of business processes and industry/market trends within the pharmaceutical space', 'Excellent business acumen, with proven ability to understand business processes in detail – both at global and region/country levels – and translate these into user stories and detailed business requirements', 'Proven leadership and negotiation skills, along with good analytical and problem-solving skills', 'Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (English – both oral and written), along with the ability to communicate appropriately and confidently with colleagues from different backgrounds and seniority levels', 'Excellent organizational skills, with ability to navigate a complex matrix environment and organize/prioritize work', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 15 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

In den nächsten 4 – 5 Jahren installieren wir an diesem Standort eine moderne “State-of-the-Art” Produktionsanlage zur Herstellung von Vakzinen und Impfstoffen für die Tiergesundheit.', 'Zu Ihrem Aufgaben- und Verantwortungsbereich in dieser neugeschaffenen Position zählen:', 'Anleitung des Schichtteams bei der Durchführung der operativen Tätigkeiten', 'Durchführung des Wareneingangs und Warenausgangs/Versands', 'Einlagerung von Material und Lagerverwaltung', 'Termingerechte Vorbereitung und Bereitstellung der Produktionsaufträge', 'Materialversorgung der Produktion', 'Aufrechterhaltung der Ordnung und Sauberkeit im Lager', 'Sicherstellung der Einhaltung aller gesetzlichen Vorgaben und SOPs (GMP, GDP, EHS, etc.)', 'Anleiten von Aushilfen hinsichtlich der regulatorischen Anforderungen und SOP‘s', 'Verwaltung von Verbrauchsartikeln, bestands- und nicht bestandsgeführt', 'Allgemeine Mitarbeit im Lagerbereich', 'Qualifications', 'Für diese Tätigkeit bringen Sie folgende Voraussetzungen mit:', 'Abgeschlossene einschlägige Berufsausbildung (z.B. Lehre für Betriebslogistik, o.ä.)', 'Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Tätigkeit', 'Sicherer Umgang mit MS-Office-Applikationen, SAP-Kenntnisse im Logistikumfeld vom Vorteil', 'Erfahrung im GMP Umfeld (Pharmaproduktion) wünschenswert', 'Gute Englisch-Kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift', 'Engagierte, lösungsorientierte und kundenorientierte Persönlichkeit', 'Hohes Maß an Verantwortungsbereitschaft, Organisationstalent und Flexibilität', 'Wir bieten Ihnen:', 'Spannendes und herausforderndes Arbeitsfeld mit modernen „State- of-the-Art“ Technologien in einer neuen, wachsenden Organisation', 'Abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem international agierenden Unternehmen', 'Gute Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten', 'Mitarbeit in einem professionellen, ambitionierten und hoch motivierten Team und einer wertschätzenden positiven Arbeitsumgebung', 'Das Mindestgehalt beträgt Euro 35.235,20 brutto/Jahr, die Bereitschaft zu Überzahlung abhängig von Qualifikationsprofil und Berufserfahrung ist gegeben.', 'Sie sind kompetent, belastbar, zuverlässig, initiativ und wollen unseren Standort in dieser intensiven Start-Up Phase der Entwicklung einer großen Produktionsstätte aktiv unterstützen? description: ['Over MSD', 'Het MSD van vandaag is wereldleider op het gebied van gezondheidszorg en werkt mee aan een gezonde wereld. Met onze geneesmiddelen, vaccins, biologische therapieën en ondersteunende diensten bieden we innovatieve behandelingen voor een betere gezondheid van mensen en dieren in meer dan 140 landen. We zijn actief betrokken bij een betere toegang tot de gezondheidszorg. Dat doen we met uitgebreid beleid, programma’s en samenwerkingsverbanden.', 'MSD in Heist-op-den-Berg', 'De site in Heist-op-den-Berg produceert en verpakt innovatieve geneesmiddelen voor recept- en consumentenzorg. Ons productievolume is meer dan 170 miljoen verkoopeenheden met 101 formules en 9400 verpakkingsorders voor meer dan 140 landen en heeft meer dan 800 werknemers.', 'De afdeling', 'De Steriele Productie afdeling is verantwoordelijk voor het bereiden en afvullen van steriele injecties en suspensies. Hierbij komen verschillende sterilisatie processen kijken en wordt er gewerkt in een complexe omgeving die veel flexibiliteit vraagt. De steriele productie omgeving is uitdagend en dient steeds rekening te houden met omgevingsfactoren die invloed kunnen hebben op de kwaliteit van het product.', 'De positie', 'De Operational Coach SPF (Sterile Powder Facility) staat in voor het dagdagelijks managen van de productie/sterilisatie van actieve grondstoffen. Hij/zij', 'ondersteunt de organisatie in het behalen van een optimale productkwaliteit en vooropgestelde doelstellingen en KPI’s (key performance indicatoren) van de business unit door het organiseren en managen van de productiegerelateerde activiteiten in de unit teneinde de volumes te realiseren volgens de vooropgestelde targets met betrekking tot kwaliteit, planning, veiligheid, milieu en kosten. De Operational Coach zal werken in dagdienst en dient buiten deze standaard uren telefonisch bereikbaar te zijn gezien de productie ook ’s nachts en in de weekends doorloopt.', 'Verantwoordelijkheden', 'Organiseren,      opvolgen en bijsturen van het inzetten van de multifunctionele Operators      op basis van de overeengekomen supply chain planning;', 'Zorgen voor      een efficiënte en effectieve werkvoorbereiding - ervoor zorgen dat de      operationele areas optimaal draaien;', 'Samenwerken      met de afdelingen Supply Chain en Quality;', 'Opvolgen van      de efficiëntie;', 'Opstellen van      jaarlijkse verbeteringsdoelen, actief participeren en uitvoeren van      verbeteringsprojecten en deze op regelmatige basis evalueren;', 'Opvolgen en      waarborgen van een veiligheids- en milieucultuur binnen de organisatie;', 'Verantwoordelijk      voor optimale kwaliteit van de geleverde producten en het respecteren      hierbij van alle standaard operating procedures (SOPs) en werkinstructies;', 'Verantwoordelijk      voor house-keeping en visueel management in de business unit;', 'Op      regelmatige basis contact opnemen met afdelingen Logistics, Human      Resources, Finance, Technical Services, Safety & Environment en      Regulatory Affairs.', 'Qualifications', 'Benodigde kwalificaties & ervaring', 'Master of Bachelor', 'diploma of      gelijkwaardig door ervaring;', 'Enkele jaren ervaring in de farmaceutische industrie      of in een productieomgeving;', 'Kennis van lean manufacturing, TPM (total      production maintenance), 5S, elimineren van waste (zero loss).', 'Competenties', 'Operationele kennis van productieprocedures      (veiligheidsvoorschriften, operationele cGMP-regels en –voorschriften);', 'Kennis van managementstechnieken, kennis van in      process-normen en kwaliteitslimieten;', 'Coaching capabiliteit/ uitstekende people skills;', 'Bereidheid tot overleg;', 'Problem Solving skills;', 'Flexibel kunnen omgaan met een snel wisselende      omgeving en uitdagingen;', 'Individueel en zelfstandig kunnen werken in      teamverband;', 'Bereid zijn      bereikbaar te zijn buiten de standaard werkuren;', 'Goede kennis van de Nederlandse taal (zowel      gesproken als geschreven) en communicatief vaardig in het Engels.', 'MSD als werkgever', 'Keer op keer nieuwe uitdagingen aangaan, dat is wel iets wat je leuk moet vinden als je bij MSD aan de slag wilt. Want continu verbeteren is een van onze drijfveren. Dat geldt zowel voor werkprocessen als voor medewerkers. Gedrevenheid, teamwork en eigen initiatief zijn van groot belang. Bij MSD kun je je op allerlei manieren ontwikkelen. In de diepte, door je te specialiseren in je vak. Maar ook door jezelf te verbreden en door te groeien naar een leidinggevende functie. Internationaal of juist heel lokaal, er zijn talloze andere mogelijkheden om stappen te zetten in je loopbaan, te rouleren in functies of te groeien in je functie. Werken bij MSD is werken in een dynamische high tech omgeving van internationale allure, die toch sterk lokaal geworteld is.', 'Informatie', 'Voor meer informatie betreffende deze vacature, neem contact op met Ralph Salden, Talent Acquisition Business Partner Benelux, via', 'Ralph.Salden@MSD.com', 'Solliciteren', 'Als je interesse hebt in deze interessante rol nodigen we je van harte uit om online te solliciteren door middel van het indienen van je CV en motivatiebrief.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'No', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['About MSD', 'MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us. Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork.  As part of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.', 'MSD. Inventing for Life. For more information, visit our website: www.werkenbijmsd.nl', 'The department', 'The Facilities Management Moleneind team is a centralized team that enables the production teams and COE’s to use the onsite facilities by running and maintaining all MSD-buildings and their systems at the Moleneind site and provide a variety of soft services. The team consists of the Facility Lead, Senior Specialist Facilities, FM Project Coordinator, the Asset and Reliability Specialist, the Senior Engineer energy and a team of 4 FM-engineers. To strengthen the FM team, we are recruiting a Senior Project Manager to manage a diverse project portfolio for FM MSD Oss.', 'The function', 'Reporting into the Associate Director Facilities Management as a Senior Project Manager you are responsible for the successful delivery of new capability of a diverse project portfolio for MSD Oss. It is an exciting and unique opportunity to have early involvement in creation of a site and setting up the business for successful delivery of products.', 'The successful candidate will be responsible for managing portions of an overall large capital investments to an aggressive timeline. The role will also involve developing relationships and working very closely with the site team to understand and address business needs. Provide input into project plans and successfully execute them according to established schedule, cost and performance standards.', 'Accountabilities include but are not limited to the following main tasks:', '• Manage the Long-Range Capital Plan (LRCP) based asset lifecycle and site master plan', '• Develop yearly budgets in line with the LRCP', '• Leads the preparation of Capital Management Process funding requests', '• Manage design, scope, schedule and cost in collaboration with FM team, other project team members, safety and quality representatives, outside contractors and suppliers for their scope element', '• Track and report progress as required against project deliverables, highlight risks and mitigation plans and provide regular updates to project sponsors', '• Provide input into project plans and successfully execute them according to established, scope, schedule, cost and performance standards', '• You act as Capital Project Team Leader (CPTL) leading the Capital Project Team (CPT). The CPTL ensures the project goals are met. This include CPT formation, functional alignment, issue resolution and communications of issues to management Capital Review Committee (if required).', '• The CPTL is responsible for coordinating all project activities through process qualification.', '• Ensure there is a strong safety culture and performance in the execution of capital projects', 'Qualifications', '• Mechanical, electrical or chemical engineering bachelor’s degree or similar relevant qualification', '• A minimum of five to ten years of relevant experience in project management of capital projects in Pharm/Bio Pharm/Food and including management, experience with managing challenging timelines', '• Understands the typical project life cycle from concept through to qualification and has proven experience in this area', '• Establishing and maintaining a strong relationship with clients at the site. Leveraging relationships by interfacing and inﬂuencing with Engineering and service providers to produce optimal result', '• Ability to work with a multinational team and different cultures', '• Experience in a complex, international environment with matrix organization', '• Culturally sensitive and able to build strong relationships with clients, employees, third parties, line management and other stakeholders, able to apply influence and persuasion;', '• Strong verbal and written communication skills in both Dutch and English', '• Solid project and change management capacities', '• Experience of LEAN construction principles would be an advantage', 'A good place to work', 'Our employees are the key to our company’s success. We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program. Our company’s benefits are designed to support the wide range of goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees, and many of the people that matter the most in their lives.', 'Information', 'For more information about the vacancy, please contact Marieke Sijbers, Associate Director Facility Management, by phone via 0412-661880.', 'Are you an experienced Senior Project Manager and do you have experience in managing a diverse project portfolio? Do you have experience in working in a complex, international environment and matrix organization? Are you in for a new challenge? We would like to meet you!', 'Application', 'If you are interested in this challenging role, you are invited to apply online by uploading your resume and application letter in English.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'No', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

title: Senior Project Manager Job

description: ['The department and the function', 'Pharmaceutical Operations Oss (PO) is engaged in technologically high-quality production, packaging and distribution of medicines for, among other things, contraception, promotion of fertility and anesthesia in a highly regulated GMP environment. In addition to tablets (solids) and injection liquids (steriles), special products are also made here, such as contraceptive rods and rings based on polymer technology.', "Technical Operations (TO) is a Center of Excellence within PO. The department consists of various sections that provide technical and technological support to MSD's pharmaceutical operation in Oss.", 'The Process Engineer reports to the head of the section.', 'Technical Operations is looking for a driven Process Engineer who has demonstrable knowledge of pharmaceutical production processes.', 'If you are our new colleague, you will be in the lead for or participating in one or more projects that are carried out within MSD and in MSD Global teams.', 'This requires that you can work effectively in a complex, local and globally oriented environment. In addition to the strong substantive knowledge that you bring with you, good communication skills and keeping an overview are essential.', 'The content of the function', '•Defining, specifying and purchasing new production equipment together with the internal customer and other stakeholders and setting up and carrying out', 'Qualifications', 'on this equipment;', '• Introducing new products to the production departments;', '• Scaling up production processes i.v. increased demand for products and / or reducing the operational costs of existing products;', '• Setting up, executing, reporting and / or coordinating investigations and changes for the improvement of existing installations and production processes;', '• Managing or contributing to investigations resulting from deviations in the production process and or Out Of Spec situations.', 'Qualifications', 'For this position we are looking for an enthusiastic, driven and above all self-managing professional who recognizes himself in the following job requirements:', '• Possessing a Diploma of completed technical training at a minimum level of HBO (e.g. chemical technology, Mechanical engineering, applied physics, materials science);', '• We are looking for juniors, mediors and seniors with at least 2 years of work experience in the pharmaceutical industry, or similar, highly regulated environment;', '• Demonstrable experience in executing/realising multidisciplinary projects in a complex organization;', '• Able to make substantive depth and to maintain the overall overview;', '• Able to communicate at different levels and to play a binding role within a complex organization;', '• Strong analytical work and thinking ability, analysing and managing problems from different perspectives; (Scientific problem solving);', '• Excellent command of the English language in Word and writing, and preferably also speaks Dutch;', '• Knowledge and experience with qualifications and validations is an advantage;', '• Knowledge and experience with Lean and Six Sigma is an advantage.', 'About MSD', "Today's MSD is a world leader in healthcare and contributes to a healthy world. With our medicines, vaccines, biological therapies and support services we offer innovative treatments for better health of people and animals in more than 140 countries. We are actively involved in better access to health care. We do this with extensive policies, programs and partnerships. Some 4500 employees work at MSD in the Netherlands at three different main locations.", 'MSD as an employer', 'Time and time again encountering new challenges, that is something you should like when you want to start working at MSD. Because continuous improvement is one of our motives. This applies to both work processes and employees. Drive, teamwork and own initiative are of great importance. At MSD you can develop in many ways. In depth, by specializing in your profession. But also by broadening yourself and growing towards a managerial position. Internationally or very locally, there are countless other possibilities to take steps in your career, to rotate in positions or to grow in your position. Working at MSD is working in a dynamic high-tech environment of international allure, which is strongly rooted locally in Oss, Haarlem and Boxmeer.', 'Our employees are the key to the success of our company. We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by, among other things, offering a competitive employment package. Our conditions offer support to the different goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees and those who are most dear to them.', 'Qualifications, Skills & Experience Required  - This text will be posted online:Please take care to remove any potentially discriminatory information – if in doubt speak to R&S.; MSD is an equal opportunities organisation.', 'Information:', 'For more information about this vacancy you can contact Jeroen Mertens', '(0412-662637), Ellen Theunissen (0412-663017) or Harm Veenstra (0412-669188).', 'Application:', 'If you recognize yourself in this interesting role, we invite you to apply online by submitting your CV and English motivation letter.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Have you heard about MSD?', "MSD is an innovative, global healthcare leader committed to improving health and well-being in 140 countries around the world. We continue to focus our research on conditions that affect millions of people around the world - diseases like Alzheimer's, Diabetes and Cancer - while further expanding our strengths in areas such as vaccines and biology.", 'We aspire to be the best healthcare company in the world and are dedicated to providing leading innovations and solutions for tomorrow.', 'Opportunity offered : Environmental Health & Safety Sr. Specialist', 'We are looking for an experienced EH & Safety Sr. Specialist  based in Prague.', 'On this position you will be responsible for our Commercial Operations in Central and eastern Europe. Reporting to the Global Director EHS, the Sr. Specialist EHS is responsible for managing the development and implementation of environmental, health and safety programs for Commercial Operations (Offices and Warehouses) including both field sales and office facilities.', 'This role will partner with country leadership and facilities to integrate effective and efficient EHS programs in alignment with business goals and values. Monitors and reports on EHS performance and develops strategies for continuous improvement and sustainable compliance to governing regulations and programs', 'You will have the opportunity to work with a variety of EHS experts and pharmaceutical professionals, translating safety relevant information into best practices and communicating across all levels of the organization.', 'Full', 'Description', 'of Position:', '• Act as a single point of contact for business stakeholders in assigned areas of responsibilities. Provides coaching and support to operational leaders in meeting their responsibilities under the EHS program.', '• Complete frequent program assessments and data analytics to evaluate the performance of the EHS programs. Establish and ensures completion of corrective actions, with urgency, to address areas requiring improvement. Escalate concerns through management as appropriate.', '• Provide clear and concise EHS performance reports to operational leaders that are actionable and support implementation of EHS programs.', '• Collaborate with and provides guidance to local leadership and facilities management to drive consistency into the implementation of EHS programs across Commercial Operations.', '• Manage the assigned budget within the established limits and quickly reports, adjusts and resolves variances.', '• Ensure completion of all regulatory submissions and notifications required to maintain compliance with federal/country, state, and MSD EHS requirements.', '• Develop and implements approaches to protect the safety of employees and to continuously reduce EHS events. Ensure proper investigation of EHS events through the root cause and establishes the required preventative measures.', '• Partner with Fleet Management, Service Providers, Human Resources and Country leaders to ensure compliance with Global Motor Vehicle Safety program. Provide expert advice and coordinate local technical support.', '• Ensure reporting of accidents or environmental events to the enforcing authorities and MSD reporting guidelines.', '• Ensure that adequate records are maintained to demonstrate compliance with EHS programs.', '• Develop and implement country-specific injury prevention campaigns based on trending analysis.', '• Complete working visits to Commercial sites as needed. Participate in comprehensive building inspection of Commercial sites supported.', '• Partner with in-country Communication teams to develop and implement effective communication strategy. Including information resulting from EHS related events to office occupants and field sales using available communication tools (Newsletter, Sync, etc.', '• Travel about 25% of the time.', '• No relocation provided', 'Qualifications', 'Expected Qualification of YOURS :', 'We are seeking professionals with the following qualifications, skills and', 'Experience:', 'Qualifications', 'Required:', '• Bachelor’s Degree;', '• Minimum 5 years applied professional EHS work experience;', '• Proficiency in Czech and English language both written and spoken. Other European languages are a plus German, Swedish, Norwegian, French, Italian.', '• Outstanding written and oral communication skills. Proven ability to present information clearly and concisely through all levels of an organization;', '• Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to influence others. Demonstrated leadership skills with the ability to quickly adjust to changing situations.', 'Preferred:', '• Bachelor’s Degree with concentration in Safety or Environmental related technical discipline;', '• Experience with Fleet Safety and Office Safety;', '• Relevant EHS professional certification. Example: NEBOSH, CSP, CHMM, or equivalent.', 'We offer:', '• Competitive remuneration', '• Position in a leading global healthcare company', '• Challenging career', '• Professional growth based on performance', '• Innovative and flexible working environment', '• Wide range of benefits', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 25 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Mit seinen verschreibungspflichtigen Arzneimitteln, Impfstoffen, Biologika, Präparaten zur Selbstmedikation und für die Tiergesundheit in verschiedenen Therapiebereichen bietet MSD in mehr als 140 Ländern umfassende und innovative Lösungen für Gesundheit. Ein besonderes Anliegen von MSD ist darüber hinaus die Verbesserung der weltweiten Gesundheitsversorgung und der verbesserte Zugang zu Medikamenten. Dafür engagiert sich MSD in weitreichenden Gesundheitsprogrammen und Partnerschaften.', 'STELLENPROFIL:', 'Für die neuen Bundesländer und Teile von Hessen suchen wir eine/n Regionalleiter/in.', 'Als Regionalleiter/in sind Sie für die personelle und organisatorische Führung eines regionalen Marktes und Verkaufsteams zuständig.Damit sind Sie verantwortlich für die in Kooperation mit dem Sales Manager / BU Direktor erarbeitete regionsspezifische Planung und Organisation Ihres Marktes und Ihres Teams sowie für die Erfolgskontrolle.', 'Ihre Aufgaben umfassen im Einzelnen:', '• Ergebnisorientierte kaufmännische, disziplinarische und fachliche Führung des regionalen Teams gemäß den Firmengrundsätzen', '• Permanente Weiterentwicklung und Führung der Mitarbeiter zu erfolgreichen und selbständigen Managern in ihrem Gebiet (Performance Management, Coaching, Training)', '• Sicherstellung der Firmenumsatzziele sowie Erarbeitung und Steuerung der konkreten Ziele für die Region in allen geschäftsrelevanten Zielgruppen', '• Analyse aller regionsrelevanten Markt-, Mitbewerber- und Berichtsdaten und Erarbeitung und Steuerung entsprechender Konzepte zur Zielerreichung', '• Mitgestaltung der Marketing- und Vertriebsstrategie für Deutschland und Management aller geschäftsrelevanten Aktivitäten in der Region', '• Ergebnisorientierte Planung und Controlling der Investitionsmittel (Field Selling + Direct Marketing Expenses) unter dem regionalen Profitabilitätsaspekt', '• Mitarbeit bei lokalen und regionalen Market Access Projekten', '• Regelmäßige Kommunikation in Berichtsform nach firmeninternen Standards über die Ergebnisse und Aktivitäten in der Region. Das Ziel ist die permanente Weiterentwicklung der Arbeitsprozesse', '• Auswahl geeigneter neuer Mitarbeiter im Rahmen des definierten Rekrutierungsprozesses', '• Teamübergreifende Kooperation und Kommunikation', 'Qualifications', '• Vorzugsweise abgeschlossenes natur-/wirtschaftswissenschaftliches Studium oder gleichwertige Qualifikation', '• Erfolgreiche Tätigkeit im pharmazeutischen Außendienst', '• Führungskompetenz', '• Erfahrung in der Begleitung von Veränderungsprozessen (Change Management)', '• Profunde Kenntnisse des regionalen Marktes (regionale Gesetze und regionale gesundheitspolitische Bedingungen)', '• Sehr gute Anwenderkenntnisse in MS-Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook)', '• Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift', '• Sehr gute Moderations- und Präsentationsfähigkeit', '• Hohe Bereitschaft an der Nutzung alternativer Kommunikationskanäle/neuer Medien', 'Wir bieten:', '• Attraktives Gehaltspaket', '• Betriebliche Altersvorsorge plus Entgeltumwandlung in den Chemiepensionfond', '• 30 Tage Urlaub plus Urlaubsgeld', '• Firmenwagen', '• Interne und externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten', '• Flexible Arbeitszeiteinteilung', '• Homeoffice Möglichkeit', '• Mitarbeitervergünstigungen', '• Employee Assistance Program', '• Arbeitsfreistellung bei ehrenamtl. Ausübung (20 Std/Jahr)', 'Wir haben Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Lebenslauf, Motivationsschreiben, Zeugnisse) über unsere Karriereseite.', 'Ihre Rolle bei MSD ist von entscheidender Bedeutung, um der Welt dabei zu helfen, neue Durchbrüche zu erzielen, die kommende Generationen betreffen. Wir zählen auf Ihre Fähigkeiten und Ihren Erfindungsreichtum, um einen bedeutsamen Beitrag zum weltweiten medizinischen Fortschritt zu leisten. Bei MSD erfinden wir fürs Leben.', 'Personalberatungsvertreter, bitte sorgfältig lesen:', 'MSD akzeptiert keine unaufgeforderte Unterstützung von Personalberatungen für diese Beschäftigungsmöglichkeit. Bitte keine Anrufe oder E-Mails. Alle Lebensläufe, die von Personalberatungen per E-Mail, im Internet oder in irgendeiner Form und/oder Methode an einen Mitarbeiter von MSD gesendet werden, ohne dass eine gültige schriftliche Vermittlungsvereinbarung für diese Position besteht, gelten als alleiniges Eigentum von MSD. Für den Fall, dass der Bewerber von MSD aufgrund der Verweisung oder auf andere Weise eingestellt wird, wird keine Gebühr gezahlt.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD’s Business Service Center (BSC), located across three regions (Americas, Europe, and Asia), are responsible for the timely and efficient delivery of standardized, global financial processes. The BSC – Americas in San Jose, Costa Rica will be responsible for the execution and delivery of a broad range of financial services and processes across MSD business divisions and markets for the Americas region.', 'The responsibilities of the Collections Analyst include execute Collection activities. Involves statement of account creation, generation in an accurate and timely manner, to ensure past dues, DSO, disputes, bad debt, refunds and write offs processes are within established SLAs and process compliance. Analysis, reconciliation, understanding if the adjustment of credit and debit notes. Payments follow up, and support cash application.', 'Primary Responsibilities:', '· High external customer interaction, high communication skills and negotiation.', '· Analyze and work towards issues troubleshooting, root cause fix analysis.', '· High analysis of customer account debits and credits, netting, offsets opportunities.', '· Support the execution of OtC processes for America´s markets, ensuring compliance with all policies, quality and Internal, External Control requirements. SOX based.', '· Timely account analysis and prompt escalation of disputes, claims, past due receivables.', '· Prioritization focus, strategic thinking. Proper follow up of due receivables, full knowledge of credit terms, limits, payment methods, customer financial status, contacts, and processes to ensure prompt payment.', '· Manage bad debt, write off, refunds processes.', "· Achieve all defined KPIs and SLA's (DSO, AR aging, leakage risk, unapplied cash, dispute/claim resolution, other)", '· Perform month end activities and/or reports for individual and team activities as needed. Perform other duties & projects as assigned.', '· Support Service Center activities, be a team player and a strong liaison with third parties.']
