customers and patients on time, every time, across the globe.', 'Position Overview:', 'Deputising to the Site Quality Head, the deputy Site Quality Head will work directly with, and act on behalf of, the Site Quality Head during site absence.', 'Working with the IPT Quality teams, Quality Systems team, Quality Control teams and Qualified Persons located at UK sites, provide Quality Assurance support to the UK site operations.', 'Take on ownership, directly and indirectly of key quality systems, driving compliance and continuous improvement.', 'As required act in Quality Management roles within UK quality operation, across Quality Systems, IPT Quality and Quality Control.', 'Work directly with IPT staff, supporting and at times leading significant investigations to provide an efficient and effective service to support the timely and compliant disposition of materials, components and products.', 'Working with the site management, ensures that the Milton Keynes site operates in a fully GMP compliant manner in accordance with the relevant corporate governance requirements (including reporting), policies, procedures and guidelines as well as ensuring that the products and processes are fully compliant with the filed regulatory dossiers for the products supported.', 'Partners with and supports other sites and functions as required, e.g. during regional improvement activities, during the technical transfer of products into and out of the site, or during cross site investigations.', 'Acts as site representative for compliance inspections of the sites e.g. internal and corporate audits as well as Regulatory Inspections.', 'Either directly or through the QP, liaises with the Veterinary Medicines Directorate (VMD) and other relevant HA’s regarding the routine and non-routine release of biological products and at other times to secure the resolution of complaints and other issues that might impact the quality and supply of the products supplied by or for the company.', 'Participate in and where required lead escalation and issue resolution processes relating to significant regulatory or quality events that require concurrence above site.', 'Provide leadership and coaching to both quality and production staff in relation to quality performance and improvement.', 'Qualifications', 'Minimum Experience', 'Required:', '8 years post graduate knowledge of GMP/GCLPs, QMS, test method validation & equipment qualification, Lean and 6 Sigma, continuous improvement/business excellence.', 'Excellent Leadership and interpersonal skills including verbal and non-verbal communication, stakeholder management, conflict management, issue resolution and leadership.', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that description: ["The company is an innovative, global healthcare leader committed to improving health and well-being in 140 countries around the world. We aspire to be the best healthcare company in the world and are dedicated to providing innovative solutions for tomorrow.", 'About this Opportunity', 'We are seeking energetic, forward-thinking professionals to join our Information Technology group in Singapore. As part of that team, you will help launch our new IT Global Innovation Center focused on developing and applying advanced capabilities in information sciences, information security, mobility, social media and big data. You will have the opportunity to work on global teams to identify and tackle the biggest opportunities and challenges at the intersection of healthcare, information and technology. We offer project-based rotations to help with your professional development, and a flat, collaborative environment. Overall, our new Global Innovation Center in Singapore offers technology professionals incredible opportunities to learn from others across the globe, to challenge themselves, and to enjoy a reward that technology careers don’t often bring: the satisfaction of helping to save lives.', 'Working within the Commercial Platforms Team, the Digital Capability Lead manages the delivery of digital assets leveraging content management solutions. You will:', '•', 'Lead IT project management in Web Contents Management projects for APCJ', '•', 'Lead client engagement for daily operation of Digital Marketing & Channels platform in JCAP region', '•', 'Conduct project management for JCAP region in global post-launch maintenance of MSD Connect web/portal platform', '•', 'Oversee IT service enhancements through global support process review and validation with related service teams for MSD Connect end-to-end', '•', 'Functions as a CMS & Web Content Management subject matter expert providing “hands on” technical assistance to agencies, developers and staff resources throughout the project lifecycle.', '•', 'Contributes to marketing & promotion of CMS platform within the company.', '•', 'Consults with Technical Product Manager and digital architects on best practices, product enhancements, upgrades and complimentary product offerings', '•', 'Reviews business requirements and recommends solutions aligned with platform best practices', '•', 'Assists in evaluating new and existing implementations to judge their functionality, effectiveness, reliability, performance, usage, maintainability and cost of ownership', '•', 'Troubleshoots system errors and collaborates with development teams on issue resolution', '•', 'Recommends changes to existing systems to achieve alignment with platform best practices and use of standard features', '•', 'Keeps abreast of new technologies, methodologies, industry practices and standards', 'Qualifications', 'About You:', '•', 'To be successful for the role, ideally, you will need a Maser Science/ Degree with relevant experience in Computer Science, Sales, Marketing or other related discipline with 2-3 years’ experience in supporting a sales and marketing environment', '•', 'Knowledge and experience with Content Management Systems; description: ['MSDC, Maintenance Coach Integrated Production Team (IPT)', 'MSD CARLOW', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of healthcare in Ireland', 'MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'Our Manufacturing Division, is a team of dedicated, energetic individuals who are committed to being the most trusted supplier of pharmaceuticals and health products worldwide. Our facilities, along with our external contractors, suppliers, and partners, comprise an interdependent global manufacturing network that’s committed to delivering a compliant, reliable supply to customers and patients on time, every time, across the globe.', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do. We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD CARLOW', 'MSD in Carlow is a world-class manufacturing facility, and the company’s first stand-alone vaccine and biologics facility outside the US. Carlow employs over 350 highly skilled employees and is an important element of MSD’s network of sites, playing a pivotal role in the manufacture of our immuno-oncology treatment.', 'MSD Carlow is a state-of-the-art, 200,000 sq ft vaccines and biologics facility focused on formulating and filling vaccine and biologic products that improve and transform the lives of people across the world.', 'MSD’s sustained investment in Ireland empowers Carlow to offer its team the opportunity to continuously grow, learn, invent and thrive.', 'We are growing our highly-skilled team and building our presence in Carlow so that we can continue to lead scientific breakthroughs in the treatment of some of the world’s most harmful diseases.', '& SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES', 'Responsible for the maintenance teams, associated equipment and all activities affecting them. Provide leadership, cross functional development and technical expertise to operations, maintenance and administrative personnel in the management of production equipment.', 'POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES', 'Leadership activities including selection, development, coaching and day to day management of Production Maintenance areas. Ensure that the team receives appropriate resources and programmes to develop technical and other skills, to complete their jobs whilst stimulating personal growth and development in line with role. Develop and maintain training programmes.', 'Oversee maintenance related schedules, tasks and resources in IPT and cross functionally; partner with colleagues and third parties, such as the Facilities Coach, Operations Coaches and IFM, to perform vendor management, communications, training, project work, audit/inspection duties etc.; thereby, ensuring department is audit/inspection ready.', 'Ensure effective technical support is provided to Production in all aspects of machine and equipment maintenance, installation and modification; perform detailed maintenance, calibrations, PMs and troubleshooting. Required to operate and clean the process equipment as necessary.', 'Ensure process and production equipment are maintained, ensuring ongoing preventative maintenance, equipment troubleshooting and repairs to ensure continuous, reliable and repeatable operation of all equipment; drive Total Productive Maintenance. Oversee the management and equipment shutdown scheduling, ensuring resources are available, thereby minimizing downtown.', 'Responsible for overseeing maintenance planning and preventative maintenance through completion of planned and emergency work orders, calibrations, PMs etc', 'Ensure team operate and monitor production activities and support equipment, using MES/DCS and PLC based systems, to ensure optimum equipment uptime and target outputs, whilst facilitating continuous process improvements using Lean Principle', 'Ensure effective technical support is provided to Production in all aspects of machine and equipment maintenance, installation and modification', 'Ensure correct operation, troubleshooting and repair of complex systems which may include CIP, Autoclaves, Glassware Washers, production vessels, HVAC, Isolators, compressed gasses, plant steam/condensate, bulk chemical distribution and waste water treatment in a highly regulated, cGMP environment. Ensure correct interpretation of P&ID;’s, equipment/system layouts, wiring diagrams, and specifications in planning and performing maintenance and repairs. Facilitate others to do likewise.', 'Ensure equipment reliability and performance by facilitating effective systems for identification of root cause failures, recommendations and implementation of improvement changes throughout processes, ensuring calibrations of equipment are performed as necessary', 'Ensure efficient supply of information and technical data for securing spare parts and equipment asset entry into the CMMS; liaise directly with vendors on supply of parts, upgrades to systems etc as necessary. Manage general facility up keep and responsive customer support with emphasis on customer satisfaction', 'May be required to perform other duties as assigned', 'REPORTING STRUCTURE', 'Associate Director, Maintenance & Engineering', 'Qualifications', 'QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE - KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS', 'General', 'Effective communication and interpersonal skills to interface effectively with all levels of colleagues in a team environment, and with external customers', 'Understand the specific responsibilities of all Carlow departments as they relate to ones own department, understanding the business processes ones department supports', 'Progressive people management skills', 'Strong influencing skills', 'Customer service', 'Vendor liaisons', 'Demonstrate analytical and systematic problem solving skills', 'Training skills', 'Technical', 'Understanding of mechanical/electrical/pneumatic processes', 'Sterile filling processes and equipment', 'Lean Six Sigma Methodology experience desired', 'Knowledge of cGMP and GDP preferred', 'Troubleshooting and maintaining process instrumentation and equipment', 'SAP knowledge and experience preferred', 'Leadership:', 'Focus on Customers and Patients', 'Collaborate', 'Act with Candour and Courage', 'Make Rapid, Disciplined Decisions', 'Drive Results', 'Build Talent', 'Demonstrate Ethics and Integrity', 'Education & Experience', "Bachelor's Degree or higher preferred; ideally in a Science, Engineering or other Technical discipline and 10+ year related experience.", 'So, if you are ready to:', 'INVENT solutions to meet unmet healthcare needs', 'IMPACT the future by joining MSD, one of the world’s leading healthcare companies', 'INSPIRE your team to reach their full potential and push the boundaries of science and technology', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'MSD is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms / recruitment agencies for this employment opportunity.  Please, no phone calls or emails.  All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at MSD via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of MSD.  No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by MSD as a result of the referral or through other means.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 10 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'Right now, thousands of MSD associates are working to cure the world’s most complex diseases. We know that our people are the key to our success, which is why our Talent Acquisition Team takes pride in building teams of skilled, forward-thinking individuals who contribute to MSD’s pioneering medical advancements. Our Human Resources department shares a spirit of attentive enthusiasm that helps support our associates in achieving new milestones in global healthcare.', 'As a new addition to our Global Talent Acquisition Team, we are looking for an Associate Director Talent Acquisition (m/f) responsible for our MSD Sites in Switzerland, Austria, Nordics and Baltics (Full-time, indefinite).', 'As an Associate Director Talent Acquisition, you will be accountable for a cluster of countries where you will partner with cross divisional business / HR leaders to understand their needs and translate these into actionable talent acquisition strategies and deliverables. You will hire and manage a number of Talent Acquisition Advisors who will consult the business and support hiring of senior roles in the organization. You will also act as a project manager and change agent by supporting the transformation to ensure that your team are capable of senior consulting and managing stakeholder expectations.', 'The Global Talent Acquisition organization at MSD is transforming. Our vision is to move from a recruitment delivery function to a value-add HR function / Talent Acquisition CoE that not only delivers hires, but also consults the business to offer talent business intelligence, map the market for business-critical talent and develop a strong employer branding strategy (with focus on employee advocacy) and a university relations strategy (to attract our future talent). A key enabler for this shift is a significant investment in headcount, budget and technology and a new partnership with an RPO organization to outsource much of our transactional Talent Acquisition work.', 'The primary activities include but are not limited to:', 'Partner and consult with the business to understand business needs and develop, gain commitment and execute against talent strategies to deliver value', 'Develop and implement the country Talent Acquisition strategy', 'Understand the internal talent landscape (including Talent Reviews and Succession Planning)', 'Accountable for end to end recruiting in the respective business area / geography for business niche (senior) positions for all divisions in the markets', 'Be personally responsible for executive hires and contract negotiation for the region', 'Consult & influence selection decisions ensuring a diverse pipeline', 'Partner with Sourcing team to develop deep candidate pipelines; network proactively and have a passion for identifying and securing top talent externally', 'Partner with the Talent Acquisition CoE leads to identify and deploy Employee Branding, Social Media and Diversity strategies, etc.', 'Lead regional/ global Talent Acquisition CoE continuous improvement projects', 'Drive Diversity initiatives with HRBPs, Managers and RPO (where needed)', 'Consult on and conduct assessment/selection approach when needed', 'Educate the business on hiring progress and competitive landscape utilizing internal and external metrics and data', 'Drive consistency in the hiring process and ensure a best in class hiring manager and candidate experience', 'Build strong relationships with business, HR CoEs, HRBPs and RPO', 'Represent Talent Acquisition in the local HR leadership team and towards senior management', 'Adhere to local Compliance requirements', 'Ability to deliver on or exceed stated KPIs', 'Lead the team of local talent acquisition advisors', 'Qualifications', 'Bachelor’s degree, Master’s degree preferred', 'Minimum 7 - 8 years of end-to-end recruiting experience; a combination of search firm / RPO and corporate recruiting experience is strongly preferred', 'Minimum 2 years’ experience managing a Team', 'Experience with an Applicant Tracking System (ATS)', 'Prior experience recruiting in a global matrix environment would be an advantage', 'Strong sourcing capability to direct our sourcing team to identify world class talent', 'Ability to consult and collaborate at all levels of the organization', 'Strong business acumen, external labour market and best practice knowledge', 'Excellent project management capabilities and a mindset of optimization', 'Good communication skills with strong influencing, negotiation and conflict management skills', 'Strategic thinking', 'Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment', 'Business fluency in English', 'We offer:', 'An exciting opportunity within a stable and growing company', 'Development and career opportunities within the company', 'A competent, motivated and great team', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'Interested in becoming part of a dynamic, developing team and contributing your know-how to an innovative environment that allows you to show initiative and that offers long-term perspectives? Please apply using the link to our career site!', 'MSD is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at MSD via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of MSD.  No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by MSD as a result of the referral or through other means.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 20 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

title: Pharmaceutical Info Specialist-太原-刘菲 Job

description: ['Do you want to make a difference for patients and physicians – while unleashing your own full potential? Do you relish the chance of mastering the field of medical information, medical review and ethical product communication and contribute to the successful launches of multiple products? Then you could be our new Senior Medical Services Specialist in Finland in the Nordic Medical Services Team at MSD working in a vibrant cross-cultural environment.', 'Together with your local colleague, you are our ethical communication ambassador within the Finnish subsidiary:', 'As our Senior Medical Services Specialist, you review and approve all promotional materials and other marketing activities, as appropriate.', 'Patients are at the centre of all what we do! Therefore you ensure medical and scientific accuracy, the highest ethical standard and compliance with applicable rules, regulations and ethical codes in our promotional communications. All to ensure the appropriate and correct use of our products and to maintain trust among our customers.', 'Driven by ethics and integrity, you establish strong relationships with multiple internal stakeholders across the different functions, with special focus on the marketing and sales departments, Medical Affairs colleagues as well as colleagues in the regulatory-, quality- and pharmacovigilance departments. You work across all therapeutical areas and brands with colleagues on both Local and Nordic level. You pride yourself of being the undisputed expert on the local code specifics in combination with a broad business understanding in order to help the company achieve the overall objectives while maintaining the highest ethical standard.', 'Internally, together with your Nordic Medical Services colleagues, you assist your marketing and sales colleagues in understanding the corporate standards and processes for promotional material approvals and the current practice of the local code by training and guiding on a day to day basis. You have an active dialogue with the Local Management Team and Brand leads to ensure support, alignment and understanding of these requirements.', 'As our Senior Medical Services Specialist, you respond to complex medical inquiries about our products from our customers.', 'You manage our Vendor that provides first line medical information services to ensure they perform in accordance with MSD standards and applicable regulations and requirements.', 'As you can see, your tasks as Senior Medical Services Specialist are many and varied. They also include:', 'Providing early input to innovative ideas and activities', 'Training MSD employees on local ethical rules and medical information requirements', 'Together with Nordic Medical Services colleagues develop how we operate to ensure continuous improvement of quality and effectiveness.', 'Supporting Nordic Medical Information colleagues by acting as extra resource and/or back up', 'Participating in cross-functional and/or cross-country activities', 'Qualifications', 'You understand science – and people', 'You have either a pharmacist degree or equivalent (MSc) in Life Sciences. Over 2 years of experience of  medical information services or approving promotional materials within the pharma industry is an advantage.', 'You have learned that trust, achieved through a strong desire to reach results while focusing on patients and customers and highest ethical and scientific standards, is a prerequisite for success in this industry. Combining a strong head for science with business acumen and strong communication skills, you easily communicate with customers in Medical Information as well as various internal stakeholders.', 'As a person, you have the flexibility to adapt and succeed in a rapidly changing environment. You are able to work independently, you can take decisions and apply rules and guidances on new activities and situations even though not all facts are available and you are able to develop strong relationships with your internal stakeholders. You are good at listening and understanding others perspectives, yet you know how to get your point across in a way that makes colleagues and external stakeholders appreciate your expertise, skills and high ethical standard.', 'You exhibit the following qualities:', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Finnish and English', 'High level of scientific and ethical integrity in combination with courage and candor', 'Excellent cross-functional collaboration skills', 'Excellent negotiation skills, able to diffuse tense situations comfortably, so that common ground is found', 'Ability to understand customers, patients as well as other external stakeholders views and needs', 'Application and further information', 'Start the application process by clicking the application button. Application deadline is March 31st, 2019.', 'For further information about the position, please contact Nordic Medical Services Lead, Camilla Poljen on  +46 70 345 50 90.', 'About MSD in the Nordics', 'For over 125 years and counting MSD has revolutionised global health care. Today, more than 800 people work for MSD in the Nordics alone. Innovation is our life’s blood, and you will be a part of developing new and customer centric health care solutions that go beyond medicine to help people be well and live better lives during treatment. We have a strong pipeline of products within medicines, vaccines, biologic therapies and animal health products. We work every day to make healthcare accessible to as many as possible, which requires top talent within both R&D;, marketing, finance, health economy and policy shaping. Globally, we operate in 140 countries and demonstrate our commitment to increasing access to health care through far-reaching policies, programs and partnerships.. For more information, visit', 'www.workforlife.com', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 5 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

title: Sr. District Manager-南宁 Job

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'Procurement Specialist, Biologics Manufacturing Procurement', 'MSD Biotech Dublin', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of healthcare in Ireland', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do. We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD BIOTECH, DUBLIN', 'The latest addition to the MSD Ireland family is MSD Biotech, Dublin.  The site will play a pivotal role in the manufacture of MSD’s biologics-based medicines, including in the area of immuno-oncology, and will expand MSD’s current internal network of biologics drug substance manufacturing plants when full manufacturing operations begin in 2021.', 'MSD Biotech Dublin, will be MSD’s first ever Large-Scale Mammalian-Based Drug Substance Facility, with the mission and ambition to manufacture breakthrough medicines from Ireland for patients around the world.', 'This facility will be a significant supplier of drug substances for one of MSD’s key treatments and will also be critical in the future supply of new biotechnology products to its global network.', '& SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES', 'The Procurement Specialist (Biologics Manufacturing) will be responsible for executing strategic procurement projects and supporting the site’s operating objectives.', 'POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES', 'This individual will work with Indirect Category leads within Global Procurement to execute projects at site, working with closely with stakeholders.  They will represent category teams locally - understand supply strategies, execution planning and Global & Local Agreements - describing the benefits of these Agreements to the site and MSD overall.', "They will ensure that all objectives are effectively achieved, consistent with MSD's requirements to ensure compliance, safety and reliable supply to our customers. This individual will also support the procurement aspects of SAP introduction to the site.", 'The Procurement Specialist will have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  The role will require experience in the following areas:', 'Indirect Sourcing', 'Negotiation and Contracts', 'Supplier & Supply Base Management', 'Cost Improvement Project Identification & Execution', 'Process & Policy compliance & that of site stakeholders', 'KPI Target Achievement & Reporting – Working Capital, Diversity, PPV etc.', 'Understanding of Risk & Risk Mitigation', 'SAP knowledge', 'Stakeholder Engagement is a key part of this role. The Procurement Specialist will be required to closely partner with a wide range of internal stakeholders in the establishment, communication and implementation of business goals & strategies.', 'Sourcing Management', 'Ensure appropriate sourcing rigor. Compliance to Source Recommendation Committee (SRC), Supplier Performance Management process and other supply management processes are key.', 'Continuous Improvement', 'Ensure that every supplier relationship is established with the intent of future continuous improvement and manage the measurement & review process to ensure delivery of expectations.', 'Business requirements/cost management focus', 'Must have keen insight and understanding of business requirements on a 1/3/5-year horizon. Must be capable of working with the wider team as well as strategic business partners to drive reliability of supply and cost reductions.', 'REPORTING STRUCTURE', 'The Procurement Specialist (Biologics Manufacturing) will report to the Associate Director (Biologics Manufacturing Procurement Lead).', 'Qualifications', 'QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE - KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS', 'General', 'Professional expertise in Procurement within a manufacturing environment (>5 years), including Indirect Procurement', 'Experience working with senior stakeholders', 'Experience using SAP, SAP implementation experience preferred', 'People', 'This individual needs to be adaptable, working collaboratively with stakeholders.  They need to have strong planning, organization, data analytics and reporting skills.', 'Education', 'Degree / 3rd Level Qualification, ideally in Business, Engineering, Science, Supply Chain or Procurement related area.', 'So, if you are ready to:', 'INVENT solutions to meet unmet healthcare needs', 'IMPACT the future by joining MSD, one of the world’s leading healthcare companies', 'INSPIRE your team to reach their full potential and push the boundaries of science and technology', '*HJDublin', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'MSD is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms / recruitment agencies for this employment opportunity.  Please, no phone calls or emails.  All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at MSD via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of MSD.  No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by MSD as a result of the referral or through other means.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 10 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']
similarJobs: ['Sales Jobs', 'Project Management & Director Jobs', 'Pennsylvania Operations and Production Jobs', 'Information Technology Jobs', 'Human Resources Jobs']
title: Procurement Specialist, Biologics Manufacturing Procurement Job

title: Asso. Pharmaceutical Information Manager-天津-王丽丹 Job

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', "MSD’s Global Human Health (GHH) Division abides by a “patient first, profits later” ideology. Results-driven and ambitious, this team of individuals represents a functional balance between meeting company objectives and the needs of people around the world. The division is comprised of sales and marketing professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing MSD's prescription medicines, vaccines, and other medical products to our customers worldwide.", 'Opportunities such as this one do not come around too often in a professional career.  Once, at best twice, in a lifetime!', 'As 1 of the Top 6 countries for MSD, the UK is positioned to be leading the way for the company in the use of data and analytics to drive business innovation and data driven decisions making.', 'We are looking for a', 'Data Scientist', 'who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations.', 'They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.', 'Position Responsibilities:', 'You will be responsible for executing end-to-end advanced analytics/data science projects:', 'Business understanding – capturing and proactively initiating analysis requirements and defining success metrics.', 'Data understanding - identifying and validating sources of data.', 'Data preparation - extracting, merging and cleaning data from a variety of sources.', 'Data visualisation & modelling.', 'Communicating clear recommendations and action plans to stakeholders.', 'Having the skills needed to exploit the data and managing the issues of data privacy and security. Leverage high technical skill and ability to support the development of innovative data solutions which can differentiate and drive growth for MSD.', 'Key Activities:', 'Promotional Effectiveness, Sensitivity and ROI Modelling, Multi-channel Strategy Analysis.', 'Innovative Segmentation and Targeting techniques, customer and geography restructures.', 'Customer Intelligence to understand the needs and Priorities for the NHS.', 'Sub-National Business Tool Management, analysis, including potential customer engagement.', 'Qualifications', 'Skills &', 'Experience:', 'A postgraduate degree in a numerate discipline and a minimum of 2 years working in a hands-on technical analytics/data science role within a customer data analytics team would be beneficial though not essential.', 'Demonstrable end-to-end analytics / data science project lifecycle experience with a track record in being able to spot opportunities and drive them through to delivery.', 'Passionate about analytics / data science. Up-to-date with the latest developments. A desire and ability to research and pick up new tools and techniques quickly is essential.', 'Some Experience in running various methods like Regression, Random forest, k-NN, k-Means, boosted trees, SVM, Neural Network, text mining, NLP, statistical modelling, data mining, exploratory data analysis, statistics (hypothesis testing, descriptive statistics).', 'Experience of manipulating large quantities of high-dimensional data. Ability to extract, clean, and combine data from a variety of sources and ensure high levels of data quality.', 'Ability to build predictive models and customer segmentations. Solid understanding of machine learning techniques.', 'Ability to communicate findings and recommendations clearly at all levels of the organisation.', 'Strategic Thinking – Support the delivery of the MSD analytics strategy working alongside the Data Solutions Team Manager, by providing high quality data and analytical solutions.', 'Interpersonal requirements:', 'Highly effective and confident communicator with the ability to influence outcomes at all levels of the business.', 'Teamwork is crucial. To be truly successful, you will need to navigate a complex matrix, build meaningful relationships along the way, ask for help, and offer help to others. You will be part of a highly collaborative UK & Ireland HR team, and as such you will work across site and country boundaries on key HR initiatives.', 'Strong leadership skills.', 'Resilient and can demonstrate that you embrace challenges, with tenacity to always do the right thing, while driving the business forward.', 'Embraces diversity and has professional experience in working in different places, different industries and different geographies.', 'Ability to form impactful and trusted partnerships across the network and ensure sustained, fruitful and meaningful collaboration with all relevant stakeholders.', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'MSD is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms / recruitment agencies for this employment opportunity.  Please, no phone calls or emails.  All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at MSD via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of MSD.  No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by MSD as a result of the referral or through other means.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 20 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

title: Data Scientist Job

description: ['Mit seinen verschreibungspflichtigen Arzneimitteln, Impfstoffen, Biologika, Präparaten zur Selbstmedikation und für die Tiergesundheit in verschiedenen Therapiebereichen bietet MSD in mehr als 140 Ländern umfassende und innovative Lösungen für Gesundheit. Ein besonderes Anliegen von MSD ist darüber hinaus die Verbesserung der weltweiten Gesundheitsversorgung und der verbesserte Zugang zu Medikamenten. Dafür engagiert sich MSD in weitreichenden Gesundheitsprogrammen und Partnerschaften.', 'Die Burgwedel Biotech GmbH ist eine Tochter des international tätigen Pharmaunternehmens MSD.', 'In unserem Impfstoffwerk in Großburgwedel/Hannover arbeiten rund 240 Mitarbeiter und stellen eine breite Palette hochwertiger Veterinärimpfstoffe zur Prophylaxe/Kontrolle von Krankheiten bei Nutz- und Heimtieren für den weltweiten Bedarf her. Des Weiteren wurden jüngst große Investitionen getätigt, um auf einer neuen Impfstoffproduktionslinie eine Vakzine zur Prophylaxe einer humanen Seuche zu fertigen.', 'Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Unterstützung durch eine/n:', 'Manager Blend (m/w/d)', 'Aufgaben der Stelle:', 'Führung und Motivation des Teams durch eine lebendige Feedbackkultur', 'Verantwortliche Führung und Weiterentwicklung der Mitarbeiter unter Einbeziehung einer modernen und transparenten Kommunikationskultur', 'Coaching & Mentoring der Direct Reports durch gezielte Entwicklungsprogramme', 'Terminierung und Koordinierung sowie Durchführung der Produktion entsprechend dem Produktionsbedarf in Absprache mit dem Supply Chain Management unter Berücksichtigung von GMP-und EHS-Standards sowie Qualitätsanforderungen', 'Bearbeitung und Prüfung der Herstelldokumente. Organisation und Durchführung von Schulungen gemäß GMP', 'Verantwortung für die termingerechte Bearbeitung von GMP-relevanten Dokumenten und -Prozessen, wie z.B. NOE/Deviations; Corrective and Preventive Actions (CAPAs), (Monitoring) Out of Specifications (MOOS), Erstellung und Aktualisierung von SOPs, sowie deren Nachverfolgung', 'Sicherstellen der Einhaltung der Compliance-Anforderungen aus GMP- und EHS-Bereichen', 'Kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Prozesse/Arbeitsabläufe sowie Sicherstellung der Erfüllung von GMP und Qualitätsanforderungen', 'Qualifications', 'Naturwissenschaftliches / biotechnologisches Studium bzw. einschlägige Berufsausbildung als Laborant/in; mind. 5-jährige Erfahrung in der Produktion, bevorzugt im Bereich Formulierung von Impfstoffen', 'Moderner Führungsstil erwünscht', 'Gute Basiskenntnisse in Projektmanagement, wissenschaftliche Problemlösung und kontinuierliche Verbesserung; Lean Six Sigma Methodologie von Vorteil', 'Hervorragende GMP-Kenntnisse, sehr gute technische Kenntnisse bezogen auf Produktionsprozesse und Equipment', 'Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse (technisch/wissenschaftlich) in Wort und Schrift', 'Gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit MS Office Anwendungen; SAP von Vorteil', 'Ergebnisorientiertes Arbeiten, kommunikationsstark und teamorientiert', 'Wir haben Ihr Interesse geweckt und Sie möchten Teil einer wachsenden und sich entwickelnden Organisation werden? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Lebenslauf, Motivationsschreiben, Zeugnisse) über unsere Karriereseite.', 'Ihre Rolle bei MSD ist von entscheidender Bedeutung, um der Welt dabei zu helfen, neue Durchbrüche zu erzielen, die kommende Generationen betreffen. Wir zählen auf Ihre Fähigkeiten und Ihren Erfindungsreichtum, um einen bedeutsamen Beitrag zum weltweiten medizinischen Fortschritt zu leisten. Bei MSD erfinden wir fürs Leben.', 'Personalberatungsvertreter, bitte sorgfältig lesen:', 'MSD akzeptiert keine unaufgeforderte Unterstützung von Personalberatungen für diese Beschäftigungsmöglichkeit. Bitte keine Anrufe oder E-Mails. Alle Lebensläufe, die von Personalberatungen per E-Mail, im Internet oder in irgendeiner Form und/oder Methode an einen Mitarbeiter von MSD gesendet werden, ohne dass eine gültige schriftliche Vermittlungsvereinbarung für diese Position besteht, gelten als alleiniges Eigentum von MSD. Für den Fall, dass der Bewerber von MSD aufgrund der Verweisung oder auf andere Weise eingestellt wird, wird keine Gebühr gezahlt.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ["This position performs MSD's public affairs function (internal/external) by building awareness and enhancing reputation of MSD in the Philippines (corporate communications) as well as increasing and improving visibility of key growth drivers (product communications) in the public.", 'Key Responsibilities', 'Corporate Reputation and Branding', 'Drive positive coverage of MSD in the Philippines by creating and implementing public relations (PR) plan to enhance the reputation and image of the company harping on its innovation, culture, and partnership programs.', 'Product Communications', 'Coordinate with different MSD internal stakeholders, primarily marketing, sales and customer solutions, in implementing a PR plan aligned to the company’s disease priority areas and key products to create opportunities for brand awareness through relevant media engagement opportunities.', 'Media Relations', 'Map and establish business relationships with key stakeholders, opinion leaders and influencers in traditional and digital media through ethical engagement practices, to have MSD in the Philippines as top of mind and credible partner in delivery of up to date health information.', 'Internal Communications', 'Develop and implement a comprehensive strategy for continuous and effective communications to employees focused on business integration and culture change to improve employee engagement.', 'Qualifications', 'Job Qualifications', 'Education:', 'Bachelor degree in mass communications / journalism / advertising; science or business related courses may be considered', 'Experience:', '-Three (3) years’ experience in a corporate affairs or marketing function in the pharmaceutical industry', '-Knowledge and experience in public relations, stakeholder mapping and management, web development and content writing, digital marketing, project management is an advantage', '-Previous engagements relative to function with government agencies and officials, policymakers, KOLs, civil society organizations and patient groups is a plus', '-Position calls for an outgoing proactive person with excellent interpersonal skills and has familiarity of the media environment in the Philippines', '-Should be able to work both independently and cross functionally across MSD', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 50 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['De afdeling', 'De afdeling Down Stream Processing (DSP) is met ongeveer', '105 medewerkers verantwoordelijk voor purificatie (zuivering) binnen Biotech.', 'We maken zowel commerciële producten als materiaal voor klinische studies. Onze', 'productie vindt plaats in onze state of the art fabrieken onder Good', 'Manufacturing Practice (GMP). Begin 2012 is een nieuw deel van onze fabriek in', 'gebruik genomen.', 'De positie', 'Je maakt deel uit van het Contamination Control Team', 'binnen DSP wat er op gericht is de kwaliteit van de productie-omgeving zoveel', 'mogelijk te verbeteren en te controleren met monsternames. De Operator', 'Monstername & Omgevingsmonitoring is verantwoordelijk voor de uitvoering', 'van omgevings- en watermonitoring binnen een GMP grade D, C en B', 'gekwalificeerde productie omgeving. Binnen DSP zijn EM samplers ook betrokken', 'bij een productafvulprocess voor het nemen van omgevingsmonsters en monsters', 'van personen. Buiten monstername om zijn er nog mogelijkheden om als Operator', 'Monstername & Omgevingsmonitoring monstername te plannen, resultaten in het', 'global LIMS in te voeren en ondersteuning te bieden voor trend rapportages en', 'onderzoeken bij afwijkingen.', 'De volgende taken maken onderdeel uit van de functie van Operator', 'Monstername & Omgevingsmonitoring:', 'Monitoringswerkzaamheden:', 'Watermonitoring', 'Microbiologische', 'luchtmetingen', 'Microbiologische', 'oppervlakte metingen', 'Lucht', 'deeltjes metingen', 'Afvulprocess:', 'personen monitoring van handschoenen', 'Documentatie', 'van activiteiten in logboeken van ruimtes en apparatuur', 'Loggen en', 'voorbereiding van monsters in global LIMS systeems', 'Loggen van', 'monitoringsdata', 'Ondersteuning', 'aan trendrapportages', 'Ondersteuning', 'aan verbeterprojecten en onderzoeken bij afwijkingen', 'Ploegen en tijden', 'Deze functie van Operator Monstername &', 'Omgevingsmonitoring zal deelnemen in een dagdienst', 'Qualifications', 'Benodigde kwalificaties & ervaring', 'Afgeronde MBO of Vapro B/C opleiding, bij voorkeur gericht in      (micro)-biologie, productieprocessen of analetiek', 'Kan goed samenwerken in team verband', 'Heeft affiniteit met nauwkeurig werken met bewustzijn voor besmetting', 'Kan omgaan met wijzigingen in geplande werkzaamheden (flexibiliteit)', 'Kennis en/of ervaring met cleanroom hygiène en microbiologie is een      pré', 'Kennis van cGMP is een pré', 'Goede schriftelijke en mondelinge communicatie', 'Percentage in dienst 100 %', 'Over MSD', 'Het MSD van vandaag is wereldleider op het gebied van gezondheidszorg en werkt mee aan een gezonde wereld. Met onze geneesmiddelen, vaccins, biologische therapieën en ondersteunende diensten bieden we innovatieve behandelingen voor een betere gezondheid van mensen en dieren in meer dan 140 landen. We zijn actief betrokken bij een betere toegang tot de gezondheidszorg. Dat doen we met uitgebreid beleid, programma’s en samenwerkingsverbanden. Bij MSD in Nederland werken ongeveer 4500 medewerkers op drie verschillende hoofdlocaties.', 'Voor meer informatie ga naar', 'msd.nl/werkenbijmsd/', 'MSD als werkgever', 'Keer op keer nieuwe uitdagingen aangaan, dat is wel iets wat je leuk moet vinden als je bij MSD aan de slag wilt. Want continu verbeteren is een van onze drijfveren. Dat geldt zowel voor werkprocessen als voor medewerkers. Gedrevenheid, teamwork en eigen initiatief zijn van groot belang. Bij MSD kun je je op allerlei manieren ontwikkelen. In de diepte, door je te specialiseren in je vak. Maar ook door jezelf te verbreden en door te groeien naar een leidinggevende functie. Internationaal of juist heel lokaal, er zijn talloze andere mogelijkheden om stappen te zetten in je loopbaan, te rouleren in functies of te groeien in je functie. Werken bij MSD is werken in een dynamische high tech omgeving van internationale allure, die toch sterk lokaal geworteld is in Oss, Haarlem en Boxmeer.', 'Informatie:', 'Voor meer informatie betreffende deze vacature, neem contact op met Jan-Jaap Schot, Contamination Control Manager DSP, via 06-54 34 76 70.', 'Solliciteren', 'Als je interesse hebt in deze interessante rol nodigen we je van harte uit om online te solliciteren door middel van het indienen van je CV en motivatiebrief.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'Do you want to help MSD become the world’s best health care company – while opening the doors to exciting, international career opportunities for yourself? Do you dream of a job where you manage your own time, and where your efforts make a tangible difference to the lives of real people? Do you relish the opportunity to have a high level of responsibility and be a part of a strong and diverse team of sales professionals? Then you could be our new Regional Account Manager for MSD’s activities in Tampere region!', 'As a Regional Account Manager you will be the primary point of contact responsible for managing a regional strategic business relationship with the assigned Accounts in Tampere area. You will contribute to MSD’s overall portfolio business performance and will be accountable for business relationship and customer experience with by identifying needs, co-developing, implementing and following up on customer solutions.', 'The Regional Account Manager is a strategic and a very cross-functional role that works in close co-operation with Medical Affairs, Market Access, Policy and Commercial (or business) departments.', 'You are a valued partner to our customers', 'In the Regional Account Manager role you will be responsible for Market and Customer Understanding and Analysis, Account Plan Development, Implementation and Tracking, Integrated Account Team Management and Tender Management.', 'Your responsibilities will include:', 'Identifying emerging or accelerating market -trends and relevant insights to drive growth opportunities with Top and Key Customers', 'Developing an in-depth understanding of the Key Account’s unmet and evolving needs and deducting Implications integrating full MSD portfolio.', 'Understanding the decision-making from funding and market access point of view, logistical, tendering and contracting processes within the Account.', 'Defining, presenting and validating Account objectives and KPIs with relevant business stakeholders.', 'Developing a Customer Plan that contains a thorough understanding of the Customer(s)’ goals and needs as well as considers competitive and business challenges.', 'Defining a tailored MSD value proposition linked to Customer needs using a cross-franchise approach.', 'Developing long-term customer-centric strategies that will appropriately grow revenue, market share and portfolio penetration while also building our reputation through professional engagement and partnerships with key decision-makers.', 'Developing and maintaining long-term engagements with customers/stakeholders within the Key Accounts that are responsible for the “business” side of the account (e.g. Clinic Budget Owners, Directors of Pharmacy, Senior Procurement Managers, Board of Expensive Drugs, Business Development Managers, and Hospital management (CEO, CFO and COOs)) and municipality.', 'Serving as primary MSD interface for all products and services to the business-end of the Key Account – coordinating the efforts of all other functions/divisions towards the account.', 'Your geographic coverage will be Tampere region, but you can be based in either Helsinki or Tampere area. Around 60% of time will be spent in the field with customers', 'You will report to the Head of Strategic Accounts in Finland.', 'Qualifications', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 50 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'Cancer is one of the most significant global health challenges today, representing one of the world’s most urgent unmet medical needs.', 'At MSD, our goal is to translate breakthrough science into biomedical innovations to help people with cancer worldwide. For our Oncology division, helping people fight cancer is our passion, supporting accessibility to our cancer medicines is our commitment, and pursuing research in immuno-oncology is our focus to potentially bring new hope to people with cancer.', 'MSD is focused on advancing innovative molecules that harness the power of the immune system to fight cancer. MSD is making considerable investments in the field of immuno-oncology and is committed to accelerating every aspect of development and commercialization in order to bring our innovative investigational medicines to patients around the world.', 'As a global healthcare company, MSD’s role is first and foremost to discover and develop breakthrough medicines and vaccines that address unmet medical needs. We also recognize that we have a role to play – in partnership with other key stakeholders – in helping to ensure our products are accessible and affordable to those in need. Through access to care, partnerships with the community and expansion of our capabilities, we want to help as many people with cancer as possible.', 'Position Overview', 'The Key Account Manager (KAM) is responsible for MSD Oncology portfolio key accounts within a specified geography.', 'KAMs understand and works with customers and stakeholders who determine whether MSD’s Oncology Portfolio is prescribed, the process to gain access within each account and the brand priorities required to growth', 'Partners with key customers, builds sustainable relationships and levers customer insights to develop strategies and solutions to address unmet and/or evolving needs within the Oncology therapeutic area.', 'Implements both short-term tactical plan as well as a strategic, long-term business oriented approach in key accounts', 'KAMs also work with relevant internal stakeholders to support access and sales growth', 'Key Activities', 'Account Understanding & Analysis', 'Understand brand priorities and needs relative to each cccount and the healthcare environment.', 'Understand the decision-making process to gain access for MSD Oncology products in the Accounts', 'Identify customers & stakeholders; understand their perspective on MSD, our competitors, the healthcare environment and their unmet and evolving needs within the therapeutic area', 'Levers the above insights to identify collaborative opportunities within key accounts', 'Account Plan Development', 'Develop a prioritised business plan to maximise the uptake of MSD products across the territory, including prioritised key account plans & tracking metrics; including short and long term opportunities', 'Provide accurate, up to date local intelligence and feedback through Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and as required to Management and local Area Teams to support MSD plans', 'Identify how to leverage cross-functional internal resource to support accounts', 'Account Plan Implementation & Tracking', 'Develop & maintain long-term engagements with customers and stakeholders within accounts', 'Co-ordinate the efforts of relevant internal functions to support access to MSD’s Oncology Portfolio within key accounts', 'Promotes MSD Oncology brands as required to key prescribers, decision makers, influencers, commissioners & providers across each account. Utilise approved resources to engage customers effectively and drive sales growth', 'Engage customers as required to develop treatment and/or disease specific protocols and drive implementation of these protocols across the relevant territory/area', 'Present and interpret health economic data to appropriate audiences to demonstrate cost effectiveness & value of MSD products, using advocacy & marketing resources', 'Allocate resources appropriately, track account performance indicators, and accurately record information as required.  Adjust plans and activities as required', 'Qualifications', 'Knowledge/Experience/Education', 'Preferred:', 'Degree in Science or Business or other relevant subject/field', '3+ years working in a customer facing role in the Healthcare Industry', 'Internal applicants current role to be position at least at a S2 positioning on the career pathway or equivalent', 'Knowledge of therapeutic area and NHS payor, procurement, local organisations and stakeholders in the area', 'Previous success in gaining protocols/formularies/clinical guidelines for products in the hospital sector', 'Understanding of MSD’s service & support offerings', 'Strong understanding of key business planning principles, metrics and their application', 'Required Competencies & Behaviours', 'Strategic Thinking', ': able to visualize the way forward, identifying opportunities that add value to the work, to the business and to our customers.', 'Market Management', ': understands customer’s business climate; assess overall market potential; and identifies and prioritises opportunities which support the development of the territory business plan to achieve business results.', 'Account Management:', 'understands multiple interdependencies within an account; considers customer goals and needs;  maximizes account performance and provide value-based offerings by building long term relationships through collaborative business planning processes and approaches.', 'Collaboration & Working Across Boundaries', ': understands differing perspectives and works together to achieve common goals; bridging boundaries across teams for both external and internal stakeholders.', 'Advanced Communication Skills', ': plans and delivers ideas and information to others in a clear and impactful manner.', 'Advanced Customer Engagement', ': identifies and appropriately builds and maintains long term, sustainable relationships with customers, external stakeholders and key influencers through a variety of relationship-building approaches.  Demonstrates in-depth knowledge of the customer’s evolving needs, and is able to effectively navigate the customer’s political, social and economic environment  to drive long term sustainable results.', 'Advanced Sales Acumen', ': builds trust with customers and demonstrates valin in the selling situations to deliver high quality engagements and interactions that deliver products and/or solutions with the common goals of improving health outcomes', 'Product & Disease Knowledge', ': ability to demonstrate in-depth knowledge of therapeutic area, products and competitors; and is able to translate this knowledge into productive communication with internal and external stakeholders.', 'Ethics & Integrity', ': adheres to the highest standards of trustworthy and ethical behaviour in all interactions and holds others to the same standards; complies with all laws and regulations.', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'MSD is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms / recruitment agencies for this employment opportunity.  Please, no phone calls or emails.  All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at MSD via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of MSD.  No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by MSD as a result of the referral or through other means.', 'Other Locations:', 'London, England, GB', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 100 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Mit seinen verschreibungspflichtigen Arzneimitteln, Impfstoffen, Biologika, Präparaten zur Selbstmedikation und für die Tiergesundheit in verschiedenen Therapiebereichen bietet MSD in mehr als 140 Ländern umfassende und innovative Lösungen für Gesundheit. Ein besonderes Anliegen von MSD ist darüber hinaus die Verbesserung der weltweiten Gesundheitsversorgung und der verbesserte Zugang zu Medikamenten. Dafür engagiert sich MSD in weitreichenden Gesundheitsprogrammen und Partnerschaften.', 'Die Burgwedel Biotech GmbH ist eine Tochter des international tätigen Pharmaunter-nehmens MSD.', 'In unserem Impfstoffwerk in Burgwedel/Hannover arbeiten rund 200 Mitarbeiter und stellen eine breite Palette hochwertiger Veterinärimpfstoffe zur Prophylaxe/Kontrolle von Krankheiten bei Nutz- und Heimtieren für den weltweiten Bedarf her. Des Weiteren wurden jüngst große Investitionen getätigt, um auf einer neuen Impfstoffproduktionslinie eine Vakzine zur Prophylaxe einer humanen Seuche zu fertigen.', 'Zur Verstärkung unserer Produktionsteams an unserem Standort Burgwedel suchen wir ab sofort in Vollzeit und zunächst befristet auf 2 Jahre Produktionsmitarbeiter in der Impstoffherstellung (m/w).', 'Ihre Aufgaben in dieser Position umfassen unter anderem:', 'Aseptische Herstellung eines humanen Impfstoffes auf Basis von adhärenter, tierischer Zellkultur im Labor- und Produktionsmaßstab', 'Aufreinigung und Formulierung des Impfstoffes', 'Dokumentation der Ergebnisse und Arbeitsschritte gemäß der aktuellen GMP-Anforderungen', 'Aktive Mitarbeit am Abweichungsmanagement von Produktionsprozessen', 'Mitarbeit bei Routineaktivitäten gemäß des Produktionsbedarfs (z.B. Raumdesinfektion, Monitoring und Housekeeping)', 'Bereitschaft zur Übernahme von kleineren Projekten, beispielsweise im Bereich der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung', 'Qualifications', 'Als idealer Kandidat bringen Sie folgende Ausbildung und Kenntnisse mit:', 'Erfolgreich abgeschlossene naturwissenschaftliche Ausbildung z.B. zum/zur Pharmakant/in, Biologielaborant/in oder vergleichbare Ausbildung mit Berufserfahrung', 'Idealerweise Erfahrung im Bereich der aseptischen Herstellung, insbesondere adhärenter Zellkultivierung', 'gute GMP-Kenntnisse', 'gute MS-Office Anwenderkenntnisse', 'Eigeninitiative, Flexibilität und Spaß an Teamarbeit', 'Bereitschaft zur Schicht- und Wochenendarbeit', 'Wir haben Ihr Interesse geweckt und Sie möchten Teil einer wachsenden und sich entwickelnden Organisation werden? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen über unsere Karriereseite.', 'Ihre Rolle bei MSD ist von entscheidender Bedeutung, um der Welt dabei zu helfen, neue Durchbrüche zu erzielen, die kommende Generationen betreffen. Wir zählen auf Ihre Fähigkeiten und Ihren Erfindungsreichtum, um einen bedeutsamen Beitrag zum weltweiten medizinischen Fortschritt zu leisten. Bei MSD erfinden wir fürs Leben.', 'Personalberatungsvertreter, bitte sorgfältig lesen: MSD akzeptiert keine unaufgeforderte Unterstützung von Personalberatungen für diese Beschäftigungsmöglichkeit.Bitte keine Anrufe oder E-Mails. Alle Lebensläufe, die von Personalberatungen per E-Mail, im Internet oder in irgendeiner Form und/oder Methode an einen Mitarbeiter von MSD gesendet werden, ohne dass eine gültige schriftliche Vermittlungsvereinbarung für diese Position besteht, gelten als alleiniges Eigentum von MSD. Für den Fall, dass der Bewerber von MSD aufgrund der Verweisung oder auf andere Weise eingestellt wird, wird keine Gebühr gezahlt.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Temporary', 'Travel:', 'No', 'Number of Openings:', '2', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Lab Analyst', 'Ballydine', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of healthcare in Ireland', 'MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'Our Manufacturing Division, is a team of dedicated, energetic individuals who are committed to being the most trusted supplier of pharmaceuticals and health products worldwide. Our facilities, along with our external contractors, suppliers, and partners, comprise an interdependent global manufacturing network that’s committed to delivering a compliant, reliable supply to customers and patients on time, every time, across the globe.', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do. We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD BALLYDINE', 'MSD Ballydine develops and supplies the active ingredients and final formulated product for a range of innovative medicines at its manufacturing and R&D; facilities. The plant, which has been operating in Tipperary for over 40 years, exports to over 25 countries around the world with primary markets being Europe, USA and Japan.', 'Our highly-skilled local workforce of 500 employees is now leading the way in the development of new medicines, including MSD’s treatment for hepatitis C, which is being manufactured in Tipperary for patients around the world.', 'MSD Ballydine’s existing portfolio and future pipeline offers team members the opportunity to operate at the cutting-edge of science and technology, and develop new treatments that positively impact patients across the globe.', 'Full', 'Description', 'of Position', 'The Analytical Development and Commercialisation (ADC) department is responsible for all analytical support to the site.  This involves testing of Raw Materials, Excipients, Components, Intermediates, Drug Substance and Drug product.', 'We are currently recruiting for the position of Lab Analyst in support of these activities. The position reports to the Laboratory Lead.', 'The position offers the opportunity to work with a team of professionals in a modern analytical laboratory using the most up to date technology and quality assurance procedures.  The laboratory operates under Lean principles and employees the use of a wide variety of analytical techniques.', 'Responsibilities', 'Testing of Raw Materials/Excipients/Components/Intermediates/Drug Substance/Drug Product in accordance with site schedules and company policies, procedures and guidelines.', 'Support the introduction of new products to the site', 'Aid in the resolution of issues that may arise during testing', 'Participate in assigned projects.', 'Working at MSD', 'At MSD, we offer the opportunity to work in a challenging, team environment where professional expertise and well developed interpersonal skills are essential. A highly attractive salary and benefits package will be offered.', 'This is a 12 month fixed term contract position.', 'Qualifications', 'Education/Requirements', 'Degree in Analytical Chemistry with relevant experience in a laboratory in the Pharmaceutical Industry.', '3-5 years experience in a Laboratory in the Pharmaceutical Industry would be an advantage.', 'Core Competencies', 'Technical:', 'Relevant GMP standards', 'Lab safety standards', 'HPLC, GC, FTIR, Kf, Wet Chemistry techniques', 'Business:', 'To perform analytical testing with a high degree of precision and accuracy', 'To perform instrument maintenance and troubleshooting', 'To maintain accurate records in compliance with GMP expectations', 'To understand and internalise procedures relevant to GMP operations', 'To communicate clearly and concisely on technical issues', 'Leadership:', 'Analytical chemistry – demonstrated ability in technical elements relevant to Ballydine ADC IPT operation', 'Technical lab skills (precision, etc)', 'Strong aptitude for handling analytical instruments', 'Mechanical and computer', 'Communication - written, oral', 'Team and interpersonal skills', 'Leadership skills', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'MSD is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms / recruitment agencies for this employment opportunity.  Please, no phone calls or emails. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by MSD as a result of the referral or through other means.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'No', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'Senior Specialist – Process Engineering', 'MSD BIOTECH DUBLIN', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of biotech in Ireland', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do, pushing the boundaries of science to discover new medicines that treat the world’s most significant health challenges and benefit patients globally.', 'As one of the world’s leading healthcare companies, we are committed to making a difference. We are now looking for a Senior Specialist to play a pivotal role in the development of our new world-class biotechnology facility in Dublin where they will have the opportunity to help shape the future of biotech in Ireland and play a significant role in the next chapter of our invention and discovery story.', 'THE OPPORTUNITY', 'Dublin, Ireland has been chosen for MSD’s first ever Large-Scale Mammalian-Based Drug Substance Facility. This facility will be a significant supplier of drug substance for one of MSD’s key treatments and will also be critical in the future supply of new biotechnology products to our global network.', 'Construction on this exciting new facility will commence immediately and this is a unique opportunity for the right person to shape, create, build and grow the capabilities of MSD Biotech, Dublin which will support the manufacture of MSD’s biologics-based medicines, including in the area of immuno-oncology.', 'As one of the hires in this ambitious project, the Specialist - Engineering’s role will be essential in ensuring efficient and effective compliant design, construction, qualification, approval and operation of the new state-of-the-art facility during the initial project phase. The successful candidate will take a lead on utilising the latest innovations in technology and automation to create a workplace of the future.', 'THE ROLE', 'Reporting through the site manufacturing and technology head and based at the MSD Biotech Dublin site, the Senior Specialist, Process Engineering responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:', 'Support the design, construction and qualification of the new cell culture installation at MSD Biotech Dublin through to technology transfer and commercialization.
