description: ['About this Opportunity', "MSD is an innovative, global healthcare leader that is committed to improving health and well-being around the world. Our product offering categories include heart and respiratory health, infectious diseases, sun care and women's health. We continue to focus our research on conditions that affect millions of people around the world - diseases like Alzheimer's, diabetes and cancer - while expanding our strengths in areas like vaccines and biologics. We also devote extensive time and energy to increasing access to medicines and vaccines through far-reaching programs that donate and deliver our products to the people who need them.", 'Information Technology Risk Management and Security has become an essential component of the current IT enterprise that provides IT & Automation support to the Pharmaceutical Research, Supply Chain and Marketing organizations. Increased risks in both the information security (e.g. cyber threats, malware, etc.) and the regulated areas have required that we possessing such skills is fully embedded within the IT organization. The enterprise is now dependent on these security and compliance experts for identifying, escalating and remediating such IT Risks in a timely and efficient manner. Also, emerging technologies like cloud, mobility and data analytics require strong IT Risk and Compliance early involvement.', 'As part of the Information Technology Risk Management and Security (ITRM&S;) organization, you will act as a member of the cyber security incident response team, and be responsible for managing and remediating instances of malicious software infection and other cyber security incidents that occur on MSD’s global network and global computing assets. You will also participate in threat and vulnerability management activities. As part of these duties, you will be expected to manage security incidents to the point of remediation and clearly communicate any remediation activities and status to colleagues and/or senior management. You will:', '•', 'Investigate on cyber security incidents escalated from our Security Operations Center.', '•', 'Ability to use log management tools, packet captures reports, data visualization, and pattern analysis to enhance on cyber security incident investigation.', '•', 'Work with our Managed Security Services Partner (MSSP) to respond to monitored threats and possible intrusions and take the appropriate response actions', '•', 'Analyze, escalate, and assist in remediation of critical information security incidents.', '•', 'Cyber Security analysts should have expert knowledge of:', 'o', 'Information security policies and goals', 'o', 'Log analysis and event traffic patterns', 'o', 'Current IT threat landscape and upcoming trends in cyber security', '•', 'Create, modify and review various reports and dashboards from our security solutions such as internet proxies, network behavioral analysis tools, intrusion detection and endpoint security tools such as antivirus and firewalls.', '•', 'Respond to cyber security incidents that occur on regulated environments such as SOX, PCI, GxP and shop floor systems.', '•', 'Assist to maintain/troubleshoot issues with security infrastructure.', '•', 'Participate and present when required in weekly threat management meetings to report on security incidents that have occurred.', '•', 'Make recommendations to strengthen the cyber security posture of our computing environment as well as recommend process improvements and tooling to ensure timely response to future security incidents.', '•', 'Maintain up-to-date security industry awareness and malware trends, and be able to understand how emerging threats may potentially impact the organization.', '•', 'Improve and challenge existing processes and procedures in a very agile and fast moving information security environment.', '•', 'Take responsibility for end-to-end problem and service management, and clear communication of ongoing problem status to colleagues and management.', '•', 'Maintain ongoing collaboration with other MSD organizations and departments acting in a consultative capacity promoting information security awareness, compliance and supporting ITRM&S; policies.', '•', 'Experience working on a follow-the-sun operating model.', 'Qualifications', 'About You:', '•', 'To be successful to the role, you will ideally need to have a Bachelor of Science in Information Security, Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience.', '•', 'Minimum of 3 years’ experience in IT, prefer with 2 years’ experience in information security.', '•', 'Prior experience as a cyber-security incident responder preferred', '•', 'Excellent analytical and communication skills are essential for this role, as well as passion for problem solving, a desire to learn, and the ability to work in a team environment', '•', 'Various general technical skills including knowledge of networking (i.e. TCP/IP) and security product experience.', '•', 'Strong written and verbal communication skills.', '•', 'Experience or familiarity with web content filtering solutions, anti-malware solutions, intrusion detection and response systems.', '•', 'Demonstrate the desire to acquire in-depth knowledge of network and host security technologies and products.', '•', 'Ability to build strong relationships with business and technology stakeholders, self-motivation, personal drive and high energy are highly valuable for this position.', '•', 'System administration on Windows, Unix or Linux knowledge is preferred.', '•', 'Knowledge of other information security related products is a plus.  CISSP, GCIH, GCFA, GREM, GPEN or similar security certification is a plus.', '•', 'Certificate Management Experience with knowledge of enterprise encryption systems, such as full disk encryption, file/folder encryption, sMIME and PKI environments is beneficial.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 10 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

title: Specialist,Cyber Intelligence & Response Job

description: ['We attract, develop and inspire members of Oncology Global Medical Affairs (OGMA) as we continue to build a high-performance team of uniquely talented medical / scientific professionals committed to improving the lives of people with cancer.', 'OGMA mission', ': Rapidly translating the value of our lifesaving innovative medicines for people with cancer.', 'OGMA values', ': Our core values are driven by a desire to improve life, achieve scientific excellence, operate with the highest standards of integrity, expand access to our medicines and support a diverse team that values collaboration.', 'The Oncology Medical Affairs lead for Nordic and Baltic countries Reports to the Oncology lead of the Europe, Africa & Middle East (EURAM) Region.', 'Expectations for the role', 'Leads the development of the medical strategy and drives the strategic and tactical execution of MSD’s oncology, immune-oncology and oncology supportive care products. Development and execution of the strategy is done in close collaboration with the Oncology Business Unit Head and the Market Access Lead and with other local and regional stakeholders.', 'Inspires, challenges and provides direction, prioritizes activities & resources priorities with the guidance of the EURAM Medical Affairs Director Oncology, sets objectives and monitors performance against objectives of the oncology medical affairs team in pursuit of the OGMA mission within the Nordic and Baltic countries.', 'Acts as a role model in the field when it pertains to building solid and meaningful/purposeful customer relationships with Key Opinion Leaders and other relevant local Health Care Community members; seek input & transfer knowledge about MSD products and their utilization in the Nordic and Baltic countries and drives (internal & external) decision making and progress of projects that improve the lives of people with cancer.', 'Number of direct reports:', '7, total number of people around 17-18 across 7 different markets and evolving', 'Qualifications', 'Minimum Educational Requirements', ': Pharmacist, Medical Doctor, PhD in a Life-Science', 'Core Competencies:', 'Relevant leadership experience is a plus. Leadership skills are a must: fosters collaboration, builds talents by inspiring & eloquently expressing vision, prioritizing & giving direction, capable of rapid & disciplined decision maker, acts with courage & candor, drives results and demonstrates ethics and integrity.', 'Solid medical skills allowing acting as a role model to the oncology medical team and helping the MSD cross-functional team come up with creative solutions.', 'In-depth scientific knowledge in a specialty care domain, preferably oncology.', 'Excellent communication and people skills, strong customer orientation and great listening skills', 'Team player and action-oriented matrix networker', 'Special Requirements:', 'Willingness to travel (~40%)', 'Fluent in English, fluency in a local language is a plus.', 'The position is available for applications until 31st of March, 2019. You are welcome to apply online.', 'For additional questions to the hiring manager, please feel free to contact Nathan Vastesaeger, Oncology EURAM Medical Affairs Lead at', 'nathan.vastesaeger@msd.com', 'Other Locations:', 'Espoo, Southern Finland, FI; Stockholm, Stockholm, SE; Drammen, Buskerud, NO', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 50 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'Senior Warehouse & Dispensary Associate', 'MSD Biotech, Dublin', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of healthcare in Ireland', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do. We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD BIOTECH, DUBLIN', 'The latest addition to the MSD Ireland family is MSD Biotech, Dublin.  The site will play a pivotal role in the manufacture of MSD’s biologics-based medicines, including in the area of immuno-oncology, and will expand MSD’s current internal network of biologics drug substance manufacturing plants when full manufacturing operations begin in 2021.', 'MSD Biotech Dublin, will be MSD’s first ever Large-Scale Mammalian-Based Drug Substance Facility, with the mission and ambition to manufacture breakthrough medicines from Ireland for patients around the world.', 'This facility will be a significant supplier of drug substances for one of MSD’s key treatments and will also be critical in the future supply of new biotechnology products to its global network.', '& SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES', 'Execute procedures to provide manufacturing with the required materials to meet production schedule.  Including receipt of raw materials/intermediates/components to the schedule agreed.  Supply of Dispensary operations and cold chain shipment of Bulk Drug Substance/samples.', 'Extensive use of COMET to track valued inventory required and use of MES systems.  Demonstrated use of electronic systems, i.e. SAP, LIMS, MES, required', 'Assist the Area Manager in developing best in class solutions for the MSD Biotech start-up warehouse.  Utilizing lean methodologies, Kanban, 5S, standard work, etc', 'Be a “go-to” person in the MSD Swords Warehouse and/or Dispensary, providing key coaching/guidance to less experiences staff members', 'Help in the start-up of the Warehouse & Dispensary Operation, helping the team to support C&Q; activities, developing processes/SOP and giving input in the development of COMET (SAP), LIMS and MES.', 'As needed by the business, perform cleanroom/dispensing operations in the Grade C Dispensing/Sampling suite', 'Contribute to the overall Warehouse/Dispensary strategy for the department, with focus on material supply to manufacturing and participating in wider Warehouse/Logistics activities.', 'POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES', 'Responsible for Warehouse and/or Dispensing Activities activities, such as Incoming Goods Receipt, RM Sampling, put-away, RM Dispensing in Grade C, pick for manufacturing, shipping Drug Substance, etc', 'Link in with planners/schedulers in order to aid the area Manager to ensure that that the area has a steady stream of Process Orders in order to maximize people/equipment utilization.', 'Provide support in order to provide the on-site distribution of materials to key internal customers, i.e. manufacturing, Labs, MS&T;, etc.', 'Work to ensure there is 100% availability of SAP/MES Managed material to agreed schedule with manufacturing', 'Extensive use of key Warehouse/Dispensary equipment, reach truck, VNA, motorized pallet trucks, Downflow Booth, Scales, Drum tippers, etc.  Able to act as SME for this equipment', 'Initiate & promote Continuous Improvements and Process improvement within the Warehouse/Dispensary Operations area', 'Proactively seek opportunities for reduce cost and increase productivity, i.e. reduction in consumable spend, improved scheduling, trusted dispense opportunities, etc', 'Aid in the start up of Warehouse/Dispensary operation for MSD Biotech, developing SOP’s, work practices, shift structures (if applicable), etc', 'perform all Dispensary/Sampling operations requirements as identified by area management', 'REPORTING STRUCTURE', 'Position will report into an Area Manager within the Warehouse/Logistics function', 'There may be a requirement for shift work in this role after the initial c.18months of the project.', 'Qualifications', 'QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE - KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS', 'General', 'Minimum 2 years’ experience in warehouse, dispensary or logistics, in the Pharmaceutical industry or a similar operating industry.', 'Knowledge of and experience in applying Six Sigma and Lean methodologies.', 'Demonstrated change management skills with a continuous improvement focus.', 'Capability to interact and communicate with all levels of operational teams and greater Supply Chain team.', 'The ability to influence decision making in a manner that achieves the best possible solution for the organization', 'Excellent understanding of how a Warehouse operates when required to support a manufacturing facility.', 'Technical', 'Strong knowledge of Warehouse/Dispensary operations, i.e. best in class practices in Warehousing/Dispensary.', 'Clear understanding of all functions in a Biologics warehouse, i.e. controlled ambient storage, cold storage (2-8C), ultra-low storage (-40C) and Cryogenic Storage (-70C)', 'Experienced and trained on reach truck, counter balance truck, VNA truck and motorised pallet truck', 'Experience on use of equipment used in a RM Sampling/Dispensary Operation, i.e. Downflow booths, scales, Fumehoods, drum movers, etc', 'Preference for candidate to have a good knowledge of the overall Drug Substance manufacturing process (Upstream & Downstream processes)', 'People', 'Ability to interact with multiple stakeholders across numerous departments', 'Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a cross functional collaborative environment.', 'Good interpersonal skills, attentiveness and an approachable manner for interactions with inter-departmental colleagues.', 'high degree of problem solving ability and adherence to scheduled timelines.', 'Education', 'Preferably a Level 6 qualification in a related discipline.', 'Strong knowledge of GMP/FDA regulatory requirements, housekeeping, health and safety.', 'Knowledge of validation an advantage but not essential.', 'Previous experience of working within a Known Consignor approved warehouse an advantage.', '*HJDublin', 'So, if you are ready to:', 'INVENT solutions to meet unmet healthcare needs', 'IMPACT the future by joining MSD, one of the world’s leading healthcare companies', 'INSPIRE your team to reach their full potential and push the boundaries of science and technology', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'MSD is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms / recruitment agencies for this employment opportunity.  Please, no phone calls or emails.  All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at MSD via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of MSD.  No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by MSD as a result of the referral or through other means.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 5 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '2', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Voor de Quality afdeling binnen Oss Biotech zijn we op zoek naar een:', 'Quality Officer', 'Over MSD', 'Het MSD van vandaag is wereldleider op het gebied van gezondheidszorg en werkt mee aan een gezonde wereld. Met onze geneesmiddelen, vaccins, biologische therapieën en ondersteunende diensten bieden we innovatieve behandelingen voor een betere gezondheid van mensen en dieren in meer dan 140 landen. We zijn actief betrokken bij een betere toegang tot de gezondheidszorg. Dat doen we met uitgebreid beleid, programma’s en samenwerkingsverbanden. Bij MSD in Nederland werken ongeveer 4000 medewerkers op drie verschillende hoofdlocaties.', 'Voor meer informatie ga naar', 'www.werkenbijmsd.nl', 'De afdeling', 'Bij MSD Biotech Operations in Oss worden actieve bestandelen van medicijnen gemaakt. Quality Intergrated Proces Team (IPT) Upstream is de kwaliteitsafdeling die produktgericht toezicht houdt op de Upstream productie-afdeling (USP). USP is de Biotech afdeling waar actieve bestandelen door het kweken van levende cellen of micro-organismen in speciale reactoren worden gemaakt. Vervolgens worden ze in de afdeling Downstream Processing (DSP) gezuiverd. Het toezicht houden gebeurd door het reviewen van batchrecords en aanverwante systemen en door aanwezigheid op de produktiewerkvloer.', 'Kijk voor meer informatie over MSD Biotech Oss naar bijgaande video', 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yzzdXlQNzYY', 'De functie', 'Rapporterend aan de Quality IPT Lead Upstream ben je als Quality Officer (intern: QIPT Officer Level 1) bezig met batchrecord review en toezicht binnen de produktie en het magazijn. Je helpt daarbij de produktie-afdeling om volgens GMP te produceren. Je functioneert als kwaliteitsadviseur in geval van afwijkingen en helpt om herhaling te voorkomen. Je geeft gevraagd en ongevraagd advies aan het management over kwaliteitsproblemen of kwaliteitsverbeteringen. Dit alles om ervoor te zorgen dat er volgens de GMP richtlijnen wordt geproduceerd.', 'De volgende taken maken onderdeel uit van de functie van QIPT officer level 1:', 'Als onderdeel van Quality on the floor:', 'Uitvoeren van batch record review inclusief acties in andere systemen', 'Reviewen en goedkeuren van logboeken', 'Behandelen van afwijkingen van de USP produktie-afdeling, inclusief het ondersteunen bij correctieve en preventieve acties (CAPA’s)', 'Beoordelen van changes', 'Deelnemen aan kwaliteitsprojecten binnen de afdeling om verbeterde werkprocessen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren', 'Qualifications', 'Afgeronde MBO/HBO opleiding, bij voorkeur in een biochemische, analytische of microbiologische richting', 'Minimaal 1 - 2 jaar werkervaring', 'Basale kennis/overzicht van biotech processen, farmaceutische kwaliteit en GMP richtlijnen', 'Onder beperkt toezicht kunnen werken', 'Goede communicatieve vaardigheden', 'Ervaring met SAP is een pre', 'Ervaring met root cause analyse of technisch schrijven is een pre', 'Percentage in dienst 80-100%', 'MSD als werkgever', 'Keer op keer nieuwe uitdagingen aangaan, dat is wel iets wat je leuk moet vinden als je bij MSD aan de slag wilt. Want continu verbeteren is een van onze drijfveren. Dat geldt zowel voor werkprocessen als voor medewerkers. Gedrevenheid, teamwork en eigen initiatief zijn van groot belang. Bij MSD kun je je op allerlei manieren ontwikkelen. In de diepte, door je te specialiseren in je vak. Maar ook door jezelf te verbreden en door te groeien naar een leidinggevende functie. Internationaal of juist heel lokaal, er zijn talloze andere mogelijkheden om stappen te zetten in je loopbaan, te rouleren in functies of te groeien in je functie. Werken bij MSD is werken in een dynamische high-tech omgeving van internationale allure, die toch sterk lokaal geworteld is in Oss, Haarlem en Boxmeer.', 'Wij bieden', 'Werken bij MSD betekent samen werken aan gezondheid in een internationale werkomgeving met toegewijde collega’s. Je krijgt alle ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en te laten zien wie jij bent. Verder kan je rekenen op aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden:', 'Een competitief salaris', '35,5 vakantiedagen', '8% vakantietoeslag en 3% eindejaarsuitkering', 'MSD Incentive (bonus) Plan', 'Een uitstekend pensioen', 'Reiskostenvergoeding (OV wordt 100% vergoed)', 'Interne training- en opleidingsmogelijkheden', 'Informatie', 'Voor nadere informatie omtrent deze functie kun je contact opnemen met Alexander Bijman, Quality IPT manager USP, op telefoonnummer 0412-663245.', 'Sollicitatie', 'Als je interesse hebt in deze functie, nodigen we je uit om online je curriculum vitae en een motivatiebrief te versturen.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Company Introduction:', 'MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where MSD has codified its 125-year legacy. MSD’s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.', 'MSD Business Service Centers ( BSCs), located across three regions (Americas, Europe, and Asia), are responsible for the timely and efficient delivery of standardized, global financial processes. The BSC – AP in Petaling Jaya, Malaysia will be responsible for the execution and delivery of a broad range of financial services and processes across MSD business divisions and markets for the AP region.', 'Role Summary:', 'The Source to Settle (StS) Payments Specialist is responsible for a variety of activities across the Accounts Payable work stream. Payment processing, accounts payable aging and oversight of third parties responsible for executing accounts payable transactions for the AP are just some of the responsibilities. The StS team is responsible for the timely payment of invoices to Third Party Suppliers, Employees and other entities.', 'Key Responsibilities:', 'Primary responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to, the following:', '• Perform a variety of responsibilities within the Accounts Payable department to include but not limited to, analyzing check/wire payments, stop payments and voiding of the companies checks, as well as vendor account additions and changes', '• Perform aged balance AP account research exercising due diligence to document justification for blocked or rejected items as it relates to multiple platforms for payment processes', '• Work in partnership with other groups outside of StS to resolve employee and/or supplier systemic or process issues (e.g. Vendor Master team, StS Center of Excellence, Treasury)', '• Support month and year-end closing activities', '• Maintain files and documentation thoroughly and accurately in accordance with company policy and accepted accounting practices', '• Maintain department controls, policies and procedures', '• Analyze data to propose process improvements and execute implementation plans', 'Qualifications', 'Qualifications:', '• Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance', '• Minimum 3 Years Professional experience in Finance or Accounting Role', '• Knowledge of applicable accounts payable systems, expense reporting, and compliance policy', '• Business Level fluency (oral and written) in Cantonese language required', '• Strong communication bilingual in English and Cantonese, interpersonal, and organization skills required', 'What we offer at MSD?', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At MSD, we’re inventing for life.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Mit seinen verschreibungspflichtigen Arzneimitteln, Impfstoffen, Biologika, Präparaten zur Selbstmedikation und für die Tiergesundheit in verschiedenen Therapiebereichen bietet MSD in mehr als 140 Ländern umfassende und innovative Lösungen für Gesundheit. Ein besonderes Anliegen von MSD ist darüber hinaus die Verbesserung der weltweiten Gesundheitsversorgung und der verbesserte Zugang zu Medikamenten. Dafür engagiert sich MSD in weitreichenden Gesundheitsprogrammen und Partnerschaften.', 'STELLENPROFIL:', 'Die/Der Specialist Retail Channel Management unterstützt den Manager Retail Channel bei', 'Sales Channel Management zur Sicherstellung des Patientenbedarfs mit Hilfe von eIIMS (enhanced Integrated Inventory Management System', 'Sicherstellung der Produktverfügbarkeit im Markt, dabei den Patienten-bedürfnissen auf effiziente Art und Weise gerecht werden, und gleichzeitig unsere gesetzliche Verpflichtung zur Marktversorgung erfüllen', 'Planung des Validated Patient Demand in Zusammenarbeit mit BU, monatliche Überprüfung und Diskussion mit regionalen Funktionen', 'Gewährleistung einer effizienten und einheitlichen Produktallokation für alle Kunden, ohne einzelne Kunden zu diskriminieren', 'Permanente Analyse der Warenströme & Kundenbedarfe', 'Kundendatenpflege inklusive der anhängigen Prozesse', 'Intensive Kundenkommunikation zur Sicherstellung der Aktualität unserer Kundendaten', 'Weiterentwicklung unserer Prozesse im Rahmen der GDP Compliance hinsichtl. Kundenqualifizierung', 'Unterstützung bei der Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung des Apothekenwebshops', 'Pflege der bestellbaren Produkte sowie Preise und Mengen', 'Analyse der Verkaufsdaten sowie Ableitung etwaig notwendiger Maßnahmen', 'Troubleshooting/Kundenanfragen/Kundenkommunikation', 'Erstellung von Analysen/ECC-Berichten (SAP)', 'enge Zusammenarbeit mit OTC, Pharma Mall, eIIMS, EMEA Customer Master Team, Finanz, BU Franchises', 'Qualifications', 'KANDIDATENPROFIL:', 'Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium oder Ausbildung mit einschlägiger Berufserfahrung', 'zielführender Handlungsstil sowie hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative', 'ausgezeichnete analytische Fähigkeiten, sehr gutes Zahlenverständnis', 'versierter Umgang mit SAP (ECC) und Excel', 'innovativ, flexibel und belastbar', 'ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung', 'Genauigkeit, Zuverlässigkeit und Termintreue', 'Standardsoftware', 'englische Sprachkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift', 'Wir bieten', 'Attraktives Gehaltspaket', 'Betriebliche Altersvorsorge plus Entgeltumwandlung in den Chemiepensionfond', '30 Tage Urlaub plus Urlaubsgeld', 'Interne und externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten', 'Flexible Arbeitszeiteinteilung', 'Homeoffice Möglichkeit', 'Mitarbeitervergünstigungen', 'Employee Assistance Program', 'Zuschuss zum Fahrradleasing', 'Kantine', 'Parkplätze für Mitarbeiter', 'Arbeitsfreistellung bei ehrenamtl. Ausübung (20 Std/Jahr)', 'Ihre Rolle bei MSD ist von entscheidender Bedeutung, um der Welt dabei zu helfen, neue Durchbrüche zu erzielen, die kommende Generationen betreffen. Wir zählen auf Ihre Fähigkeiten und Ihren Erfindungsreichtum, um einen bedeutsamen Beitrag zum weltweiten medizinischen Fortschritt zu leisten. Bei MSD erfinden wir fürs Leben.', 'Wir haben Ihr Interesse geweckt und Sie möchten Teil einer wachsenden und sich entwickelnden Organisation werden? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen über unsere Karriereseite!', 'Personalberatungsvertreter, bitte sorgfältig lesen: MSD akzeptiert keine unaufgeforderte Unterstützung von Personalberatungen für diese Beschäftigungsmöglichkeit. Bitte keine Anrufe oder E-Mails. Alle Lebensläufe, die von Personalberatungen per E-Mail, im Internet oder in irgendeiner Form und/oder Methode an einen Mitarbeiter von MSD gesendet werden, ohne dass eine gültige schriftliche Vermittlungsvereinbarung für diese Position besteht, gelten als alleiniges Eigentum von MSD. Für den Fall, dass der Bewerber von MSD aufgrund der Verweisung oder auf andere Weise eingestellt wird, wird keine Gebühr gezahlt.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Have you heard about MSD?', "MSD is an innovative, global healthcare leader committed to improving health and well-being in 140 countries around the world. We continue to focus our research on conditions that affect millions of people around the world - diseases like Alzheimer's, Diabetes and Cancer - while further expanding our strengths in areas such as vaccines and biologics. We aspire to be the best healthcare company in the world and are dedicated to providing leading innovations and solutions for tomorrow.", 'MSD’s Information Technology division partners with colleagues across the business to help serve our patients and customers around the world. Ours is a high-energy team of dynamic, innovative individuals dedicated to advancing MSD’s contribution to global medical innovation by leveraging information and technology to efficiently advance the business by driving revenue and productivity.', 'Information Technology Risk Management and Security', 'has become an essential component of the current IT enterprise that provides IT & Automation support to the Pharmaceutical Research, Supply Chain and Marketing organizations.  Increased risks in both the information security (e.g. cyber threats, malware, etc.) and the regulated areas have required that staff possessing such skills is fully embedded within the IT organization.  The enterprise is now dependent on these security and compliance experts for identifying, escalating and remediating such IT Risks in a timely and efficient manner.  Also, emerging technologies like cloud, mobility and data analytics require strong IT Risk and Compliance early involvement.', 'One of our colleague is taking maternity leave and we would like to have someone help us meet the challenge in her absence.', 'Essential Responsibilities:', 'Information Security policy issuance development, execution and best practices.', 'Assist with defining policy to ensure that MSD employees comply with global laws and regulations, while also balancing the requirements of both an agile workforce and a secure environment.', 'Assist to coordinate policy development with various organizations including the Global Compliance organization, Global Technical Organization, divisional IT leaders, and technical experts.', 'Provide consultancy to stakeholders regarding the interpretation of policy issuances and their implementation.', 'Help monitor laws, regulations, standards & risk to ensure policy issuances are current with the rapidly changing environment.', 'Drive compliance with policy issuances by leveraging ITRMS communications team and automation activities.', 'Assist with influencing the workforce to adopt new behaviours that protect the company’s information.', 'Assist with audit related preparation and remediation efforts.', 'Qualifications', 'Qualifications/ Education:', 'Minimum of 3 years’ experience in IT, audit, legal, information security, or IT Compliance.', 'Bachelor’s degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Business, or equivalent experience.', 'Superior written communications skills.', 'Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills.', 'Ability to work both independently and collaboratively, with different teams across geographical regions.', 'Familiarity with laws, rules and regulations applicable to the Pharma industry.', 'Familiarity with NIST framework, ISO/IEC 27000 standards, GXP, PCI and other industry standards.', 'A foundational understanding of risk management.', 'Knowledge in IT security related to diverse platforms and technologies: Remote Access, VPN, firewalls, Anti-Virus systems, Data Leakage Protection, PKI environments, encryption technology, mobile devices, cloud computing, Windows, Unix/Linux, Macintosh, wireless, PCI.', 'Highly desirable:', 'Professional certifications: CISSP, CISA, CRISC or equivalent.', 'Internal Security Assessor certification a plus.', 'Your role at MSD is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global description: ['Biotech, Dublin', 'Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire?', 'Join MSD and shape the future of healthcare in Ireland', 'INTRODUCTION', 'At MSD Ireland, we are committed to ‘Inventing for Life’ in all that we do. We keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world’s most challenging healthcare needs.', 'THE COMPANY', 'MSD Ireland is one of the country’s leading healthcare companies, having first established here over 50 years ago.', 'We currently employ over 1,700 employees, across four sites in Ballydine, Co Tipperary, Brinny, Co Cork, Carlow and Dublin and, in addition, operate substantial Human Health and Animal Health businesses.', 'In total to date, we have invested $2.5 billion in our Irish operations and our annual turnover ranks us as one of Ireland’s top 20 companies. Currently, our Irish sites manufacture approximately half of MSD’s top twenty products, saving and enhancing lives in over sixty countries around the world.', 'With almost 70,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, you will be joining one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.', 'MSD BIOTECH, DUBLIN', 'The latest addition to the MSD Ireland family is MSD Biotech, Dublin. The site will play a pivotal role in the manufacture of MSD’s biologics-based medicines, including in the area of immuno-oncology, and will expand MSD’s current internal network of biologics drug substance manufacturing plants when full manufacturing operations begin in 2021.', 'MSD Biotech Dublin, will be MSD’s first ever Large-Scale Mammalian-Based Drug Substance Facility, with the mission and ambition to manufacture breakthrough medicines from Ireland for patients around the world.', 'This facility will be a significant supplier of drug substances for one of MSD’s key treatments and will also be critical in the future supply of new biotechnology products to its global network.', '& SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES', 'The project QA USP role is critically important to ensure efficient and effective compliant design, construction, qualification, approval and operation of the new strategic MSD Drug Substance facility. The candidate will be responsible for supporting multiple Quality Assurance strategies, systems and processes for all phases of the project and will report to the Upstream QA Lead. The role will subsequently transition to the site Quality Operations team. Additional development opportunities may also be considered to recognize the tremendous value of knowledge / experience gained by the candidate during the project phases.', 'To maximize the development opportunity, this role may include areas such as Commissioning, Qualification and Compliance covering Utilities, Upstream and Downstream requirements, Deviation and Change Control ownership. In addition, the candidate will be responsible for maintaining cGMPs for assigned areas within the capital project of designing, building, commissioning and qualifying a bulk Drug Substance mAb facility, in conformance with MSD policies and in compliance with cGMPs and Health Agency regulations and all other applicable governing regulations. An expectation as part of the MSD team will be to drive a Quality culture for the site also.', 'The facility will utilize the latest innovations in technology and automation. The candidate will work with a high performing cross functional team of talent sourced from across MSD and the biotechnology industry. Together, the team will build the future of MSD biologics through a Quality culture that delivers unconstrained supply, Right First Time to our patients through an inspired team.', 'The candidate will be actively supported and encouraged to continue their development and knowledge build, incorporating areas to support their future development and ability to continuously improve in their current role.', 'The candidate will provide quality support to the project and site, including training and guidance on the interpretation and implementation of MSD Guidelines / Policies and regulatory requirements.', 'POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES', 'QA support of Commissioning, Qualification and Compliance of Upstream requirements', 'Maintaining cGMPs for assigned areas', 'Review and approval of Master records, executed records, investigations, change controls, SOPs, validation protocols, reports,', 'Provide Quality support to the project and site, including training and guidance on the interpretation and implementation of MSD Guidelines / Policies and Regulatory requirements', 'Participate in internal and Regulatory audits', 'REPORTING STRUCTURE', 'This position will report to the QA lead for Upstream Operations.', 'Qualifications', 'General', 'A minimum 5 years’ experience in Quality Control, Quality Assurance or Pharmaceutical, Vaccine or Biological Operations or Technical Operations', 'A minimum 2 years’ experience in monoclonal antibody manufacturing in one of the capacities above', 'Technical', 'Experience with new product introductions and/or process qualification/technology transfer', 'People', 'The motivation to be an inspiring member of a high performing team.', 'The passion to build the future of MSD biologics', 'The desire to continuously learn, improve and develop', 'A great communicator, decisive decision maker and proven ability to deliver excellence', 'Confidence to direct off-site suppliers to the project, willingness to support the team and a laser light focus to deliver excellence', 'Strong contemporary knowledge of relevant cGMPs, regulations and current industry trends.', 'Education', "Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Chemistry, Biology, Microbiology, Automation, Engineering or equivalent", 'So, if you are ready to:', 'INVENT solutions to meet unmet healthcare needs', 'IMPACT the future by joining MSD, one of the world’s leading healthcare companies', 'INSPIRE your team to reach their full potential and push the boundaries of science and technology', '*HJFeatured', '*HJDublin', 'Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully:', 'MSD is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by MSD as a result of the referral or through other means.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 10 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '2', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD Tiergesundheit arbeitet stets daran, die Gesundheit von Tieren auf der ganzen Welt zu verbessern. Dabei sind uns eine partnerschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und ein tiefes Verantwortungsbewusstsein gegenüber Kunden und Tieren sowie gegenüber der Gesellschaft und unserer Umwelt wichtig.', 'Mit unserem neuen Produktionsstandort in Krems an der Donau wollen wir ein Anbieter innovativer Impfstoffe und Immuntherapien für den Schutz und die Behandlung von Nutz- und Heimtieren sein. Mit dem weiteren Ausbau unserer biotechnologischen Anlagen hat sich MSD Animal Health Danube Biotech GmbH zum Ziel gesetzt, ein bedeutender Arbeitgeber in Niederösterreich zu sein, der in den verschiedensten Funktionen attraktive Karrieremöglichkeiten in einem modernen und sicheren Arbeitsumfeld bietet.', 'Sie sind kompetent, belastbar, zuverlässig, initiativ und unterstützen die Qualitätseinheit in dieser intensiven Start-Up-Phase bei der Entwicklung unserer Produktionsstätte in Krems an der Donau. Ihre Hauptaufgaben werden in der Begleitung und Bewertung von Qualifizierungs- und Validierungstätigkeiten für Ausrüstung, Medien und computerisierte Systeme liegen. Später werden Sie die Qualität in den Produktionseinheiten steuern und bewerten. Die Position berichtet direkt an den Lead Quality Operations.', 'Quality Operations Senior Specialist (m/w/d)', 'Vollzeit, ab sofort', 'Zu Ihrem Aufgaben- und Verantwortungsbereich in dieser Position zählen:', 'Selbstständige Qualitätsbegleitung eines komplexen Großprojektes zur Errichtung einer neuen Herstellungsstätte', 'Überwachung und Bewertung von Qualifizierungs- und Validierungstätigkeiten inklusive FAT/SAT und IQ/OQ/PQ-Studien an neu zu errichtenden hochinstrumentierten und automatisierten Anlagen', 'Selbstständige Begleitung, Überwachung und Bewertung der Validierung der dazugehörigen computerisierten Systeme (Prozessleitsysteme)', 'Nach Abschluss der Projekte Übernahme von Tätigkeiten innerhalb der Quality Operations Gruppe mit Knowhow-Schwerpunkt Prozesse und Systeme in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Produktionsleiter zur Sicherstellung des Quality Oversights am Standort', 'Bewertung von Risiken in Prozessen sowie Abweichungsmanagement', 'Erstellung und Review von Verfahrensanweisungen zur Beschreibung der relevanten Prozesse', 'Vorstellung der Qualifizierung und Validierung in Inspektionen und Audits', 'Qualifications', 'Für diese Tätigkeit bringen Sie folgende Voraussetzungen mit:', 'Naturwissenschaftlich-technische Ausbildung, z.B. HTL, FH', 'Mindestens 5 Jahre Pharmaerfahrung im Bereich der Qualifizierung von Ausrüstung sowie der Validierung und Inbetriebnahme von komplexen computerisierten Systemen', 'Zusätzliche Berufserfahrung im Bereich Produktion oder Qualitätssicherung in der pharmazeutischen Industrie ist von Vorteil', 'Systematische Herangehensweise und gute Organisationsfähigkeiten', 'Genauigkeit, Vielseitigkeit, Termintreue und auch Liebe zum Detail', 'Fähigkeit zur abteilungsübergreifenden Umsetzung der Prozesse am Standort in Übereinstimmung mit den Unternehmensvorgaben', 'Fähigkeit zur positiven Kommunikation mit Mitarbeitern in der Produktion auf allen Ebenen', 'Sehr gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse, erste Kenntnisse in SAP und Anwendungssoftware', 'Sehr gute Deutsch- und verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift', 'Wir bieten Ihnen:', 'Einzigartige Möglichkeit zur Mitarbeit am Aufbau eines modernen „State-of-the-Art“ Produktionsbetriebes', 'Spannende und herausfordernde Tätigkeiten in einer stark wachsenden Organisation', 'Abwechslungsreiche Aufgabengebiete in einem international agierenden Unternehmen', 'Mitarbeit in einem professionellen und hoch motivierten Team und einer wertschätzenden Arbeitsumgebung', 'Höchste Standards hinsichtlich Sicherheit, Gesundheit und Umweltschutz', 'Gute Entwicklungs- sowie Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten', 'Flexible Arbeitszeiten und attraktive Sozialleistungen', 'Das kollektivvertragliche Mindestjahresgehalt für diese Position beträgt EUR 35.235,20 brutto. Abhängig von Qualifikationsprofil und Berufserfahrung des erfolgreichen Kandidaten ist die Bereitschaft zu Überzahlung gegeben.', 'Ihre Rolle bei MSD ist von wesentlicher Bedeutung, um neue Errungenschaften in der Tiergesundheit zu erzielen, die kommende Generationen positiv beeinflussen können. Hierbei setzen wir auf Ihre Fähigkeiten und Ihre Innovationskraft, um einen sinnvollen Beitrag zum globalen medizinischen Fortschritt zu leisten.', 'Personalberatungsvertreter, bitte sorgfältig lesen:', 'MSD akzeptiert keine unaufgeforderte Unterstützung von Personalberatungen für diese Beschäftigungsmöglichkeit. Bitte keine Anrufe oder E-Mails. Alle Lebensläufe, die von Personalberatungen per E-Mail, im Internet oder in irgendeiner Form und/oder Methode an einen Mitarbeiter von MSD gesendet werden, ohne dass eine gültige schriftliche Vermittlungsvereinbarung für diese Position besteht, gelten als alleiniges Eigentum von MSD. Für den Fall, dass der Bewerber von MSD aufgrund der Verweisung oder auf andere Weise eingestellt wird, wird keine Gebühr gezahlt.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Mit seinen verschreibungspflichtigen Arzneimitteln, Impfstoffen, Biologika, Präparaten zur Selbstmedikation und für die Tiergesundheit in verschiedenen Therapiebereichen bietet MSD in mehr als 140 Ländern umfassende und innovative Lösungen für Gesundheit. description: ['Voor de afdeling Quality Control Biotech – Method validation & Transfer (QCB-MVT) zijn we momenteel op zoek naar kandidaten voor de functie van:', 'Senior Laboratory Technician - Biotech', 'Over MSD', 'Het MSD van vandaag is wereldleider op het gebied van gezondheidszorg en werkt mee aan een gezonde wereld. Met onze geneesmiddelen, vaccins, biologische therapieën en ondersteunende diensten bieden we innovatieve behandelingen voor een betere gezondheid van mensen en dieren in meer dan 140 landen. We zijn actief betrokken bij een betere toegang tot de gezondheidszorg. Dat doen we met uitgebreid beleid, programma’s en samenwerkingsverbanden. Bij MSD in Nederland werken ongeveer 4500 medewerkers op drie verschillende hoofdlocaties: Oss, Haarlem en Boxmeer.', 'Voor meer informatie ga naar www.werkenbijmsd.nl', 'De afdeling', 'Quality Operations (ongeveer 120 personen) binnen MSD Biotechnology Operations in Oss heeft de volgende 3 subdivisies: Quality Compliance, Quality IPT and Quality Control. De Quality afdeling draagt er zorg voor dat productie, verpakken, testen, opslag en distributie van onze medicijnen conform een adequaat kwaliteitssysteem wordt uitgevoerd.', 'Voor meer informatie over MSD Biotechnologie Operations, bekijk de video:', 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yzzdXlQNzYY', 'De functie', 'Als Senior Technican rapporteer je aan de manager van de afdeling Quality Control Biotech Oss-Method Validation & Transfer (QCB-MVT). We zijn op zoek naar een gemotiveerde Senior Technican voor de QCB-MVT groep die het werken in een multidisciplinair team in het veld van methode validatie en methode transfers ambieert. Je gaat analytische methoden met technieken zoals UV/VIS, HPLC, UPLC, CE en meer valideren en transferen. Onder jouw hoofdtaken vallen de planning, uitvoering en rapportage van analyses voor methode kwalificatie, validatie, transfer en troubleshooting.', 'Taken en verantwoordelijkheden', 'Uitvoering van validaties van analytische testmethoden;', 'Uitvoering van transfers van analytische test methoden;', 'Protocollering en rapportage van de validaties en transfers;', 'Initiëren van Quality Notifications;', 'Ondersteund van de Quality Notifications processen waar nodig;', 'Uitvoeren van Root Cause onderzoeken;', 'Uitvoeren van troubleshoot activitieiten;', 'Als change Control coördinator uitvoeren van analytische Change Control activiteiten binnen QCB;', 'Uitvoeren van vrijgifte en stabilitets onderzoeken op produkten in ontwikkeling met bijbehorende rapportages, trending, verificatie en goedkeuring van ruwe data;', 'Uitvoering van Second Person Review activiteiten;', 'Uitvoeren van Person in Charge activiteiten (bijv. apparatuur beheer);', 'Uitvoeren van chemicaliën beheer;', 'Verantwoordelijk voor QCB-MVT plannings activiteiten.', 'Qualifications', 'Kwalificaties', 'HLO diploma met enkele jaren ervaring op het gebied van de biochemie, life sciences of analytische chemie;', 'Kennis en ervaring met cGMP;', 'Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring in de pharmaceutische industry;', 'Kwaliteits- en veiligheidsbewustzijn, resultaatgericht, innovatief vermogen en met de regelgeving betreffende methode validaties en transfers;', 'Ervaring met Lean principes, tools en technieken;', 'Kennis en ervaring in het statistisch verwerken van onderzoeks resultaten.', 'MSD als werkgever', 'Keer op keer nieuwe uitdagingen aangaan, dat is wel iets wat je leuk moet vinden als je bij MSD aan de slag wilt. Want continu verbeteren is een van onze drijfveren. Dat geldt zowel voor werkprocessen als voor medewerkers. Gedrevenheid, teamwork en eigen initiatief zijn van groot belang. Bij MSD kun je je op allerlei manieren ontwikkelen. In de diepte, door je te specialiseren in je vak. Maar ook door jezelf te verbreden en door te groeien naar een leidinggevende functie. description: ['For our Global Engineering Solutions (GES) department we are recruiting an:', 'Associate Director/  Senior Project Manager - Global Engineering Solutions', 'Based in Oss (The Netherlands)', 'About MSD', 'MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us. Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.', 'For more information, visit our website: www.werkenbijmsd.nl', 'The department', 'Global Engineering Solutions (GES) is organized in a Technology organization (responsible for the design of projects) and a Delivery organization (responsible for the realization of projects). The GES EU Delivery organization supports the delivery of projects to all MSD sites on the continent of Europe Human Health as well as Animal Health.  With a mixture of experienced project managers, project engineers, cost controllers, schedulers and estimators in co-operation with external partners, interesting projects in a wide range will be managed together with our Technology colleagues through Frond-end loading till Commissioning, Qualification till handover.', 'The position', 'Under the direction of an Area Director, the Associate Director/ Senior Project Manager (SPM) is responsible for the implementation of projects and studies that support business objectives. The Senior Project Manager leads the project implementation activities ranging from early pre-charter activities, conceptual scoping, basis of design, detailed design, cost budgeting and control, scheduling, estimating, procurement, contract administration, construction management, safety, qualification, communications management and project close-out. As part of the role the Senior Project Manager will be responsible for:', '•\tCollaborating with other Integrated Project Team (IPT) members, plant operations personnel and outside contractors;', '•\tMonitoring and appraising the work of suppliers in the preparation of project related deliverables;', "•\tUndertaking studies, applying MSD's Capital Management Process, Lean Six Sigma (LSS) methods and providing consulting to ongoing projects and existing business operations;", '•\tApplying knowledge of scientific and engineering principles, regulatory policies, engineering standards, and practices to optimize design and construction of facilities;', '•\tApplying knowledge of capital project phases to plan and perform appropriate work during each phase;', '•\tIdentifying opportunities for innovative improvements to enhance facility/ equipment/controls design and construction to ensure operational excellence;', '•\tApplying safety knowledge to establish an injury-free work place now and in the future;', '•\tImplementing new technology to improve manufacturing processes and capital asset performance;', '•\tDemonstrating knowledge of best practices and new approaches to design and construction within MSD and across the industry;', '•\tUnderstanding procurement practices and participating in contractor select ion;', '•\tManaging contracts to insure compliance from selection through closure;', '•\tLeading small cross-functional teams to meet project milestones and demonstrating leadership necessary to build and maintain a high performing group of technical professionals.', 'The candidate is flexible in terms of assignment locations and is expected to develop and maintain technical knowledge in the relevant areas.', 'Qualifications', '•\tBachelor’s or Master’s degree in engineering or applicable technical degree (PE, MS, MBA, Ph.D. or other advanced degree is desirable);', '•\tAt least 10-15 years of experience in an engineering and/ or manufacturing field;', '•\tExperience in a pharmaceutical/ biotech environment is highly preferred;', '•\tDemonstrated ability to anticipate and solve problems;', '•\tDemonstrated proactive approach to solving issues;', '•\tDetail oriented with strong analytical and computing skills;', '•\tAbility and willingness to search out for and implement/ realize own business improvements;', '•\tAbility to manage multiple priorities;', '•\tExhibiting sound leadership and interpersonal skills;', '•\tStrong oral and written communication skills in English, Dutch is preferred.', 'A great place to work', 'Our employees are the key to our company’s success. We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program. Our Company’s benefits are designed to support the wide range of goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees, and many of the people that matter the most in their lives.', 'Information', 'For more information about the role, please contact Edwin Hodes, Area Director Oss, Global Engineering Solutions, by phone: +31(0) 6 211 94 241.', 'Application', 'If you are interested in this position, you are invited to apply online by uploading your motivation letter and resume in English.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Yes, 20 % of the Time', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['For our Biological Critical Reagent Hub in Oss (The Netherlands) we are recruiting a:', 'Scheduler - Global Quality, BCR Hub', 'About MSD', 'MSD is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us. Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.', 'The organization', 'The Biological Critical Reagents (BCR) hub in Oss, the Netherlands is part of the Global Quality unit of MSD. The BCR Hub is responsible for maintaining BCR stock levels of all BCRs aligned with the customer needs and manages manufacture, (re-)qualification testing, storage, and distribution of Biological Critical Reagents (BCRs). All activities are according to our Policies, Guidelines & Procedures and regulatory requirements by appropriate oversight and monitoring.', 'For more information about MSD Biotech, please watch the MSD Biotech Oss video below.', 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yzzdXlQNzYY', 'The position', 'The Specialist Scheduler (Planner) directly reports to the BCR Hub Lead and is accountable for the end to end scheduling of all activities related to Biological Critical Reagents (BCRs). The Scheduler’s main focus is to align the inventory of the BCR Hub with the customer needs and therefore has a central position between the customer (global internal and/or external analytical labs) and all other BCR Hub employees who are responsible for the purchasing, manufacturing, qualifying and distributing the BCRs. The Scheduler needs to have a good relationship with the customers and needs to be a good partner for the purchasing department and suppliers.', 'The Scheduler works closely together with the BCR Hub’s Supervisor Inventory Management and Shipment and the Supervisors BCR', 'Qualifications', '.', 'Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:', '•\tTranslating the site BCR inventory, based on remaining stock and/or expiry date, into a BCR activity schedule including ordering, testing and report writing to deliver all BCRs on time;', '•\tTrack the activities against the planning and escalate the activities as needed to the BCR Hub lead;', '•\tEvaluate (global) shipping requests against BCR inventory/ qualification schedule;', '•\tDetermine delivery dates aligned with customer needs and shipping lead times;', '•\tContinuously link into key people from supply chain and customers to predict an accurate burn rate of the critical reagents;', '•\tCollaboration with the other members of the BCR Hub, testing labs, purchasing department;', '•\tAssist other BCR team members as needed with other activities, like shipping, tracking on progression of deviations and/or change controls;', '•\tLead planning & scheduling meetings to support an accurate planning and tracking;', '•\tLeveraging Lean/Six Sigma skills, sequence orders based on standardized rhythm wheels, delivery date and resource loading; Create visualization of work progress at daily and weekly tier meetings;', '•\tEnsure Master Data is up to date in various IT systems;', '•\tServe as project leader or sponsor for key projects/initiatives that are geared toward improving execution within the planning & scheduling or to improve the bullet proofing of delivering BCRs on time.', 'Qualifications', '•\tBSc or Msc Degree;', '•\tA minimum of 5 years of experience in a supply chain planning role;', '•\tContinuous Improvement Mindset, with drive to improve the value chain through Lean/Six Sigma tools and a “go to the GEMBA” approach;', '•\tTangible Production Planning and Supply and operation planning experience;', '•\tAbility to influence and communicate with all levels of the organization from shop floor to senior management;', '•\tStrong team player and can-do attitude;', '•\tStrong written and verbal communication skills (Dutch and English) to ensure proper communication and training to all key stakeholders;', '•\tExperienced Excel user and knowledge of other planning tools like MS project.', 'Desired', '•\tExperience with lean six sigma tools to identify and execute improve the BCR value chains;', '•\tExperience with ERP (preferable: SAP), LIMS, deviation and change control systems;', '•\tProject Management Skills, demonstrated through leadership of small projects/teams;', '•\tUnderstanding of Analytical technique/language.', 'What we offer', 'We welcome you to a truly global, dynamic and challenging environment with great opportunities for personal development. Our benefits are very competitive, and the summary below will give you an idea of what you can expect.', '•\tCompetitive salary and a 3% year-end bonus;', '•\t35,5 days of leave;', '•\tAttractive collective health care insurance package with considerable reduction rates;', '•\tSolid Pension Plan;', '•\tMSD Incentive Plan;', '•\tTravel allowance for commuting;', '•\tNumerous training, coaching and e-learning modules for long term job opportunities and development.', 'A good place to work', 'Our employees are the key to our company’s success. We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program. Our company’s benefits are designed to support the wide range of goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees, and many of the people that matter the most in their lives.', 'Information', 'For more information about the position, please contact Stefan Notermans, Talent Acquisition Advisor, T. 0412 666635.', 'Application', 'If you are interested in this challenging role, you are invited to apply online by uploading your resume and application letter in English.', 'Closing date', 'The', 'closing date for applications for this position is on March 17', 'th', ',', '2019.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['Acts as primary site contact and site manager throughout all phases of a clinical research study, taking overall responsibility of allocated sites.', '•\tDevelops strong site relationships and ensures continuity of site relationships through all phases of the trial.', '•\tPerforms clinical study site management/monitoring activities in compliance with ICH-GCP, Sponsor SOPs, Local Laws & Regulations, Protocol, Site Monitoring Plan and associated documents.', '•\tGains an in-depth understanding of the study protocol and related procedures.', '•\tCoordinates & manages various tasks in collaboration with other sponsor roles to achieve Site Ready.', '•\tParticipates & provides inputs on site selection and validation activities.', '•\tPerforms remote and on-site monitoring & oversight activities using various tools to ensure:', '-Data generated at site are complete, accurate and unbiased', '-Subjects’ right, safety and well-being are protected', '•\tConducts site visits including but not limited to validation visits, initiation visits, monitoring visits, close-out visits and records clear, comprehensive and accurate visit & non-visit contact reports appropriately in a timely manner.', '•\tCollects, reviews, and monitors required regulatory documentation for study start-up, study maintenance and study close-out.', '•\tCommunicates with Investigators and site staff on issues related to protocol conduct, recruitment, retention, protocol deviations, regulatory documentation, site audits/inspections and overall site performance.', '•\tIdentifies, assesses and resolves site performance, quality or compliance problems and escalates per defined CRA Escalation Pathway as appropriate in collaboration with CRM, PLM and RCPM.', '•\tManages and maintains information and documentation in CTMS, eTMF and various other systems as appropriate and per timelines.', '•\tContributes strongly to CRA team knowledge by acting as process Subject Matter Expert (SME), sharing best practices, making recommendations for continuous improvement and providing training as appropriate/required.', '•\tSupports and/or leads audit/inspection activities as needed.', '•\tMentors / buddies junior CRAs on process/study requirements and performs co-monitoring visits where appropriate', 'Qualifications', '•\tMin. 4 years of direct site management (monitoring) experience in a bio/pharma./CRO.', '-\tEducation', '•\tB.A./B.S. preferred with strong emphasis in science and/or biology', '-\tTravel', '•\tAbility to travel domestically and internationally approximately 65%-75% of working time.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', title: Manager, AB/AF, Medical Affairs Job

description: ["MSLs' engagements are based on in-depth scientific exchange in a therapeutic area and often lead to knowledge transfer initiatives and research.  The MSL, in interacting with healthcare professionals and researchers, is governed by the following guiding principles intended to deliver unbiased and evidence based information", '•         Report into Global Medical Affairs.', '•         Have no sales objectives or accountability for prescribing or sales of any MSD product and do not participate in Sales Incentive Plans (SIP).', '•         Discussions between MSLs and Health Care Professionals should focus on bi-directional exchange of ideas on disease related topics, scientific presentations of data in the public domain, and reporting scientific results (e.g. discussion of clinical study results.)', '•         Product claims must be discussed in the context of clinical and scientific exchange, and shall be consistent with prescribing information and substantiated with reference-able data.', '•         Communicate evidence with fair balance, in accordance with company and local regulatory standards.', '•         If unsolicited, responses to requests that necessitate providing information or data that is not within the current product indication, must clearly disclose that the information being provided is not contained within the regulatory-approved labeling and that MSD recommends the use of its products in accordance with its approved labeling.', '•         In response to an unsolicited request for information, the MSL can provide references, abstracts and bibliographies for the specified topics.  The literature and data that MSL use to support their discussions, as a general rule, are peer-reviewed, of the highest quality, and from databases and sites of information approved by the Medical Affairs Management Team.', '•         Slides must go thorugh proper medical review per local procedures prior to use. Refrain from use of corporate product trademark and branding in slide kits, unless expressly approved by Medical Affairs in the specific context used.', '•         Information provided will not be highlighted or annotated by the MSL.', '•         MSLs must not provide materials to Sales Representatives as these should only use materials approved in compliance with the Local Review Guidelines.', 'Qualifications', '-\tstrong scientific baseline knowledge in therapeutic area 1) Clinical doctor in the related TA (bachelor of clinical medicine degree or above) resident level at Tier III hospital (preferred) or resident to attending level at Tier II hospital. 2) Clinical doctor in the unrelated TA (bachelor degree of clinical medicine plus master degree or above) resident level (preferred) at Tier III hospital or resident to attending level at Tier II hospital. 3) Pharmacologist or Biologist (master degree of Pharmacology, or Ph.D degree for Life Science).', '-\tstrong, confident and engaging presentation skills', '-\toutstanding communication and skills and the ability to function within a team environment.', '-\thandling of multiple tasks at the same time and working under pressure', '-\tproactive "can do" attitude and passion for the science related to the products and associated therapeutic area', '-\tstrong customer facing skills, listening skills, probing skills, and flexibility', '-\tcorporate culture competencies of Leader Behaviors, including Business Integrity', '-\texperience within a clinical drug development environment preferred.', '-\tbe able to travel', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

title: Asso Mgr, Oncology, Medical Affairs Job

description: ['•\tSupport Clinical Operations and strategy management by: 1) Responsible for managing clinical research as assigned by the Clinical Research Director to support registration, 2) support local and regional strategy development consistent with long-term corporate needs, and 3) serves local business needs (sign contracts, manage budgets).', '•\tManage talent across territory (e.g. CRA, CPM, CTC) and forecast personnel needs.  Support recruiting efforts (interviews, hiring), conduct performance evaluation, and ensure appropriate training.', '•\tResponsible for compliance with corporate policies, procedures, and quality standards and adverse event reporting requirements internally and  externally. Works with applicable regulators as appropriate to meet compliance requirements.', '•\tWorks internally with PV, Regulatory, and Global Medical Affairs to align on key decisions.  Works with external investigators, vendors, and contractors to ensure consistency across organization. Participates in knowledge generation across industry.', '•\tThis position and the reports have a significant impact on our ability to effectively conduct clinical studies and develop the pipeline, while maintaining local regulatory and compliance requirements in countries. The role requires knowledge of how clinical trials are conducted, strong scientific understanding, talent management skills, and the ability to coordinate with key stakeholders.', '•\tThis position will work under direct supervision of the CRD. Will make decisions independently and oversee important activities relevant to clinical research activities, but will have support from manager in key decisions. Local variation in the local regulatory environments require that the individual can weigh pros/cons of key decisions with input from manager.', '•\tThe role will work closely with local clinical research job roles (CRD, CRA, CAM, CPM, CTC) as well as PV, Regulatory, and Global Medical Affairs internally, and may also work with external vendors and investigators.', 'Qualifications', '•\tMaster and advanced Degree.', '•\t8-10 years of experience for a MS/MBA/JD; 3-6 years for an MD-PhD. Should have strong experience and track record for people management.', '•\tPosition will require strong leadership skills (scientific and business) to maintain top talent in the organization.  Additionally, business leadership and alignment with corporate requires that individual has ability to lead across several dimensions simultaneously.', '•\tStrong scientific and clinical knowledge is required for this position.  Additionally, an understanding of clinical trial planning and management is important.  The role will require strong talent management skills and a proven ability to lead cross-functional teams.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['We are seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic scientist in bioinformatics to join a high-performance team of informatics scientists and data science professionals to further the objectives and reputation of MSD, and to drive drug discovery and development, especially in immuno-oncology area in China and globally.', 'The successful candidate will lead/contribute to a broad scope of bioinformatics/health informatics projects-', '•\tDevelop computational pipeline and analytical tools to analyze, visualize and summarize NGS and other molecular data from clinical trials, preclinical data.', '•\tUse molecular data to identify biomarkers and molecularly defined groups of patients most likely to benefit from individual therapies, with a focus on translating biomarker-driven strategies into the clinic.', 'Qualifications', 'Required', '•\tA PhD (or with equivalent experience) with a focus on Bioinformatics, computational biology, or related fields.', '•\tStrong technical expertise in developing and utilizing bioinformatics analytic tools.', '•\tHands-on analysis experience with large genetic/genomic datasets.', '•\tA background in statistics, including familiarity with mathematics and statistics packages such as MatLab, or R, or SAS.', '•\tExcellent oral and written communication skills in Chinese and English.', '•\tExperience with a matrix environment and ability to effectively collaborate with colleagues from a wide range of disciplines.', 'Preferred:', '•\tUnderstanding of the major concepts of immuno-oncology biology.', '•\tUnderstanding of drug discovery and development processes.', '•\tRecord of publishing in high profile scientific journals.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']

description: ['MSD un des leaders mondiaux de l’industrie pharmaceutique, est présent avec un portefeuille diversifié et innovant sur les marchés de produits de prescription, vaccins et produits de santé animale. Aujourd’hui, nous construisons un nouveau modèle d’Entreprise pharmaceutique – une Entreprise engagée dans la création d’un futur améliorant la santé de tous.', 'Notre capacité à exceller est liée à l’intégrité, la connaissance, l’imagination, la compétence, la diversité et le travail d’équipe que vous pouvez démontrer. Autour de nos valeurs, nous visons à créer un environnement de respect mutuel, d’encouragement et de travail d’équipe. Intégré à notre équipe mondiale, vous aurez l’opportunité de collaborer avec des collègues talentueux et engagés tout en ayant l’opportunité de développer et de diversifier votre carrière.', 'MSD France, recrute aujourd’hui un', 'Responsable Prix et Remboursement H/F', 'Vous intégrez l’équipe Market Access de MSD France, une équipe qui se fédère avec dynamisme et enthousiasme dans la construction de ses multiples enjeux.', "Vous êtes rattaché au Directeur Prix et Remboursement. Vous intervenez dès le développement clinique des médicaments pour répondre aux besoins des patients et de santé publique, puis assurez l'accès au marché des médicaments au niveau national, ainsi que le maintien des conditions de prise en charge tout au long de leur cycle de vie.", 'Poste transverse, vous travaillez en étroite collaboration et coordination avec les différents départements du laboratoire, les équipes de la maison-mère pour mener à bien vos principales missions:', '• Elaboration et mise en œuvre des stratégies locales d’accès au marché, rédaction, coordination et suivi des dossiers de demande de remboursement (inscription, extension ou réinscription/réévaluation) et de prix', '• Elaboration de la stratégie de prix, développement d’argumentaires médico-économiques à destination des différents départements afin de soutenir leurs activités auprès des professionnels de santé et des administrations hospitalières', '• Relation, coordination avec les équipes globale et locales, participation aux équipes projets et rédaction de comptes rendus et de documents de synthèse', '• Veille économique, suivi des grands facteurs d’évolution de l’environnement économique et des contraintes technicoréglementaires et anticipation de l’évolution qualitative/quantitative du marché pharmaceutique.', 'Qualifications', '• De formation scientifique complétée par un Master en Economie de la Santé, vous justifiez d’une expérience professionnelle réussie d’au moins 3 ans.', '• Vous pouvez démontrer des résultats et de réelles compétences de collaboration avec un excellent relationnel.', '• Vous êtes reconnu pour vos capacités d’analyse, de synthèse et d’adaptation dans un environnement compétitif, pour vos compétences rédactionnelles, et pour votre respect de l’éthique et de la compliance.', '• Votre pratique de l’anglais est parfaitement courante et vous permet de défendre vos idées lors de réunions internationales.', 'Nos collaborateurs sont la clé de la réussite de notre Entreprise. Nous leur démontrons notre engagement par nos politiques de rémunération et de reconnaissance avantageuses. Nos avantages sociaux sont conçus pour répondre aux attentes et besoins de nos collaborateurs, en fonction de leurs priorités de vie, mais aussi de tous ceux qui comptent autour d’eux.', 'Other Locations:', 'Employee Status:', 'Regular', 'Travel:', 'Number of Openings:', '1', 'Shift (if applicable):', 'Hazardous Materials:', 'Company Trade Name:', 'MSD']
